title: Luis Severino Has a Rocket for an Arm. The Yankees Arent Afraid to Ride It.
description: When Luis Severino reared back and fired a 98-mile-per-hour fastball past the Tampa Bay Rays slugger Logan Morrison on Wednesday night, the pitch carried with it a degree of symbolism.

title: Marches for Racial Justice and Black Women Converge in Washington
description: WASHINGTON  On the first crisp fall day in Washington, thousands of anti-racism marchers proved that the capitals summer of protests had not yet come to a close.

title: The Mets Terry Collins, Age 68, Can Hear a Goodbye Lurking
description: On the wall behind Terry Collinss desk at Citi Field is a framed display commemorating the Mets victory in Game 5 of their 2015 division series. To a visitor, it seems significant: The game was a one-run thriller at Dodger Stadium, propelling the Mets to a sweep in the next round and a berth in the World Series.

title: The New Washington: Though Out of Power, Democrats Are Winning the Fight, Pelosi Says
description: WASHINGTON  Representative Nancy Pelosi might have retired from Congress had Hillary Clinton been elected, content that she was leaving the government in capable female hands.

title: As Mets Crawl to the Finish, Sandy Alderson Stands Up for Terry Collins
description: PHILADELPHIA  The Mets 2017 season continued stumbling to the finish line on Saturday as General Manager Sandy Alderson told reporters that he was angry and disappointed about two published reports in recent days that had depicted Mets Manager Terry Collins in unfavorable terms.

title: Quotation of the Day: A Day of Struggle Amid the Wreckage of Maria
description: They have forgotten about us.

title: Corrections: October 1, 2017
description: T: DESIGN

title: Stephanie Swensen, John Buza III
description: Dr. Stephanie Joelle Swensen and Dr. John Andrew Buza, III were married Sept. 30 at the Montauk Yacht Club in Montauk, N.Y. Daniel C. Swensen, the bride's brother who became a Universal Life minister for the event, officiated.

title: Kate Abrams, Tzur Peleg
description: Kate Elizabeth Abrams and Tzur Peleg were married Sept. 29 at the Aspen Meadows Resort in Aspen, Colo. Brian T. Abrams, the brides brother who became a Universal Life minister for the event, led a ceremony incorporating Jewish traditions.

description: Kate Marie Mueting and Greg Stewart Roth were married Sept. 30 by the Rev. Karen Brau, a Lutheran minister, at the Old First Reformed United Church of Christ in Philadelphia.

title: Eduardo Varela, Stephen Mellert
description: Eduardo Jaime Varela and Stephen Joseph Mellert were married Sept. 30 at 620 Loft & Garden, an event space at Rockefeller Center in New York. The Rev. Norma Moutal, an interfaith minister, officiated.

title: Victoria Ryan, Leo Lucisano
description: Victoria Jeanne Ryan and Leo Cyril Lucisano were married Sept. 30. The Rev. James E. Devlin performed the ceremony at Holy Name Roman Catholic Cathedral in Chicago.

title: John Pierce, Dominic Decker
description: John Michael Pierce and Dr. Dominic Paul Decker were married Sept. 30 at First Unitarian Church in Providence, R.I. The Rev. Elizabeth L. Maclay, a Unitarian Universalist minister, performed the ceremony.

title: Grace du Pont, Conor Sutherland
description: Grace Hays Holcomb du Pont was married Sept. 30 to Conor Jackson Sutherland in Manhattan. The Rev. J. Donald Waring performed the ceremony at Grace Episcopal Church.

title: Alia Avidan, Edward Conbeer
description: Alia Donnelly Avidan and Edward George Conbeer were married Sept. 30 at Liberty View Farm in Highland, N.Y. Veronica Thew, a friend of the couple, who became a Universal Life minister for the event, officiated.

title: Lisa Rossi, Loren Amor-Radovich
description: Elizabeth Jeanne Rossi and Loren Amor-Radovich were married Sept. 30 in Manhattan. The Rev. Daniel R. Corrou performed the ceremony at the Roman Catholic Church of St. Francis Xavier.

title: Julianne Baker, Aaron Kur
description: Julianne Olivia Baker and Aaron Benjamin Kur were married Sept. 26 at the Manhattan Marriage Bureau. Angel L. Lopez, a staff member of the New York City clerks office, officiated. On Sept. 30, the grooms father, Bob Kur, led a ceremony involving Jewish traditions at Pippin Hill Farm & Vineyards in North Garden, Va.

title: Skating Through Tel Aviv's Empty Highways on Yom Kippur
description: Tel Aviv's roads and highways are devoid of traffic on Yom Kippur, the holiest day of the Jewish year. While many people are at synagogues and at home with family, others explore the quiet on bikes and skateboards.

title: Answer to N.F.L. Viewers Prayers: Tony Romo, the Play Predictor
description: Television viewers first noticed the aberration on Sept. 10, during the first week of the N.F.L. season, when it happened several times before a live audience of millions of people. Then, the following week, there it was again  and then the week after that, too.

title: Jessica Bruckert, Alexander Jordan
description: Jessica Robyn Bruckert and Alexander Huff Jordan were married Sept. 30 on Indian Beach in North Carolina. The Rev. Dr. Thomas Everett, an Episcopal priest, officiated.

title: Sara Smolinski, Lin Zhao
description: Dr. Sara Elizabeth Smolinski and Lin Zhao are to be married Oct. 1 at St. Robert of Newminster Parish in Ada, Mich. The Rev. Collin Mulhall, a Roman Catholic priest, is to perform the ceremony.

title: Elizabeth Wilfong, Thomas Bell
description: Elizabeth Margaret Wilfong and Thomas Bradford Bell were married Sept. 30 at Locanda Verde, a restaurant in the Greenwich Hotel in New York. William Wilfong, the brides brother who became a Universal Life minister for the occasion, officiated.

title: Sandra Hough, Benjamin Masselink
description: Sandra Shoemaker Hough was married Sept. 30 to Benjamin Pope Masselink on Kiawah Island, S.C. The Rev. Dr. Vance Polley, a Presbyterian minister, officiated at the River Course Clubhouse at the Kiawah Island Club.

title: Carolyn Butterworth, Mark Mekhail
description: Carolyn Alexzena Butterworth and Dr. Mark Nagy Mekhail were married Sept. 30 at St. Mark Coptic Orthodox Church in Seven Hills, Ohio. The Rev. Mikhail E. Mikhail, a Coptic Christian priest, led the ceremony.

title: Allison Greenwell, David Affinito
description: Allison Christina Greenwell and David Ralph Affinito were married Sept. 30 at the Harvard Club of New York. Alan Wright, the grooms uncle who became a Universal Life minister for the event, officiated.

title: Stephanie Stiff, Chad Ellimoottil
description: Stephanie Victoria Stiff and Dr. Chad Skaria Ellimoottil were married Sept. 30 at the Alice Millar Chapel in Evanston, Ill. The Rev. Tim Stevens, a chaplain and United Church of Christ minister, performed the ceremony.

title: Britni Rillera, Anthony Lynn
description: Britni Paige Rillera and Anthony Vaughn Lynn are to be married Oct. 1. The Rev. Dr. Darryl D. Roberts, a Baptist minister, is to officiate at the Josephine Butler Park Center, an events space in Washington.

title: Geneva DeGregorio, Raaj Mehta
description: Dr. Geneva Anne DeGregorio and Dr. Raaj Shishir Mehta were married Sept. 30 at the Ritz-Carlton in McLean, Va. Pandit Ram Sneh Tripathi Ji, a Hindu Priest, officiated. Earlier in the day, the couple took part in a Christian wedding ceremony performed by Rev. Judith Fulp-Eickstaedt at the Vienna Presbyterian Church in Vienna, Va.

title: Cindy Hong, Nathaniel Hopkin
description: Cindy Yuanjia Hong and Nathaniel Mark Hopkin were married Sept. 30 at the Prospect House at Princeton University. Judge Madeline C. Arleo of the United States District Court of New Jersey in Newark, for whom the bride serves as a law clerk, officiated.

title: Ivy Cheung, Jarad Mason
description: Ivy Nai-si Cheung and Jarad Adam Mason are to be married Oct. 1. Rabbi Isaac D. Serotta is to officiate at the Ivy Room, an events space in Chicago.

title: Rachel Tulchin, Kevin Bailey
description: Rachel Elizabeth Tulchin and Kevin Jontae Bailey were married Sept. 30 at the Cloister in Sea Island, Ga. Susan Tulchin, a Universal Life minister and an aunt of the bride, officiated, with Dottie Bailey Johnson, an aunt of the groom, taking part.

title: Danielle Sauro, Mark Lloyd
description: Danielle Nicole Sauro and Mark Gordon Lloyd were married Sept. 30. The Rev. Dr. Peter A. Wells, a minister of the United Church of Christ, officiated at Riverside Farm, an events space in Pittsfield, Vt.

title: Johanna Kilbride, Alexander Volpi
description: Johanna Margaret Kilbride and Dr. Alexander David Volpi were married Sept. 30. The Rev. Dr. Peter J. Kelley performed the ceremony at the First Presbyterian Church of Southold, N.Y.

title: David Jacobsen, Justin Cahill
description: David Julian Jacobsen and Justin Thomas Cahill were married Sept. 30 at the Newark Museum in Newark. John Kelly, a friend of the couple and a Universal Life minister, officiated.

title: Gilma Avalos, Bradley Blackburn
description: Gilma Avalos and Bradley Lloyd Blackburn were married Sept. 30 at the Marty Leonard Chapel in Fort Worth. The Rev. Mathew DeBlanc, a Baptist minister, officiated at a nondenominational ceremony.

title: Yasmina Moukarzel, John Giordano
description: Yasmina Marcelle Moukarzel and John Giordano were married Sept. 30 at St. Marks Church in Philadelphia. The Rev. Sean E. Mullen, an Episcopal priest, performed the ceremony.

title: Whats on TV Sunday: 60 Minutes and Ten Days in the Valley
description: Congressman Steve Scalise speaks about his traumatic experience of being shot in Washington. And a new Kyra Sedgwick drama begins.

title: Even in Death, the Spy Kim Philby Serves the Kremlins Purposes
description: MOSCOW  Bereft of friends in Western capitals since its 2014 annexation of Crimea, Russia is celebrating the memory of the British K.G.B. spy Kim Philby, a stalwart supporter who stood by it through thick and thin  and spent the last 25 years of his life in Moscow, often drunk and miserable but still loyal.

title: Marilyn Manson Injured by Falling Stage Prop at Concert
description: Marilyn Manson, the provocative rock star, was injured on Saturday night during a concert at the Hammerstein Ballroom in Manhattan after a stage prop of two giant guns fell on him.

title: Catalonias Independence Vote Descends Into Chaos and Clashes
description: BARCELONA, Spain  Catalonias defiant attempt to stage an independence referendum descended into chaos on Sunday, with hundreds injured in clashes with police in one of the gravest tests of Spains democracy since the end of the Franco dictatorship in the 1970s.

title: S.N.L. Returns: Jay-Z and Michael Che Take on Trump
description: As a viewer, you usually enter a new season of Saturday Night Live like a student coming back to school after summer vacation. You look at the cast members and wonder, wholl be this years homecoming king and queen? And who are these new people, and should I bother to learn their names?

title: At Trial, a Focus on the Facts, Not the Politics, of Benghazi
description: WASHINGTON  Almost from the moment that Islamist militants overran the American consulate and assaulted a C.I.A. annex in Benghazi, Libya, in September 2012, politics consumed the deadly attacks. Using the event as partisan ammunition, Republicans and conservative media outlets sought to make the citys name synonymous with Democratic scandal.

title: Homes That Sold for Around $1.5 Million
description: 135 Beach Avenue, Mamaroneck

title: Reviving the Joy of Decoration at Nikes New SoHo Building
description: I am as devoted to modern style as anyone. I type on an Eames chair, eat with Arne Jacobsen cutlery and rest tired eyes on the colored squares of Josef Albers. But when I step out from my white-cube apartment, I find a different kind of pleasure thats equally thrilling: My New York neighborhood is full of Victorian tenements covered in a riot of decoration, from carved heads and scallop shells to flower garlands and twisting columns that dont hold anything up. I dare anyone to resist their splendor.

title: Through the Lens of the Obama Years, Ta-Nehisi Coates Reckons With Race, Identity and Trump
description: Ta-Nehisi Coatess We Were Eight Years in Power has yet to come out, but its already generated a storm of discussion. The Atlantic ran an excerpt; conservatives went on the attack; George Packer, a highly-regarded and left-leaning journalist who got caught in Coatess cross hairs, issued a rebuttal. A new book from Coates is not merely a literary event. Its a launch from Cape Canaveral. Theres a lot of awe, heat, resistance.

title: Puerto Rico, Tom Price, Catalonia: Your Weekend Briefing
description: Here are the weeks top stories, and a look ahead.

title: Jacques Granges Collection of a Lifetime, Now Up for Sale
description: At 73, Jacques Grange is cleaning house. For half a century, the French interior designer has not only created homes for Yves Saint Laurent, Sofia Coppola, Princess Caroline of Monaco and others, but advised his clients on which art and furniture to buy and how to arrange it in a loose, layered style sometimes called haute bohemian. He plays the role of the sophisticates sophisticate.

title: Modernist Magic in Indiana
description: Some home-building projects start with an itch for more space. Others with a love of customization. One house that lies low and lean across a bumpy patch of Indianapolis began with a run in the woods.

title: Captured ISIS Fighters Refrain: I Was Only a Cook
description: KIRKUK, Iraq  Thousands of civilians fleeing the Iraqi militarys push to evict the Islamic State from its last major urban stronghold in Iraq now include hundreds of suspected fighters for the extremist group, dirty and disheveled, who arrive at checkpoints claiming innocence and begging for mercy.

title: O.J. Simpson Is Freed on Parole in Nevada After 9 Years
description: O. J. Simpson was released on parole in Nevada on Sunday after serving nine years in a state prison on charges stemming from an armed robbery in a Las Vegas hotel room in 2007.

title: The Best TV Shows and Movies New to Netflix, Amazon and More in October
description: Watching is The New York Timess TV and film recommendation website. Sign up for our three times weekly newsletter here.

title: Back at Full Strength, Supreme Court Faces a Momentous Term
description: WASHINGTON  The Supreme Court, which was short-handed and slumbering for more than a year after the death of Justice Antonin Scalia, is returning to the bench on Monday with a far-reaching docket that renews its central role in American life.

title: Givenchy: Spring 2018
description: The label shows its spring looks.

title: Afghan Teenagers Recruited in Iran to Fight in Syria, Group Says
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon  Afghan immigrant children as young as 14 are being recruited in Iran to fight  and die  in Syria, a prominent human rights organization said Sunday.

title: Ancient Egyptian Animals Had a Place in the Afterlife. Heres Why.
description: Doggie day care. Cat cafes. Pet grooming emporiums. Animal memorial parks. Is any population more deeply engaged with its fellow creatures than contemporary Americans?

title: Same-Sex Couples Wed in Germany as Marriage Law Takes Effect
description: BERLIN  Cheers rang out in the City Hall of Berlins Schneberg district on Sunday as two men, who met 38 years ago, when the German capital was a divided city, became the countrys first same-sex couple to legally marry.

title: Balenciaga: Spring 2018
description: The label shows its spring looks.

title: Celine: Spring 2018
description: The label shows its spring looks.

title: Facebook Blocks Chinese Billionaire Who Tells Tales of Corruption
description: HONG KONG  A Chinese billionaire living in virtual exile in New York, Guo Wengui has riled Chinas leaders with his sometimes outlandish tales of deep corruption among family members of top Communist Party officials.

title: Bike-Sharing Is Flourishing in Washington. Can the City Handle It?
description: WASHINGTON  Washington could soon bypass Portland, Ore., as the American city with the highest share of bicycle commuters, due in part to growing competition among bike-borrowing programs, according to census data and cycling enthusiasts.

title: S.I. Newhouse Jr., Who Turned Cond Nast Into a Magazine Powerhouse, Dies at 89
description: S. I. Newhouse Jr., who as the owner of The New Yorker, Vogue, Vanity Fair, Architectural Digest and other magazines wielded vast influence over American culture, fashion and social taste, died on Sunday at his home in Manhattan. He was 89.

title: N.F.L. Anthem Protests: Players Kneel, Stand and Hear Boos
description: A week after leaguewide demonstrations during the national anthem, most teams scaled back on Sunday. Heres a quick look at what each team did in N.F.L. Week 4:

title: Review: NBCs Megyn Kelly Today Isnt Partisan, but Its Awkward
description: America, Megyn Kelly would like you to know that shes kind of done with politics now.

title: Attack at Marseille Train Station Leaves 2 Women Dead
description: PARIS  Two women were killed in southern France on Sunday by an assailant armed with a knife, in an attack that forced the evacuation of a major train station, the authorities said.

title: On Dreamers Deal, Democrats Face a Surprising Foe: The Dreamers
description: WASHINGTON  As Democrats warily prepare to negotiate an immigration deal with President Trump, they face an unexpected political foe: many of the 800,000 young, undocumented immigrants threatened with deportation whom they are championing.

title: What to Cook This Week
description: Sam Sifton emails readers of Cooking five days a week to talk about food and suggest recipes. That email also appears here. To receive it in your inbox, register here. Download the NYT Cooking app here.

title: A Year Later, Trial to Begin in Chelsea Bombing Case
description: Pipe bombs stashed at the finish line of a beachside fun run. Pressure cookers in Manhattans busy Chelsea neighborhood, packed with steel nuts and ball bearings purchased on eBay. Citric acid, fuses, circuit boards. A magazine with articles like Make a Bomb in the Kitchen of Your Mom.

title: Trump Says Tillerson Is Wasting His Time on North Korea
description: WASHINGTON  President Trump undercut his own secretary of state on Sunday, calling his effort to open lines of communication with North Korea a waste of time, and seeming to rule out a diplomatic resolution to the nuclear-edged confrontation with Pyongyang.

title: At a Moment of Racial Tumult, the Little Rock Nine Inspire an Opera
description: CONWAY, Ark.  It was 60 years to the day since Minnijean Brown Trickey and eight other African-American teenagers integrated Little Rock Central High School at bayonet-point, protected by the 101st Airborne Division from racist mobs and a defiant governor.

title: Puerto Rico Is Getting a Surge of Aid, Governor Says
description: SAN JUAN, P.R.  A surge of fuel and food supplies and federal government personnel has begun to arrive in Puerto Rico, the governor of the storm-battered island said Sunday morning.

title: Akris: Spring 2018
description: The label shows its spring looks.

title: A Gray Puff, and the Old Kosciuszko Bridge Is No More
description: Sometimes this city thats always rebuilding carefully preserves the traces of its past.

title: Tom Cruises American Made Plays Second Fiddle to It
description: LOS ANGELES  American Made, an action dramedy starring Tom Cruise as a drug runner, took in about $17 million at North American theaters over the weekend, a bit more than analysts had expected before release.

title: Starbucks Closes Online Store to Focus on In-Person Experience
description: As customers increasingly shift their retail shopping toward e-commerce, Starbucks is bucking the trend: It shuttered its online store on Sunday.

title: In So Paulo, Iconic Building Helps Revive a Blighted Downtown
description: SO PAULO, Brazil  Giovanni Bright didnt dare chat with his neighbors in the elevator when he bought his apartment 31 years ago.

title: Digby Diehl, Collaborator on Memoirs of the Famous, Dies at 76
description: Digby Diehl, a journalist and author who collaborated on celebrity autobiographies with Esther Williams, Natalie Cole, Patti LuPone and more, died on Tuesday in Los Angeles. He was 76.

title: Vehicle and Knife Attack in Edmonton Is Described as Terrorism
description: The Canadian police arrested a refugee from Somalia on suspicion of terrorist acts early Sunday after a police officer in Edmonton was struck with a car and stabbed outside a football game. Four other people were later deliberately hit by a U-Haul truck driven by the same suspect, the authorities said.

title: Valentino: Spring 2018
description: The label shows its spring looks.

title: Europes On-Demand Economy Draws Complaints. And Regulators.
description: Mohaan Biswas was speeding takeout orders to customers in London for the online food delivery start-up Deliveroo when he fell from his motorbike, breaking his foot in two places.

title: Wings of Power
description: WASHINGTON  Air travel is the scourge of millions of Americans, but for officials at the highest reaches of government, crisscrossing the country in custom-built jets can be a top-of-the-line (and increasingly scrutinized) perk.

title: Catalonia, North Korea, Puerto Rico: Your Monday Briefing
description: Good morning.

title: Afghan Forces Killed in Friendly-Fire Airstrike, Capping Deadly Week
description: KANDAHAR, Afghanistan  Culminating a deadly week for Afghan forces in the south of the country, an airstrike from friendly forces mistakenly struck an Afghan unit in Helmand Province on Sunday, killing at least 10 security personnel, officials said.

title: For Ravaged Vieques, Solitude, Once an Allure, Is Now a Curse
description: VIEQUES, P.R.  Solitude used to be an allure of life on this island apart from an island. Fish shacks served grouper pulled straight from the sea. Wild horses roamed the twisting roads. Tourists flocked to the beaches and glowing bays of an area left undeveloped for decades when it was a Navy bombing range.

title: Watch Old Kosciuszko Bridge Implode in 360 Video
description: Witness the controlled explosion that brought down the old Kosciuszko Bridge in New York. Two parallel cable-stayed bridges are replacing it, the first of which opened in April and runs alongside the old bridge.

title: CeDell Davis, Bluesman Who Played Guitar With a Knife, Dies at 91
description: CeDell Davis, a Delta bluesman from Arkansas who used a knife for a guitar slide, died on Wednesday. He was 91.

title: Heng on China and WhatsApp
description: China largely blocked the Facebook-owned messaging app, WhatsApp, in an effort to increase surveillance ahead of an upcoming Communist Party gathering. The decision to block the app comes as Mark Zuckerberg, Facebooks chief executive, has been attempting to re-enter the Chinese market.

title: Bowing to the Inevitable, Advertisers Embrace Advocate Role
description: For decades, advertisers have striven to stay away from any topic that might prove controversial or divisive. Times have changed.

title: Catalan Independence Vote Turns Violent
description: Hundreds of people were hurt as the Spanish police closed polling stations and seized ballot boxes during Catalonias independence vote on Sunday.

title: Yankee Stadium Netting Will Be Extended for Next Season
description: The Yankees on Sunday announced that they would significantly expand the protective netting at Yankee Stadium next season, taking the step 10 days after a young girl was hit in the face by a line drive while sitting in seats behind the third-base dugout at the stadium.

description: To the Editor:

description: To the Editor:

description: To the Editor:

title: Review: Nate Wooleys Festival Delivers a New, Idiosyncratic Repertoire for Trumpet
description: Inside the experimental realm, Nate Wooley possesses an obvious star quality. The trumpeter can often be heard in his own well-drilled jazz groups or as a guest virtuoso in a classical ensemble. He is also a showman. Mid-song during a solo set, the trumpeter may begin to take his instrument apart in order to develop an idiosyncratic sound.

title: How a Wisconsin Case Before Justices Could Reshape Redistricting
description: WASHINGTON  How egregiously can a majority party gerrymander a political map before it violates the Constitution?

title: Treasury Auctions Set for the Week of Oct. 2
description: The Treasurys schedule of financing this week includes Mondays regular weekly auction of new three- and six-month bills and an auction of four-week bills on Tuesday.

title: Schumer Wants Bus Safety Grades Posted on Windshields
description: A federal law requiring bus companies to post safety ratings where passengers can see them might have prevented a deadly bus crash in Queens last month, Senator Chuck Schumer said, if riders had known where to look for the evaluations.

title: Michael Grimm, a Former Congressman and Felon, Wants His Job Back
description: Standing in front of a giant American flag, Michael Grimm, the former congressman from Staten Island who was forced to resign for felony tax fraud, formally announced on Sunday his candidacy to recapture his old seat.

title: Father of Girl Hit by Ball Recounts Ordeal, and the Yankees Promise Fixes
description: The father of a young girl who was struck in the face by a line drive at Yankee Stadium last month spoke publicly for the first time this weekend about the episode, describing in chilling detail the girls injuries and urging the Yankees to take action to extend the protective netting in their ballpark.

title: Day Out for Dad and Daughter
description: Dear Diary:

title: A Trail of Bread Crumbs in the Forest
description: MONDAY PUZZLE  Hello, everyone. Its great to be back, and very special thanks to the uncommonly informative Martin Herbach, the startlingly dangerous Caitlin Lovinger and the incredibly intrepid Sam Ezersky for doing such a terrific job while I was on another assignment. Its nice to know that our Wordplay puzzlehead family is growing, and by doing so, that we can offer you more to read about this pastime of ours. Stay tuned for How to Solve The New York Times Crossword, a guide to getting beyond those Monday clues that will be published online by The Times in November.

title: In an Era of Strife, Museums Collect History as It Happens
description: WASHINGTON  In April 2015, Aaron Bryant rushed to be there when demonstrations  swept through Baltimore on the day of Freddie Grays funeral. He filmed protesters angered by Mr. Grays death throwing rocks, watched the helicopters overhead and listened to marchers singing hymns.

title: Vast Exercise Demonstrated Russias Growing Military Prowess
description: WASHINGTON  A recent major exercise by the Russian military revealed significant strides in its ability to conduct the sort of complex, large-scale operations, using drones and other new technology, that would be part of any all-out war with the United States in Europe, according to American and allied officials.

title: Bitcoin Bug Bites Japan and South Korea as China Clamps Down
description: SAN FRANCISCO  Until recently, China was a center of Bitcoin activity while the rest of Asia looked on with little interest.

title: Republican Tax Plan May Not Be Built to Last
description: WASHINGTON  The Republican tax plan is built around a goal of cutting corporate taxes, but party leaders now face a key question: Can they afford to make those changes permanent?

title: Drama Book Shop Celebrates Its Centennial. But Is It Too Late?
description: In planning for the 100th anniversary celebration of the Drama Book Shop in Midtown Manhattan on Monday, no detail was overlooked. Fresh blue carpeting was installed on the stairs. The 50-seat basement theater was stocked with black cushioned chairs. And the bookshelves  lined with scripts, plays and monologues  were dusted off.

title: What Is Bitcoin, and How Does It Work?
description: If you find the concept of Bitcoin confusing, you are not alone. The virtual currency has been a constant source of controversy, but it is still not well understood.

title: Understanding Ethereum, Bitcoins Virtual Cousin
description: Bitcoin has many cousins and competitors. None have grown more popular than Ethereum, a global computer network with its own virtual currency, called Ether.

title: Brooklyn Prosecutors Investigating Rape Charge Against Detectives
description: Two New York City police detectives are under investigation by the Brooklyn district attorneys office after they were accused of raping an 18-year-old girl while she was in their custody, city officials said.

title: How to Improve the Presidents Cup? Bring On the Women
description: JERSEY CITY  No need for the Coast Guard to respond to the S O S from the luxury liner, captained by Steve Stricker and Nick Price, that ran aground Sunday along the Hudson River, in the shadows of Lady Liberty. The Presidents Cup, a poorly constructed idea manufactured by the PGA Tour to make boatloads of money, has been listing ever since the United States posted an 8-point victory in the inaugural event in 1994.

title: New Yorks Subway Delays Could Cost City $389 Million a Year
description: New York Citys top fiscal official said that subway delays are costing the city economy as much as $389 million annually in lost wages and productivity.

title: Today, We Lost a Giant: S. I. Newhouse, as Recalled by Colleagues
description: The death on Sunday of S. I. Newhouse Jr. prompted tributes from his colleagues in the magazine industry and admirers outside of it. Here are some.

title: Yankees Lose, but Who Cares? Now Comes the Wild-Card Game
description: The Yankees 2017 regular season ended the way it began. With a loss.

title: Sikh Becomes Canadas First Nonwhite Political Party Leader
description: A lawyer from the Toronto area on Sunday became the first nonwhite leader of a major political party in Canada. The New Democratic Party gave Jagmeet Singh, a son of Indian immigrants and a Sikh, a resounding victory.

title: Please Rise for Our National Anthem  if Youre Not Too Busy
description: CARSON, Calif.  At the moment the public-address announcer asked fans to rise and kindly remove their caps for the national anthem, the mens room behind Section 108 was in full use, with dozens more waiting in a line that streamed out the door.

title: Trump Takes On All Comers, Believing Himself the Victor
description: WASHINGTON  President Trump flew by helicopter Sunday afternoon to Jersey City to watch the Presidents Cup golf tournament, where he presented the trophy to the winner. In Mr. Trumps mind, that is something he knows about: winning. In fact, he would argue, he was winning all weekend.

title: Cam Newton Stands Out in a Quieter Week of Player Protests
description: FOXBOROUGH, Mass.  Standing erect and still on the sideline at midfield, Carolina Panthers quarterback Cam Newton began his day here at Gillette Stadium with his eyes closed as the national anthem was sung. All the other players, too, stood in silence.

title: No Corrections: October 2, 2017
description: No corrections appeared in print on Monday, October 2, 2017.

title: As Catalans Voted, Dying With Fear at High School Turned Polling Place
description: BARCELONA, Spain  At some point on Sunday afternoon, as riot police officers forced their way into polling places all over the city, the Moiss Broggi high school in Barcelona became a fortress.

title: A Media Empire Loses Its King. What Now?
description: Cond Nast was named after Cond Montrose Nast, who purchased Vogue in 1909. But the glossy magazine company has long been synonymous with its unassuming leader, Samuel I. Newhouse Jr., who became chairman in 1975.

title: Quotation of the Day: Father of Injured Girl Speaks, And Yankees Pledge Longer Nets
description: There is a safer way. A way where a 2-year-old girl doesnt end up in a hospital bed, a way that people dont get hit with bats and balls, a way where people dont leave a game on a stretcher.

title: Outlander Season 3, Episode 4 Recap: A Merciful Heart
description: If you placed any bets on what Outlander would do with Jamie once he was on parole, I hope you put all your chips on Full Romance Novel. In this weeks episode, the pot veritably boils over with the sort of scenery chewing that makes it feel as if it covered as much ground as a feature film. It wasnt particularly resonant, but sometimes a show just wants to take a breather, set up new pieces, have some fun and wink at the audience.

title: Labor Case Before Supreme Court and Jobs Numbers for September
description: Heres what to expect in the week ahead:

title: Star Trek: Discovery Season 1, Episode 3: Sometimes Down Is Up
description: One of my early complaints about Star Trek: Discovery is that we dont know much about character motivations. This weeks episode three is titled, aptly, Context Is for Kings, and offers more information about where the show is headed.

title: Review: Jefferson, Dickens and Tolstoy Debate Jesus. Discord Ensues.

title: Facebook to Deliver 3,000 Russia-Linked Ads to Congress on Monday

title: Terry Collins Will Stay With the Mets, but Not as Manager
description: PHILADELPHIA  The long road to the Mets 2018 season began in earnest on Sunday afternoon, the final day of their nightmarish 2017 campaign. Before the start of an 11-0 loss to the Philadelphia Phillies, Mets Manager Terry Collins gathered the team to share what he would announce to reporters after the game.

title: How to Jump-Start Your Career

Declaring it was time for new ideas, Mr. Gorka, then a White House aide, packed disdain into a cryptic phrase that could have been borrowed from science fiction  a space-age update on the Bolsheviks dustbin of history.

title: Google Updates Policy on News Pay Walls. First Click Free to End.
description: Publications like The Wall Street Journal, The Financial Times and The New York Times have long asked readers to pay for access to online articles. But many reading this article online are probably familiar with an easy workaround: Plug a search term or headline into Google, and voil! Free access to articles normally locked behind pay walls.

title: Replacing Faulty Heart Devices Costs Medicare $1.5 Billion in 10 Years

title: Trump Presents Trophy to U.S. Team at Presidents Cup

The 45th president, Donald J. Trump, received a warm reception when he showed up at Liberty National Golf Course to hand the trophy to the United States squad after its 19-11 victory over the International team.

title: One Very Big Reason Not to Scrap the Iranian Nuclear Deal
description: On Oct. 23, 1966, China conducted a nuclear test with a device that was flown on a Dongfeng missile. It produced a yield of 12 kilotons of equivalent TNT  a little less than what destroyed Hiroshima. Like the Hiroshima bomb, its fissile material was highly enriched uranium. However, its design was different. It used implosion to assemble the critical mass by compressing the sphere that was made of the fissile material.

In 1938, a 42-year-old autoworker named Florence St. John was angry about being paid less than men doing the same job on a General Motors assembly line in Lansing, Mich. Banding together with two dozen other women, she sued one of the worlds most powerful companies and  to the astonishment of all  won historys first big damages award in a discrimination case.

It is, in fact, an object, rather than an assemblage of cabinetry, fixtures and hardware designed to be ordered by the foot and bolted to a wall.

The horse-drawn carriages and pedicabs were out in force, a ska band was tuning up by the harbor, and all along Wharf Street, people strolled, most of them without umbrellas. This was British Columbia, after all, and no one was going to let a little rain get in the way.

title: Managing Head Trauma in Children
description: More than 30 years ago, my toddler stood up in his stroller, evading the various belts and restraints, and took a dramatic header down onto the pavement. He cried right away  a good thing, because it meant he didnt lose consciousness, and by the time we got home, he seemed to be consoled, though he was already developing a major goose egg. I was a fourth-year medical student at the time and called the pediatric practice at University Health Services, and explained, somewhat frantically, that I was due to get on a flight to California with him in a couple of hours; I was going out for my all-important residency interviews.

description: LOS ANGELES  Brian Solis was the first to arrive, at 3 a.m. He unfolded his beach chair and tried to get some sleep, slumping over a backpack laden with school books and immigration paperwork. By dawn, dozens of others, many wearing hoodies and wrapped in blankets, had joined him on the sidewalk.

title: On the Market in Toronto
description: This weeks properties include a condo in Moss Park, and a townhouse in the Annex area.

title: Homes for Sale in Toronto
description: After several months of declining home prices and sales, Torontos real estate market seems to be rebounding. Many brokers say that as inventory has declined, they are seeing bully offers make a comeback. (A bully offer is an offer that is submitted before a designated offer day when the seller plans to accept offers.) The rebound has not extended to neighboring provinces though. Last week, the Canadian Real Estate Association announced market activity across the country was down 9.9 percent in August and sales had dropped from the year before in 60 percent of local Canadian markets.

title: Church Offers to Protect Police Who Testify on Philippines Drug War
description: MANILA  The Roman Catholic Church has offered to protect police officers who want to come forward and testify about their participation in President Rodrigo Dutertes bloody war on drugs, a prominent archbishop said on Monday.

title: Jarred Tomatoes Capture the Fleeting Flavors of Summer
description: As the local tomato season winds down, the frivolous grasshoppers among us who did not diligently can batches of them for winter dinners have a new resource. Amid the overflowing stands of shiny red orbs still in the markets in early fall are bright jars of preserved local, organic tomatoes sold by Jorge Moret, a partner in City Saucery. The company uses the recipes of Carolina Marino, a native of Calabria, Italy, and is run by her son Michael Marino and his companion, Mr. Moret. The jarred tomatoes include yellow ones and a sauce made from bruised ugly tomatoes. The company also sells Calabrian-style sauces and condiments online and in stores: City Saucery summer tomatoes, Union Square, Fort Greene and McCarren Park Greenmarkets; sauces and condiments, $14.98 and up, citysaucery.com.

title: A New American Prosciutto
description: Increasingly, American producers are selling prosciutto. Niman Ranch is the latest. The hams are cured in the traditional fashion  rubbed only with sea salt and lard, without added nitrites or nitrates  and hung to air-dry in stages for at least a year by a processor in Rhode Island. The fragrant, deep rose result, sold as whole hams with and without bone, or sliced in three-ounce consumer packages, is meaty and slightly saline, with good prosciuttos typical shadow of sweetness. The label says uncured because, according to Agriculture Department rules, products made without sodium nitrite or sodium nitrate must be labeled that way: Niman Ranch Prosciutto, $7.99 for three ounces, $199.95 for boneless ham, $250 for bone-in ham, debragga.com.

title: Pomme Palais Reopens in Midtown
description: Pomme Palais has reopened after having been closed all summer. The chef Michel Richard, who died last year, originally opened the shop for pastries and takeout in the New York Palace hotel. Homemade apple cider and cinnamon doughnuts, autumn ginger snaps, pastrami salmon sandwiches and a new take on the black-and-white cookie with an amaretto base highlight the new fall menu: Pomme Palais, Lotte New York Palace, 30 East 51st Street (Madison Avenue), 212-303-7755, pommepalais.com.

title: U.S. Service Member Killed by Roadside Bomb in Iraq
description: WASHINGTON  An American service member in Iraq was killed on Sunday by an improvised roadway bomb, the Pentagon said Monday.

title: In Chelsea Bombing Trial, Witnesses Tell of Blood and Blindness
description: The trial of the man charged with detonating a bomb in Chelsea last year began Monday in Federal District Court in Manhattan with video replays of the blast, emotional testimony from people wounded by shrapnel and an outburst by the defendant that led to his ejection from the courtroom.

title: G.M. and Ford Lay Out Plans to Expand Electric Models
description: DETROIT  China has said it will eventually ban gasoline-powered cars. California may be moving in the same direction. That pressure has set off a scramble by the worlds car companies to embrace electric vehicles.

title: An Evening With the Chefs Barbara Lynch and Mark Ladner
description: Pasta will be just one subject of a conversation at the De Gustibus Cooking School on Nov. 20 between Barbara Lynch, the Boston chef and restaurateur, and Mark Ladner, the former Del Posto chef whose soon-to-open Pasta Flyer will put a new spin on fast-service spaghetti. Expect them to demonstrate some pasta-making tips and recipes, and along the way, perhaps divulge some revelations. (Ms. Lynch is the author of the tell-all memoir Out of Line, and Mr. Ladner, who worked in Boston, can share memories with her.) Food and wine will be served: 6 to 8:30 p.m., Nov. 20, $115, De Gustibus Cooking School, Macys Herald Square, 151 West 34th Street, 212-239-1652, degustibusnyc.com.

title: Guggenheim Talk Focuses on Legendary Dancers Cookbook
description: The ballerina Tanaquil Le Clercq, a star of the New York City Ballet and a wife of George Balanchine, was an accomplished cook. Polio ended her dancing career in 1956, so she spent more time in the kitchen and eventually wrote The Ballet Cook Book (Stein and Day) with recipes and anecdotes from the files of leading figures in the world of dance at that time. The more than 90 contributors include Alicia Alonso, Erik Bruhn, Leslie Caron, Margot Fonteyn, Serge Lifar, Arthur Mitchell and Edward Villella. Its an international cookbook with a strong Russian influence and photographs of dancers, not food. Ballet buffs would love it, but for now, its out of print. Next month, for the books 50th anniversary, there will be a program about it at the Guggenheim Museum, with the dancers Jacques dAmboise, Allegra Kent, Jared Angle and Adrian Danchig-Waring in a conversation with Meryl Rosofsky, a food scholar. Some dishes from the book will also be served on a special menu (not included in the program price) at the museums restaurant, the Wright: Nov. 5 and 6, 7:30 p.m., $40 ($35 for museum members), worksandprocess.org; the Wright, 212-427-5690, opentable.com.

title: Chicago Art Museum Opens a Restaurant Named for Marisol
description: To honor the Venezuelan-American artist Mara Sol Escobar, known as Marisol, who died last year, the Museum of Contemporary Art Chicago has named its new restaurant after her. Decorating the Marisol dining room was the job of the English artist Chris Ofili, who also painted the colorful mural and the other artwork on the walls. The chef Jason Hammel, who owns Lula Cafe in Chicago, features dinner and counter service, and soon, lunch and brunch with menus that are contemporary and long on vegetables. Theres a steak sandwich with egg called At the Spring Street Diner c. 1972, in homage to Marisol, who donated the museums first acquisition. She is said to have liked to eat steak and eggs late at night in SoHo in New York: Marisol, 205 East Pearson Street (North Mies van der Rohe Way), Chicago, 312-799-3599, marisolchicago.com.

title: We Dont Exist: Life Inside Mongolias Swelling Slums

Here, atop one of Ulan Bators largest landfills, Ms. Dashnyam lives under a roof made of soggy mattresses. She spends her days rummaging through piles of gin bottles and discarded animal bones, picking up pieces of scrap metal to sell in order to buy water and bread.

title: Yearly 9/11 Tribute Shows Light Pollutions Effects on Birds
description: Scientists have long known that artificial light can attract and disorient birds at night, causing collisions and wreaking mischief with their migratory path. Now, the annual September 11 Tribute in Light Memorial in Manhattan has provided a unique opportunity to study and quantify the effect.

title: Denis Villeneuve Narrates a Scene From Blade Runner 2049

But the director Denis Villeneuve makes it feel ominous. In the video, Mr. Villeneuve discussed his direction for Mr. Gosling (Walk slower) and in and interview, explained the significance of music used in the sequence. Here are excerpts from the conversation.

title: Review: In Blade Runner 2049, Hunting Replicants Amid Strangeness
description: A lot of the movies released in the late 1970s and early 80s have spawned franchises, merchandising empires and what we are now invited to call cinematic universes. Blade Runner, Ridley Scotts initially underrated 1982 adaptation of a novel by Philip K. Dick, accomplished something more unusual. It sent tendrils of influence  pictorial, conceptual and spiritual  into every corner of the culture and inspired a mystery cult.

title: Louvre Pulls Sculpture, Saying It Was Sexually Explicit

title: Afghan Newspaper Hunts Corruption, but First It Has to Pay the Rent
description: KABUL, Afghanistan  The first time Zaki Daryabi started a small newspaper in Afghanistan, it shut down within months. Mr. Daryabi, who had just graduated from university in Kabul, lost most of the money lent to him by friends to start his business.

title: Controlled Chaos at Las Vegas Hospital Trauma Center After Attack
description: On Sunday night, Toni Mullan drove 110 miles an hour on side streets from home to get back to University Medical Center of Southern Nevada, where she had just worked a 12-hour shift as a clinical supervisor in the trauma resuscitation department. Her car was smoking as she pulled into a three-hour parking spot close to the trauma center. Ms. Mullan, 54, left her hazard lights blinking as she shut the car door and raced inside.

title: Arthur Janov, 93, Dies; Psychologist Caught Worlds Attention With Primal Scream

He was 93.

title: Why Does Verizon Care About Telephone Poles?

Like every other 8-year-old whom I tutored at a local school, Omar didnt know anything  and didnt care much  about high-stakes disputes over net neutrality, free speech and privacy that have consumed much of the news coverage of the telecommunications industry in recent years. Yet the inability of Omars parents to afford broadband internet access lies at the heart of a battle that will have a far greater impact on his future: the fight over street poles.

title: What 7 Fishmongers Wore to Work at the Fulton Fish Market
description: The Fulton Fish Market in the Bronx is less a market than a refrigerated warehouse. Relocated in 2005 from its old home in Lower Manhattan, it is almost a quarter-mile long, with  almost 30 seafood wholesalers selling more than 300 varieties of fish, from barramundi to wahoo. On a recent Wednesday morning, before the sun rose over the East River (the action starts daily at 1 a.m.), fishmongers, journeymen, wholesalers and dispatchers talked about what they were wearing.

title: The Golden Age of Existential Dread
description: Last month, after Hurricane Irma rolled over Florida, the states commissioner of agriculture took in the damage to citrus crops and deemed it a unique and existential threat to the industry. This was an alarming thing to say: Taken literally, it suggests that one of his states signature industries might cease to exist. And if it doesnt sound alarming, perhaps thats only because were surrounded on all sides with existential alarm, to the point where it feels almost like a tic to identify it. In the same month, a corporate lawyer, marveling at Equifaxs handling of an enormous data breach, called it a botched response to an existential threat. Climate change is considered an existential threat to all life on earth; a source in one news report deemed Brexit an existential threat to Irish beef exports.

title: Jalal Talabani, Kurdish Leader and Iraqs First Postwar President, Is Dead at 83
description: Jalal Talabani, the Kurdish leader who used pragmatism, guile and an outsize personality to navigate a hazardous course in Mideast politics, surviving guerrilla war, the terrors of Saddam Hussein and shifting alliances to become the first president of Iraq under its postwar Constitution, died on Tuesday in Berlin. He was 83.

description: LONDON  Less than two weeks after being stripped of its license in London, Uber has gone on a charm offensive to win it back.

title: America Used to Be Good at Gun Control. What Happened?
description: IN the immediate aftermath of one of the worst mass shootings in American history, I sought information about what happened by googling fully automatic weapons and Las Vegas. Audio recordings from the scene had picked up the utterly distinctive sound of fully automatic gunfire. (It appears the gun was a modified semiautomatic weapon.) But instead of turning up details of the massacre, the top search results yielded multiple advertisements for sites like Battlefield Vegas (Book Now!) and M.G.V. (Machine Guns Vegas), where customers can purchase firing-range time with fully automatic exclusive Las Vegas gun range packages, according to the second website.

description: If only Stephen Paddock had been a Muslim  If only he had shouted Allahu akbar before he opened fire on all those concertgoers in Las Vegas  If only he had been a member of ISIS  If only we had a picture of him posing with a Quran in one hand and his semiautomatic rifle in another

description: WASHINGTON  Senator Joe Manchin III, Democrat of West Virginia, was at a loss on Tuesday. After the massacre of children at Sandy Hook Elementary School in 2012, he challenged the pro-gun bent of his state and co-authored legislation to expand background checks of gun purchasers, only to see the measure fail.

title: A Providence Chef Has Connections at the Docks
description: PROVIDENCE, R.I.  Raw bluefish was on the menu at Oberlin in July, and I was thinking: I hope they know what theyre doing. Bluefish goes off so quickly that there was a chance my first impression would end my curiosity about this restaurant.

description: The Mets reckoning with their disappointing season continued Tuesday, when they announced the dismissal of their pitching coach and their head athletic trainer.

title: In Denmark, Lego House Is the New Kid on the Block
description: Legoland, the Lego toy companys flagship theme park, draws some 2 million visitors annually to the tiny town of Billund, Denmark, where the company has its headquarters.

title: Review: Chavela Recalls the Life of the Ranchera Singer Chavela Vargas
description: Those looking to learn the basic outlines of the life of the singer Chavela Vargas could do worse than watch Chavela, but this plodding documentary from Catherine Gund and Daresha Kyi rarely transcends simple biography. While the film includes footage of Ms. Vargas onstage and recordings of her music, it doesnt convey the power of her artistry, giving the viewer a sense of why, to paraphrase the musician Miguel Bos from the film, listeners might believe that she could die from being overwhelmed in the middle of a song. (Separately, we learn that may have been her wish.)

title: Thom Browne: Spring 2018
description: The label shows its spring looks.

title: In India, a Ghost Town and a Mythological Bridge
description: DHANUSHKODI, India  At dawn, a procession of buses sped past coconut huts, past fishermen unfurling nets and through the ghost town of Dhanushkodi  leveled in a powerful hurricane in 1964  before stopping at a stretch of beach where, according to Hindu mythology, an ancient bridge once stood.

title: Caitriona Balfe: The First Time I Left Home (and Fell in Love)
description: Through a cloud of Gauloises smoke, four men silently watched me as I made my way through the empty cafe to a table by the window. The waitress threw down a menu and stood, one hip cocked, impatiently waiting for my order.

title: Review: Fall for Dances Eclectic Variations
description: Fall for Dance is a fixture with a formula. It arrives every year at this time, for two weeks, at New York City Center. It presents five programs, each with four items from different areas of dance. Dance from outside New York and from other countries is part of the mix; so are commissioned premieres. Whatever your existing ideas of dance are, they should be extended in some way by each season  and its fine to dislike a few items along the way.

title: De Blasio Appoints Acting Commissioner to Head City Jails
description: After months of searching around the country for a new correction commissioner, Mayor Bill de Blasio announced on Tuesday that he had found the person to head the Correction Department, which oversees the troubled Rikers Island jail complex, from within its own ranks.

title: Tell Us 5 Things About Your Book: David Friend on The Naughty Nineties
description: The schisms of the 1960s, which opened up when many baby boomers were teenagers or in the first stages of adulthood, are commonly used as a Rosetta stone to decipher current political and cultural battles in the United States. In The Naughty Nineties, David Friend turns instead to the 1990s, when those same baby boomers were in positions of greater power: from Bill Clinton in the White House to Howard Stern on the radio to the producers Mary-Ellis Bunim and Jonathan Murray on MTV with The Real World. Friend finds that the decades sexual and political attitudes shaped, in ways both progressive and conservative, the ground we stand on today. On one side are widespread moves to the left on social issues. But a good case can be made, he also writes, that Donald J. Trumps presidency would never have been possible had the 1990s not normalized and formalized personal branding, reality programming, 24/7 news, tabloid scandal coverage and online self-expression. Below, Friend discusses how Viagra inspired the book, how the election of Trump changed his plans and more.

title: E.U. Said to Order Luxembourg to Collect Back Taxes From Amazon
description: BRUSSELS  European Union officials will order Luxembourg to collect back taxes from the online retail giant Amazon, a source with knowledge of the decision said Tuesday, the latest in a series of moves where Brussels has sought to flex its regulatory muscle over Silicon Valley.

title: Jeffrey Eugenidess Short Stories Salvage Wit From Lifes Grind
description: Like certain comets, books by Jeffrey Eugenides appear only rarely. Since 1993 he has dropped a novel a decade: The Virgin Suicides, Middlesex, which won a Pulitzer Prize, and most recently The Marriage Plot.

title: Hwa Yuan Szechuan From the Owners of Shorty Tang Noodles Opens
description: HWA YUAN SZECHUAN Chen Lieh Tang is back to opening restaurants. His father, Yun Fa Tang, known as Shorty, arrived in New York in 1963 and introduced Sichuan food and notably sesame noodles. Chen Lien Tang put the family name on many restaurants before retiring to spend time in China, New York and Taiwan. But he recently became bored. Hes getting old, and he felt the need to do it again, one last time, said his son, James Tang, who is also involved in the business. Last spring, the family opened Shorty Tang Noodles in Chelsea. Now, they have installed a grand restaurant seating about 350 on three floors in the family-owned building (formerly the Bank of China) next door to where Shorty Tang, who died at 50, opened his original Hwa Yuan restaurant in 1968. (The restaurant closed in the 1980s.) The elder Mr. Tang, now 66, designed the new restaurant, seeing to every detail, including richly hand-carved doors he brought from China. Im going to remake history here, he said. Sesame noodles, fine scallion pancakes, Sichuan kung pao chicken done simply, the way its supposed to be, just with chiles and garlic. He will also serve some banquet dishes on a menu that leans toward Sichuan heat but not exclusively so. He plans to try new ideas, he said, because times have changed. Among them are raw-bar selections displayed at one end of the bar in the front dining room, and cheesecake for dessert. (Opens Thursday): 42 East Broadway (Catherine Street), 212-966-6002.

title: The Yankees Absolutely Own the Twins in the Postseason
description: Minnesota Twins fans can be forgiven for looking at their opponent in Tuesday nights wild card game with trepidation. Its the Yankees, who have simply owned the Twins in the postseason.

title: Notorious Landlord Is Sentenced to a Year in Jail
description: A notorious New York City landlord who pleaded guilty last month to grand larceny and other felony charges, stemming from his involvement in elaborate tax and mortgage fraud schemes, began his own one-year residency on Tuesday on Rikers Island.

title: A Shortlist of What We Like Right Now
description: My paintings have always dealt with turbulence and conflict, says Cecily Brown, the British-born artist who was declared an art world virtuosa almost as soon as she arrived in New York 23 years ago. Indeed, Browns canvases  layered abstractions with erotic undertones that have earned her comparisons to de Kooning  are known for their fierce energy. This month, a solo exhibition opening at Paula Cooper (Browns first at the gallery) reveals a softer side. The artist employed faster, looser brush strokes, creating veils of blues, pinks and grays to achieve a delicate transparency.

title: Aid Is Getting to Puerto Rico. Distributing It Remains a Challenge.
description: LAS MARAS, P.R.  Inside a dark school sheltering families left homeless by landslides and hurricane winds, bottled water was getting so scarce on Monday that relief workers parceled out one small plastic cup to go with each persons dinner of hot dogs, rice and beans and syrupy apricots.

title: In Las Vegas, Concert Security Met a New Threat: Aerial Assault
description: It was a watershed attack, one in a million, an all-but-unforeseeable black swan.

title: Review: Katy Perry, Queen of Froth, Stars in a Carnival of Her Own
description: Released in June, Katy Perrys fourth major label album, Witness, has been her least commercially successful and her most artistically confused. Take Bon Apptit, the albums second single, a discoesque club song featuring the rat-tat-tat Atlanta rap trio Migos. Ms. Perry is somewhere in there, singing, but her voice is the least essential part of the song. And in the video, shes manhandled like dough by a gaggle of chefs, then covered in vegetables before getting dumped in a caldron and basted.

title: As Baseball Playoffs Begin, a Question Looms: Are There Enough Red Towels?
description: WOODINVILLE, Wash.  In early September, when the Washington Nationals were soaring, the Arizona Diamondbacks were streaking and the Cleveland Indians never lost, Kerrie Ingham started getting nervous. She walked into a second-floor office here at the headquarters of Bensussen Deutsch & Associates, the sports merchandising agency in charge of promotions for the Major League Baseball playoffs, and, in her words, freaked out.

title: Boris Johnson Takes Center Stage in U.K. Leadership Shadow Play
description: MANCHESTER, England  The annual conference of Britains Conservative Party already had the feel of a political beauty pageant, with one aspirant to power after another taking the rostrum. And then, at last, came Boris.

description: SRINAGAR, Kashmir  On Tuesday, the sound of explosions woke Srinagar up.

description: Dean McAuley had found a path to safety, but he didnt leave. As his two friends followed the police away from the Las Vegas gunmans view, one called back to him: Youve got to come with us.

title: What Do Vietnamese-Americans Think of The Vietnam War?
description: I am emotionally exhausted. By the end of this month, I will have seen 36 hours of documentary film about a momentous event that is the backbone of my identity. It doesnt matter that I was born after the fighting ended. Whether I like it or not, the Vietnam War is my war, too.

title: At Totokaelos New Home, the Fitting Rooms Are Bank Vaults
description: Recognizable to most New Yorkers as that graffiti-covered building on the corner of Spring, 190 Bowery has maintained a mysterious facade since the photographer Jay Maisel bought it in 1966 for $102,000 and converted the former Germania Bank into a six-story, 72-room home and studio for himself, his wife and their daughter.

description: MANCHESTER, England  The choice in British politics today is between the disastrous and the useless.

title: The Dawn of a New Las Vegas
description: LAS VEGAS  At around 7:30 p.m. on Monday, the evening after the massacre on the south end of the Las Vegas Strip, a packed express city bus detoured around the closed streets surrounding the site of the attack. A passenger yelled out, mystified at the mind-set of the suspected gunman, Stephen Paddock, What I dont get is, why would you go through the trouble of setting up the retirement he had and then end your life like that?

title: A Title in 2009. Boos in 2015. Now, Brett Gardner Tries Again.

title: The Rebel Puppeteers of Sudan
description: I began making this film in 2015, aiming to upend the prevailing narrative of conflict in Sudan by showing so-called victims defy two strongmen at the helm of the conflict. In an age of ascendant nationalism, it is also an example of how people use comedy to deal with authoritarian rule, no matter where they are.

title: Learning From Gravitational Waves
description: A billion years ago (give or take), in a galaxy far, far away, two black holes concluded a cosmic pas de deux. After orbiting each other more and more closely, their mutual gravity tugging each to the other, they finally collided and merged into one. Their collision released enormous energy  equivalent to about three times the mass of our sun. The black holes inspiral, collision and merger roiled the surrounding space-time, sending gravitational waves streaming out in every direction at the speed of light.

title: What Does It Take to Tighten Gun Laws?
description: To the Editor:

title: A Play About Racisms Aftershocks Returns With New Resonance
description: When Charles Fullers drama A Soldiers Play had its world premiere Off Broadway in 1981, the playwright envisioned an audience  and a public  that was ready to face uncomfortable truths about the enduring, unwieldy legacy of white supremacy in America. It had been nearly two decades since the passage of the Civil Rights Act of 1964, and Mr. Fuller had grown weary of what he called the simple racial conflict, in which white characters and black ones are neatly arrayed on opposite sides of a battlefield.

title: How I Helped My Best Male Friend Pick a Custom Wedding Suit
description: When my dear friend Daniel asked me to accompany him to a custom mens wear atelier to help him choose a suit for his wedding, I was so flattered, and frankly relieved, that I neglected to mention how little I know about mens wear.

title: Egypt Expands Crackdown on Gay and Transgender People
description: CAIRO  At least 34 people have been arrested in Egypt as part of an expanding crackdown on the gay and transgender community following a rock concert last month when audience members waved a rainbow flag.

title: Whats the Best Approach to Negotiating Your Salary?
description: Q: Ive heard conflicting advice whether to reveal my current salary when asked. How should I answer such question when asked during an interview?

title: Lincoln Center Scraps a $500 Million Geffen Hall Renovation
description: One of the biggest cultural building projects in the country was sent back to the drawing board on Tuesday, when the new leaders of Lincoln Center and the New York Philharmonic announced they were scuttling a half-billion-dollar plan for a gut renovation of David Geffen Hall and seeking simpler ways to improve the lackluster theater.

title: The Trump Tax Idea Thats a Boon for Shareholders
description: One of the proposals in the Republican tax plan set out last week  a bid to get American corporations to repatriate their untaxed corporate overseas profits  has support both in Congress and in the Trump administration. As much as $2.6 trillion in such profits sits in offshore subsidiaries of United States corporations.

title: Megyn Kelly Today Ratings Not All Sunshine for NBCs New Morning Host
description: Megyn Kelly, the new host of the 9 a.m. hour of NBCs Today show, is off to a soft start in the ratings.

description: Car buyers want sport utility vehicles and trucks today. Automakers are feeling pressure to make the electric and self-driving vehicles that may define tomorrow.

description: Legislators in three Midwestern states are taking steps to protect consumers who buy cheap and often rundown homes from investors through seller-financed deals or rent-to-own leases.

title: Looking Crisp for Fall
description: Novelty knits and ski jackets. Woolly coats and winter anoraks. Baggy corduroys and puffer vests. The best fashion from the mens fall season melds the homespun with the technical. Its a welcome look that feels right and practical for the great outdoors.

title: The Onions Las Vegas Shooting Headline Is Painfully Familiar
description: The satirical website The Onion published a headline on Monday that echoed the thoughts of many Americans who were, once again, processing a horrific mass shooting.

title: Catalans Who Did Not Vote (More Than Half) Ask: What Now?
description: BARCELONA  A tide of emotion has washed over Catalonia in the past few days, over those who demand separation from Spain and those who oppose it. Graffiti has appeared overnight, proclaiming, We are not Spanish. Crowds have marched past gawking tourists, singing, I am, I am, I am Spanish.

title: With Affordable Care Acts Future Cloudy, Costs for Many Seem Sure to Soar
description: Health insurers are aggressively increasing prices next year for individual policies sold under the federal health care law, with some raising premiums by more than 50 percent.

title: What Were Reading
description: New York Times reporters and editors are highlighting great stories from around the web. You can receive What Were Reading by email, and let us know how you like it at wwr@nytimes.com.

title: Saunas May Be Good for Blood Pressure
description: A Finnish study suggests that regular sauna visits can reduce the risk for high blood pressure.

title: Amid Promises of Aid, a Puerto Rico Still in Ruins
description: President Trump said Puerto Ricans should be proud of the low death toll after Hurricane Maria. But a tour of the island by New York Times reporters showed that vast humanitarian and logistical challenges remain.

title: Tom Petty, an Unfussy Rock Star Who Kept His Tenacity Under Cover
description: In 1985, Tom Petty the rock star became Tom Petty the music video star with the fantastical clip for the slow groan Dont Come Around Here No More, in which he played a kooky Mad Hatter in an Alice in Wonderland-themed carnival.

title: Nestl Can Head Off a Fight With Dan Loeb
description: Nestl can pre-empt the activist Dan Loebs next move. Directors at the $265 billion Kit Kat maker are light on consumer and digital expertise. Half the 14-member board is from Switzerland, the companys home market but one thats worth just 2 percent of sales. Nestls latest plans to revamp are far from radical, and Mr. Loeb, the founder of Third Point, may next seek boardroom changes. Nestl could head off a fight by beating him to it.

title: Zuzana Ruzickova, Leading Harpsichordist and War Survivor, Dies at 90
description: Zuzana Ruzickova, who survived Nazi concentration camps and a Communist dictatorship in the former Czechoslovakia to become one of the worlds most renowned harpsichordists and a leading interpreter of Bach, died on Sept. 27 in Prague. She was 90.

title: After Threat of War, Iraq and Kurds Lower the Temperature
description: ERBIL, Iraq  The world could be excused for thinking that another war was about to break out in Iraq.

title: M.L.B. Playoffs: How the Yankees Beat the Twins in the Wild-Card Game
description: The Yankees are headed to the American League division series after beating the Minnesota Twins, 8-4, in the wild-card game.

title: All 3 Billion Yahoo Accounts Were Affected by 2013 Attack
description: It was the biggest known breach of a companys computer network. And now, it is even bigger.

title: Las Vegas, Puerto Rico, Tom Petty: Your Tuesday Evening Briefing
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: Syrian Soldier Is Guilty of War Crime, a First in the 6-Year Conflict
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon  For the first time, six years into a war that began with Syrias secret police accused of torturing teenagers and has escalated in brutality ever since, a member of the Syrian military has been convicted of a war crime.

title: In Dan Browns Origin, Robert Langdon Returns, With an A.I. Friend in Tow
description: Dan Brown has thrown off the doldrums of Inferno with a brisk new book that pits creationism against science, and is liable to stir up as much controversy as The Da Vinci Code did. In Origin, the brash futurist Edmond Kirsch comes up with a theory so bold, so daring that, as he modestly thinks to himself in Browns beloved italics, It will not shake your foundations. It will shatter them. Kirsch is of course addressing The World, because thats the scale on which Brown writes.

title: How to Throw a Laid-back Parisian Dinner Party
description: I grew up going to sleep to the sound of my parents having a party, says the jewelry designer Sophie Buhai. It was very much a part of life  eating and celebrating. Following that example, Buhai, who founded her eponymous jewelry line in 2015, gathered friends together on Friday night in Paris to celebrate both her collection and that of her longtime friend, the designer Maryam Nassirzadeh.

title: States Gird for Worst as Congress Wrestles with Childrens Insurance Program
description: WASHINGTON  Federal officials on Monday approved a $3.6 million emergency infusion for Minnesota after the states human services chief warned that pregnant women and some children were at imminent risk of losing health care coverage under the Childrens Health Insurance Program.

title: Fyre Festival Organizer Pleads Not Guilty to Fraud Charges
description: Billy McFarland, the entrepreneur who became a lightning rod in April after his ambitiously marketed Fyre Festival devolved from a would-be luxury getaway into a jamboree of schadenfreude and cold cheese sandwiches, pleaded not guilty to charges of fraud in United States District Court in Manhattan on Monday. Mr. McFarland, 25, who was arrested and charged in June, is accused of misrepresenting financial information about his company to investors who paid him $1.2 million.

title: Ubers Board Approves Changes to Reshape Companys Power Balance
description: SAN FRANCISCO  Ubers board of directors voted on Tuesday for governance changes that will reshape the balance of power at the ride-hailing service, paving the way for a stock sale to the Japanese conglomerate SoftBank and for the company to go public by 2019.

title: Key Evidence in Chelsea Bombing Trial: Articles on Building Bombs
description: The magazine photograph shows a red chair, the kind arranged in pedestrian zones all over Times Square, this one on Seventh Avenue. There is a yellow cab in the background, driving past a TGI Fridays and a billboard for Mamma Mia! On the chair sits a single item, a colorful childs backpack.

title: Iranian Chess Player, Shunned for Refusing to Wear Hijab, Will Play in U.S.
description: A female chess champion from Iran has joined the United States Chess Federation, months after learning that she was officially barred from playing for her homeland because she refused to wear a head scarf.

title: Steak Rubs, Gobbledygook and the Future of American Politics
description: Early in oral arguments at the Supreme Court on Tuesday, Justice Sonia Sotomayor posed a simple question to one of the lawyers defending Wisconsins legislative district maps against charges that they were drawn intentionally to maximize and entrench Republican power  the practice known as gerrymandering.

title: Republicans Are Reconsidering Full Repeal of State and Local Tax Deduction
description: WASHINGTON  Republican leaders are backing away from a proposal to fully repeal an expensive tax break used by more than 40 million tax filers to deduct state and local taxes amid pushback from fellow lawmakers whose residents rely on the popular provision.

title: As Trump Visits Offshore, Virgin Islands Struggle to Recover
description: FREDERIKSTED, V.I.  On Tuesday morning, as President Trump prepared to meet with Gov. Kenneth Mapp of the United States Virgin Islands on a Navy amphibious assault ship offshore, the residents of the island of St. Croix were busy putting together lives and neighborhoods wrenched apart by Hurricane Maria.

title: At Menendez Trial, Ex-Health Secretary Recalls an Unusual Meeting
description: NEWARK  Kathleen Sebelius, the former secretary of Health and Human Services, testified on Tuesday that she frequently met with members of Congress about policy issues, but that a meeting in 2012 with Senator Robert Menendez was unusual because it came after a request from another member: Senator Harry Reid.

title: Jagmeet Singh, Canadas Newest Political Star, Lifts His Partys Hopes
description: OTTAWA  While Canada has long promoted multiculturalism, it took until this week for a major Canadian political party to choose a leader  Jagmeet Singh  who was not a white man or woman.

title: Gun Stocks Rise After Las Vegas Shooting, but Sales Drop Under Trump
description: Stock prices for firearm companies rose this week after a gunman killed dozens of people in Las Vegas, an apparent continuation of a morbid trend linked to mass shootings.

title: Supreme Court Weighs Immigrants Rights to Have Detention Reviewed
description: WASHINGTON  Amid a nationwide surge in immigration arrests spearheaded by the Trump administration, the Supreme Court weighed on Tuesday whether immigrants facing deportation are entitled to have their detentions, which can stretch for years, reviewed by a judge.

title: Like the Knicks, an Ad Campaign Fades Quickly
description: Just one day after it was unveiled, an advertising campaign that offended the Knicks by asking New Yorkers if they were hopeful or hopeless about the hapless team will be stripped from the subway cars they were placed on.

title: Right and Left React to the Las Vegas Shooting and the Gun Control Debate
description: The political news cycle is fast, and keeping up can be overwhelming. Trying to find differing perspectives worth your time is even harder. Thats why we have scoured the internet for political writing from the right and left that you might not have seen.

title: Paul S. Otellini, Who Led Intel and Saw It Grow Even More, Dies at 66
description: SAN FRANCISCO  Paul S. Otellini, who as chief executive expanded Intels already commanding chip-making business but failed to build a company franchise in mobile phones, died on Monday at his familys second home in Sonoma County, Calif. He was 66.

title: At Benghazi Trial, Attack Survivors Recount a Night of Horror

title: She Finished Last on the Ice, but Moved Forward

In fact, she finished last among 33 skaters at the Nebelhorn Trophy competition here. But, for Muslim women, Lari considered this a step forward, not backward.

title: French Parliament Advances a Sweeping Counterterrorism Bill

title: Dozens Charged With Using Fake Parking Placards to Avoid Tickets
description: Thirty people were hauled into state court on Tuesday in handcuffs and charged with using fake parking placards made to look like city-issued documents to park in special zones and to avoid paying tickets.

title: Finding Myself on the Page
description: One morning in my 18th summer, the guy I thought I loved stopped by to invite my roommates and me to pick apricots from the tree hed discovered behind the Boulder Public Library. Five of us gathered paper grocery sacks and trooped over, marveling that in the several weeks wed all been in town, studying poetry at Naropa Institute, none of us had noticed the fruit tree. Actually, the others marveled and I pretended to. Growing up in Queens, N.Y., the only apricots Id seen came dried and flattened into sticky sheets on paper backing my mother bought in rolls.

title: Is It O.K. to Give Cigarettes to a Homeless Person?
description: After a passer-by handed over a half-used pack of cigarettes to a homeless man on a Melbourne street, the man asked that I accompany him to a nearby convenience store to help him buy more cigarettes as he was running low for the week. That way, he claimed, he would be able to spend the small sums he received on food. Cigarettes are indeed expensive in Australia, as they come with a high disincentive tax. My offer to buy him sandwiches instead was vehemently refused. The homeless man accused me of being miserly and dishonoring our agreement (in my view, we didnt have one). He said that I was clearly not as generous as my benevolent predecessor. I refused his request for money in the belief that it would be wasted on cigarettes.

title: Chuck Todd Thinks Its Important to Stay Neutral
description: Youve been moderating Meet the Press for just over three years. Do you think your job is the same today as it was, say, 10 months ago? What the audience expects hasnt changed. People come to us for the same reasons: to be educated and informed. My biggest change is that I feel the need to reinforce the wall between the news media and the politicians. The wall has always been there, but sometimes there have been too many holes in it. One legitimate criticism of the political press over the last two decades has been the appearance of coziness between people in the media and the political elite. Its a lot easier for me, say, as a sports fan to accept a personal fandom, whereas in politics, Im not going to tell anybody whom I vote for, not even my kids, who ask me all the time, because their friends ask them.

title: What if Platforms Like Facebook Are Too Big to Regulate?
description: Ubers relationships with cities tend to begin or end in war. Smaller markets experience the company as a powerful invading force  often a welcome one. The companys model easily outclasses and undercuts provincial competitors, conscripting local cabbies and enlisting new drivers. Flimsy taxi regulations backed by weak municipal governments are quickly overwhelmed by the multibillion-dollar company and its armies of lawyers and lobbyists and their briefcases full of case studies and legislative suggestions.
