title: Once Upon a Time in Post-Racial America
description: The term post-racial is almost never used in earnest, wrote Ta-Nehisi Coates in a 2015 post on The Atlantics website, describing it instead as a means of discussing our progress toward a utopian moment that may never arrive. It is difficult to look at the word today and imagine the hope and credulity with which it was once invested: These days, people who possess faith in the possibility of the post-racial are usually those whove already experienced a measure of its promised ease, as they pass relatively unimpeded through a relatively white world. But in New People, her captivating and incisive fifth book, Danzy Senna has crafted a tragicomic novel that powerfully conjures the sense of optimism once associated with future racial transcendence, even as it grounds that idealism in a present that bears more than just a family resemblance to the racialized past.

title: The 9.24.17 Issue

title: Comparing the Las Vegas Attack With Daily Gun Deaths in U.S. Cities

title: From Innovation to Provocation, Chinas Artists on a Global Path

Art and China after 1989: Theater of the World at the Solomon R. Guggenheim Museum wants to correct that impression. With work by some 70 Chinese-born artists and collectives filling most of the museum, its the largest American survey of its kind since Asia Societys Inside Out: New Chinese Art in 1998.

title: Judge John Hodgman on a Technophobic Friends Traffic Navigation

title: How to Fight and Fix Your Car Like a Woman
description: I am woman, hear me roar, blah blah blah. Who needs all these female-empowerment books? After all, we are a nation where almost half the work force is women, where we outnumber men in graduation from college and make only 18 percent less than they do in median weekly earnings and  hmm. Well, the percentage of female chief executives leading Fortune 500 companies is at an all-time high! Of 6.4 percent. Wait, seriously? That cant be right. Perhaps these books arent such a bad idea after all.

It is a lot of fun, but also serious business, as the children learn what it takes to become a proper jockey in a real racing environment.

title: Why America Needs Foreign Medical Graduates
description: As our recent eight-nation bracket tournament showed, many people think the United States health care system has a lot of problems. So it seems reasonable to think of policy changes that make things better, not worse. Making it harder for immigrants to come here to practice medicine would fail that test.

title: Leonard Cohens Final Book to Arrive in 2018

title: Connecting, Midair, With My 8-Year-Old Son
description: My son, Max, who is 8, has many passions: BMX biking, Clash of Clans, Minecraft, the New England Patriots and bottle flipping. While I dont have an innate love for any of these, Ive made an effort to be interested. Ive learned how to throw a football (fingertips on the laces and give it a spin) and come to understand that it is cause for celebration when you upgrade your town hall in Clash of Clans or land a bottle on its cap (capping, if youre curious).

That same year, the Jet Age-inflected Trans World Airlines Flight Center, with its concrete shells and curvy interior, opened at New Yorks Idlewild Airport, which later became John F. Kennedy International Airport. In St. Louis, the Gateway Arch, a towering welcome to the Midwest, was completed in 1965.

title: New Coach Reminds Fans That Purdue Has a Football Team

title: President Trumps Failing Leadership on Iran

He is right: The ill-constructed deal left Iran with an industrial-scale nuclear program which, when the pacts terms begin to expire, will provide Iran with a clear pathway to nuclear weapons.

But dance still happens downtown, and the past year has been a time of upheaval for organizations that support it.

title: Lost and Found in Translation: Streaming Isnt Afraid of Subtitles
description: When I worked at a prominent movie magazine many years back, Id often hear from executives and filmmakers who invested in independent and foreign movies that The Kids Today simply refused to watch foreign films with English subtitles. And what a shame this was. While it was true that foreign-language pictures in the 1990s never reached the consistent heights of popularity in the United States that they had in the 60s and 70s, I was mostly offered anecdotal evidence of a bias against subtitles.

title: Canada to Pay Millions in Indigenous Lawsuit Over Forced Adoptions

title: What Does It Mean When an Artist Retires?
description: WERE BETTER AT BEGINNINGS: the debut author, the ingnue, the voice of a new generation. Endings are harder. So when Daniel Day-Lewis, perhaps the greatest actor of our age, announced in June that Paul Thomas Andersons forthcoming Phantom Thread, about a fictional British dressmaker, would be his last film, eyebrows were raised and hands wrung.

title: 10 Things to Do in NYC Now
description: Hears will also be aflutter when this Bronx garden presents its annual salute to raptors, the magnificent birds of prey that fly over the Hudson River each fall during their migratory journey. The weekends family art project, Raptors in the Autumn Sky, will invite children to make movable hawk puppets and send them aloft during an outdoor procession. Family strolls will offer opportunities to spy the birds: On Saturday, a guide will lead a garden walk at noon, while on Sunday the educator Gabriel Willow will conduct both a fall birding walk at 9:30 a.m. and a nature walk at noon that will investigate the sites furry and finned creatures, too. But the signature event is on Monday at 1 p.m., when Brian Bradley, a master falconer with Skyhunters in Flight, will present the weekends stars: species like a gyrfalcon (above, with Mr. Bradley), a great horned owl and a Eurasian eagle owl, which will show off their flight patterns by thrillingly swooping over spectators heads. LAUREL GRAEBER

People dont even want to leave voice messages anymore, let alone talk. We keep a distance from each other because we can. Its odd and sad.

title: Microsofts Chief Wants You to Know Hes a Different Kind of Leader
description: MICROSOFT WORDS: Its been three years since Satya Nadella replaced Steve Ballmer as chief executive of Microsoft  just long enough, it seems, to write a book, Hit Refresh, all about how Nadella is a different kind of leader running a different kind of company. Its not that we had lost our soul, Nadella writes (dubiously, in a book whose subtitle invokes the Quest to Rediscover Microsofts Soul), but we needed renewal, a renaissance. Elsewhere he sounds like a bummed-out consultant: Employees were tired. They were frustrated. They were fed up with losing and falling behind.  They came to Microsoft with big dreams, but it felt like all they really did was deal with upper management, execute taxing processes and bicker in meetings. In other words, they were shocked to find they worked in corporate America.

As we left the theater, we couldnt avoid walking past Mr. Weinstein, who was pressed up close to a younger, much smaller man in the hallway.

description: Tom Alter, an Indian-born character actor of American descent who spent his career playing Westerners in Bollywood films, died on Sept. 29 at his home in Mumbai. He was 67.

description: AUSTIN, Tex.  In the wake of the Las Vegas massacre, Congress and even the National Rifle Association seem on the verge of a breakthrough: regulating the so-called bump stocks used in that killing spree, aftermarket devices that effectively turn legal, semiautomatic rifles into deadly, automatic weapons of war.

description: LONDON  Those inclined to the view that no price can be placed on freedom have presumably missed the action in the Spanish bond market.

title: After Hurricanes, Schools Accommodate Puerto Rican Students
description: Students from Puerto Rico and the United States Virgin Islands who attend the State University of New York will pay in-state tuition this school year, the SUNY board of trustees said Friday.

title: Procter & Gamble Bets on Electoral Math to Keep Nelson Peltz Away
description: Procter & Gamble is counting on a variation of Americas electoral arithmetic as its best hope for keeping Nelson Peltz off the board of directors. Theres no particularly good reason for shareholders to deny a seat at the table to the pushy investor, whose hedge fund, Trian Partners, owns 1.5 percent of the $235 billion diapers-to-shampoo conglomerate. Yet as at the ballot box, a combination of voter apathy and arcane rules is likely to leave three investors holding all the cards at Tuesdays annual meeting.

title: Blade Runner, Serving Sexy Replicant Looks for Fall
description: Blade Runner 2049" may be the most well-funded sequel ever made to a movie that both tanked at the box office and got creamed by critics.

title: Game Over. Iraqi Forces See Beginning of the End for ISIS
description: HAWIJA, Iraq  The jubilant outpouring that erupted in the heart of Hawija on Friday, the day after Iraqi forces claimed victory there, celebrated more than the fact that the Islamic State militants had finally been routed from the city, their last major urban stronghold in Iraq.

title: Our Loved Ones Died. We Want Action on Guns.
description: Columbine. Virginia Tech. Sandy Hook. We are survivors and the family of the dead. We call on Republican leaders to take action after the massacre in Las Vegas.

title: Open Thread: This Week in Style News
description: Each week, the Open Thread newsletter will offer a look from across The New York Times at the forces that shape the dress codes we share, with Vanessa Friedman as your personal shopper. The latest newsletter appears here. To receive it in your inbox, register here.

title: Europe Looks to Congress in Fight to Save Iran Nuclear Pact
description: BRUSSELS  Having apparently lost the fight to dissuade President Trump from decertifying the Iran nuclear deal, the European countries that signed the pact are now looking to the United States Congress as a last chance to preserve the treaty and some shred of Western unity.

title: Fearsome Plague Epidemic Strikes Madagascar
description: Madagascar has been struck by a fast-spreading outbreak of plague, creating panic and prompting the World Health Organization to send 1.2 million doses of antibiotics to the island nation.

title: Three Men Charged in 2016 Plot to Bomb New York City
description: A plot to detonate bombs in Times Square and the New York City subway system and to open fire at concert venues last year was quietly thwarted, federal authorities disclosed on Friday.

title: Canada Letter: Thanksgiving, Old Photos and Guns
description: As most readers of this newsletter know, this weekend belongs to the real Thanksgiving. And one of the Canadians at The Times, Kerri MacDonald, a photo editor from Guelph, Ontario, has a special project to mark the holiday. Ill let her explain.

title: After 78 Killings, a Honduran Drug Lord Partners With the U.S.
description: TEGUCIGALPA, HONDURAS  The number of murders the Honduran drug lord admitted to orchestrating over 10 years was stunning.

title: Las Vegas, Harvey Weinstein, Hurricane Nate: Your Friday Evening Briefing
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: Harvey Weinsteins Money Shouldnt Buy Democrats Silence
description: For years, Harvey Weinstein, a film and television producer at the apex of the American entertainment industry, has lavished money and attention on the Democratic Partys biggest names and causes.

title: Bana al-Abed: From a Syrian War Zone to New York City
description: As airstrikes rained down on Aleppo while the Syrian government wrested the city from rebel forces, Bana al-Abed and her mother, Fatemah, were tweeting daily about life under siege.

title: Trump Takes Away Fundamental Health Care for Women
description: The average American woman spends just three years pregnant or trying to become pregnant, and a full 30 years trying not to be pregnant. So its no surprise that birth control is a standard part of most womens lives. In fact, roughly nine out of 10 women will use birth control during their lifetime.

title: Red Sox Lament in Houston: Theyve Done Everything Right
description: HOUSTON  No team in baseball slugs like the Houston Astros. Their hitting coach, Dave Hudgens, tells them not to swing unless they think they can hit a home run. In the first two games of these playoffs, they have slammed six. Their ballpark locomotive, which clangs merrily above left field after every big hit, has been rolling.

title: Jack Good, Who Put Rock n Roll on TV With Shindig, Dies at 86
description: Jack Good, who popularized rock n roll on British television in the 1950s, then followed the British invasion to the United States, where he produced Shindig, a prime-time series with a frantic pace, go-go dancers and guests like the Beatles, James Brown and the Rolling Stones, died on Sept. 24 in Oxfordshire, England. He was 86.

title: Malliotakis Outpaces de Blasio in Latest Fund-Raising Period
description: Nicole Malliotakis, the Republican candidate for mayor, raised more money than Mayor Bill de Blasio did in late September, according to information submitted to the New York City Campaign Finance Board.

title: California Treasurer Urges State Pension Funds to Drop Gun Sellers
description: John Chiang, Californias treasurer, urged board members of the states pension funds on Friday to divest holdings of retailers that sell guns and ammunition around the country that are illegal in California, which has stricter gun laws than most states. The letter came in the wake of this weeks mass shooting in Las Vegas that left 59 dead and more than 500 wounded.

title: New York City Will Sue State Over $380 Million Withheld for Uninsured
description: Ratcheting up the pressure in a bitter battle between New York City and the state over health care costs, the citys public hospital system is planning on suing New York State officials over a payment of some $380 million in federal funding it says the state is unlawfully withholding.

title: M.L.B. Says Apple Watch in Diamondbacks Dugout Was Not Used to Cheat
description: CLEVELAND  It was an honest mistake. That was the conclusion by Major League Baseball on Friday after it investigated why an Arizona Diamondbacks coach was wearing a digital watch in the dugout during his teams wild card victory over the Colorado Rockies on Wednesday night.

title: Ralphie May, 45, Comedian Who Happens to Be Fat, Dies
description: Ralphie May, a loud and large comedian known for his extensive touring and comedy specials on Netflix and other outlets, died on Friday in Las Vegas, where he had been in residence at Harrahs casino. He was 45.

title: New G.E. Chief Shakes Up Management Team
description: General Electric announced on Friday the departure of three senior executives, a further sign that John L. Flannery, the companys new chief executive, is moving quickly to chart a different course from that of his predecessor, Jeffrey R. Immelt.

title: Why Do We Ignore Initiatives That Reduce Gun Violence?
description: In the wake of this weeks devastation in Las Vegas, it is important to remember that this kind of headline-grabbing mass shooting constitutes only a tiny fraction of the gun murders in our country. There were over 8,000 gunshot homicides in 2014, according to the F.B.I.s most recent calculations, and gun violence is the first and second leading cause of death for African-American and Latino males between ages 15 and 34.

title: Mattis Discloses Part of Afghanistan Battle Plan, but It Hasnt Yet Been Carried Out
description: WASHINGTON  Defense Secretary Jim Mattis, normally reluctant to speak publicly about American troops deployed around the globe, took a different tack this week on Capitol Hill.

title: How the Draft Reshaped America
description: Greeting: You are hereby ordered for induction in the Armed Forces of the United States. In 1967, more than 300,000 American men opened envelopes with this statement inside. Few pieces of mail ever incited the same combination of panic, anticipation and resignation as a draft notice. The words struck terror in the hearts of many recipients. Others found them comforting after years of waiting for the Selective Service System to come calling.

title: Clevelands Jose Ramirez: The $50,000 Bargain Who Just Hit 56 Doubles
description: CLEVELAND  The day that Jose Ramirez became a Cleveland Indian happened almost by chance. If it were not for a scout turning his attention away from the highly prized prospects in front of him and instead settling his gaze on a smaller, overlooked switch-hitter, Ramirez might be somewhere else today instead of in Major League Baseball.

title: Now a Hurricane, Nate Is Aiming for Gulf Coast
description: NEW ORLEANS  Laurent Paige, 66, waved to his neighbor on Friday from his front-porch swing in the Broadmoor neighborhood of this city.

title: Mr. Trumps Attack on Birth Control
description: Under the guise of protecting religious freedom and moral sensibilities, the Trump administration is making it harder for women to get access to birth control. On Friday, it rolled back an Obama-era rule requiring most employers to provide their employees with birth control coverage without co-payments. The mandate, established under the Affordable Care Act, has helped millions of women avoid unwanted pregnancy by eliminating out-of-pockets costs for contraception.

title: My Stomach Dropped: Harrowing Night for Twin Brothers of the Las Vegas Police
description: LAS VEGAS  It was the first overtime shift Detective Casey Clarkson had worked in four years. But he wanted the money and he figured a country music festival would be fun.

title: In Texas, a Defiant Mood at an Outdoor Music Festival
description: AUSTIN, Tex.  A few hours before a gunman shot up an outdoor concert in Las Vegas, horrifying the nation, Tyler Costolo bought tickets for another big music extravaganza  Austin City Limits Music Festival, the annual celebration that kicked off Friday afternoon.

title: Harvey Weinsteins Media Enablers
description: Now that The New York Times has put together a stomach-turning chronicle of alleged sexual harassment by the movie mogul Harvey Weinstein  complete with brave, on-the-record statements from, among others, the actress Ashley Judd  were hearing a lot about how the story of his misconduct was the worst-kept secret in Hollywood and New York.

title: Dont Ban the Bomb
description: War, Georges Clemenceau supposedly said, is too serious a matter to be left to military men. Maybe its time for someone to say that peace is too serious a matter to be left to pacifists.

title: Trump Administration Formally Lifts Sanctions on Sudan
description: WASHINGTON  The Trump administration announced Friday that it would formally lift a host of sanctions against Sudan, concluding that decades of punitive efforts had done little to encourage reforms or fully resolve a conflict in the Darfur region that once inspired protests.

title: ArtPrize Awards Go to Portrait Made of Pennies and Video of a Meal
description: A portrait of Abraham Lincoln made entirely from pennies, and a video recording of a meal for 250 people at a 300-foot table meant to represent a range of world food cultures, were the top winners Friday night at the 2017 ArtPrize competition in Grand Rapids, Mich.

title: Rubin Museum Looks to the Future With a New Director, Jorrit Britschgi
description: Impermanence, according to Buddhists, is one of the three characteristics of reality. This was borne out on a small scale Thursday when the Rubin Museum of Art announced that they had appointed Jorrit Britschgi as their new executive director.

title: Mr. Trump, Dont Scrap the Iran Deal
description: If President Trump refuses to certify that Iran is complying with the nuclear deal this month, he will be making his most feckless foreign policy decision yet. Dont do it, Mr. President. Be a statesman, listen to your own military and intelligence officials and put the security of America and its allies ahead of your ego.

title: The Iran Nuclear Deal Isnt Worth Saving
description: Jerusalem  The only alternative to the Iran nuclear deal is war. That is what the Obama administration and proponents of the Joint Comprehensive Plan of Action with Iran claimed in 2015. Nobody in the Middle East believed that the United States would ever strike Iran, but enough Americans did that the deal went through.

title: Body of Abducted Mexican Journalist Is Found
description: MEXICO CITY  The body of a photographer was found Friday in the northern state of San Luis Potos, a day after he was abducted from his home by men dressed as police officers, Mexican officials said.

title: Dogs, Saints and Columbus Day
description: Columbus Day weekend! An excellent time to celebrate the history of our nation and have another fight about statues.

title: With Christian Pulisic Driving, United States Steers Closer to World Cup
description: ORLANDO, Fla.  The goal the United States national team needed arrived after only eight minutes. Soon there was another. And another.

title: Anthony Rendon Is the Nationals Mr. Anonymous. He Shouldnt Be.
description: WASHINGTON  In the fall of 2011, not long after the Washington Nationals selected third baseman Anthony Rendon with the sixth overall draft pick, he was taking batting practice at the teams spring training facility in Florida.

title: Dystopian Backdrop
description: SATURDAY PUZZLE  Im going to do something a bit different today. Ive spilled a few clues, but I want you to get through the puzzle yourself, mostly so you will appreciate the rest of the column. Ive been looking for an opportunity to develop my Lewis Black impression, and this is it.

title: A German Who Explains Trump
description: BRANDENBURG AN DER HAVEL, Germany  Klaus Riedelsdorf calls himself a German patriot. Hes tired of German shame over its Nazi past: enough of schuldkult, or guilt celebration. He did not give up East Germany, a vassal state to Moscow, to join a united Germany thats a vassal state to the European Union and Washington. He wants his country back. We need to be sovereign in our land, he tells me.

title: What I Learned About Cops From Baseball
description: Almost exactly 15 years ago and 1,000 miles from where I was playing in the final game of my major league season, my father passed away in New Jersey. A week later, we honored his life in a poetic ceremony in my hometown, Teaneck. A procession of people lined up  people of many faiths, many cultures. It reflected the magnetism of the man, and it also framed my parents decision, many years earlier, to join a community committed to diversity. On display was an authentic subset of the United Nations.

title: Making Encounters With Police Officers Safer for People With Disabilities
description: An Op-Ed essay last month about the fraught encounter between an Arizona teenager with autism, Connor Leibel, and a police officer inspired thoughtful comments, so we invited the author, Steve Silberman, to address a few in this follow-up. Comments have been edited for clarity and length.

title: Yankees Take Control Early, Then Suffer a Crushing Defeat
description: CLEVELAND  After Gary Sanchez and Aaron Hicks slugged home runs on Friday night off the Cleveland Indians ace Corey Kluber and helped send him to an early exit and then a five-run Yankees lead was turned over to their indomitable bullpen, they seemed destined to return to New York with their American League division series tied at a game apiece.

title: Army Accident at Ft. Jackson Kills 2 Soldiers and Injures 6
description: Two soldiers were killed and six others were injured on Friday in what military officials called a tragic accident at Fort Jackson in South Carolina.

title: Corrections: October 7, 2017
description: FRONT PAGE

title: Germanys Shift to Green Power Stalls, Despite Huge Investments
description: BETZIGAU, Germany  Katharina Zinneckers farm in the foothills of the German Alps has been in the family since 1699. But to squeeze a living from it today, she and her husband need to do more than sell the milk from their herd of cows.

title: Whats on TV Saturday: Spielberg and Clueless
description: A new documentary surveys the life and work of Steven Spielberg. And Clueless captures the fashion dos and donts of the 90s.

title: Cubs Open Title Defense With a One-Two Punch From Bryant and Rizzo
description: WASHINGTON  Kris Bryant and Anthony Rizzo form the formidable heart of the Chicago Cubs lineup. So when Stephen Strasburg, the Washington Nationals starter, made them look silly in their first two at-bats of Game 1 of a National League division series on Friday night, it was a notable feat. They are rarely overmatched so completely in the same game.

title: 5 Things to Cook While Watching Arrested Development Reruns
description: The fifth season of Arrested Development doesnt arrive until next year, but until then, you can get your fix of frozen bananas and Bluth family egotism by streaming reruns of the show on Netflix.

title: Why Arent Wages Rising Faster Now That Unemployment Is Lower?
description: When labor markets tighten, wages are expected to rise. But in recent years, as unemployment has fallen below 5 percent in the United States, wages have not been increasing as fast as in the past. Economists debate the reasons; workers grapple with the consequences.

title: Rebuilding After Harvey: Our Son Needs Us
description: Kyle Almaguer has a rare syndrome that has kept him in hospitals for most of his life. When Hurricane Harvey hit, his parents struggled to get him to safety. Now they face the daunting task of rebuilding.

title: A Year After a Hurricane, Stepping Out of Limbo in Haiti
description: The remote Haitian island of le--Vache was devastated by Hurricane Matthew in October 2016. Some residents have been able to rebuild their homes. For others, it is taking longer.

title: I Applaud the Women With Courage to Step Forward
description: Here are the top 10 comments of the week on our digital platforms, as selected by our readers and the journalists who moderate nearly every comment. Some comments were edited for length and clarity.

title: As Overdose Deaths Pile Up, a Medical Examiner Quits the Morgue
description: CONCORD, N.H.  In the state morgue here, in the industrial maze of a hospital basement, Dr. Thomas A. Andrew was slicing through the lung of a 36-year-old woman when white foam seeped out onto the autopsy table.

title: Once Shunned as Drivers, Saudi Women Who Fought Ban Now Celebrate
description: They were arrested, suspended from jobs, shunned by relatives and denounced by clerics as loose women out to destroy society. Their offense? They did what many in Saudi Arabia considered unthinkable: getting in cars and driving.

title: Global Economys Stubborn Reality: Plenty of Work, Not Enough Pay
description: LILLESTROM, Norway  In the three-plus decades since Ola Karlsson began painting houses and offices for a living, he has seen oil wealth transform the Norwegian economy. He has participated in a construction boom that has refashioned Oslo, the capital. He has watched the rent climb at his apartment in the center of the city.

title: As Cancer Tears Through Africa, Drug Makers Draw Up a Battle Plan
description: NAIROBI, Kenya  In a remarkable initiative modeled on the campaign against AIDS in Africa, two major pharmaceutical companies, working with the American Cancer Society, will steeply discount the prices of cancer medicines in Africa.

title: Americans Jailed After Failed Coup in Turkey Are Hostages to Politics
description: HATAY, Turkey  One is a NASA scientist who was vacationing with relatives in Turkey. Another is a Christian missionary who has lived in Turkey for 23 years. Others include a visiting chemistry professor from Pennsylvania and his brother, a real estate agent.

title: Danish Police Recover Body Parts of the Journalist Kim Wall
description: STOCKHOLM  The Danish police said on Saturday that divers had recovered the severed head and legs of the Swedish journalist Kim Wall in a bay, as well as crucial evidence that is inconsistent with a Danish inventors explanation of how she had died on his submarine.

title: For Madison Cox, Widower of Pierre Berg, Cest Compliqu
description: As two museums devoted to the designer Yves Saint Laurent open this month, in Paris and Marrakesh, there has been plenty of chatter in fashion and cafe society (whats left of it) about the estate of Pierre Berg, the pugnacious business brain behind the original Yves Saint Laurent fashion empire.

title: Without Harvey Weinstein, Is There a Weinstein Company?
description: LOS ANGELES  A bicoastal staff meeting of the Weinstein Company was hastily convened late Thursday. Staff members were scared and shaken after public complaints of sexual harassment against Harvey Weinstein, the entertainment companys pugnacious co-founder. With the help of a video conferencing system, David Glasser, the Weinstein Companys president and chief operating officer, tried to rally the troops.

title: In Cuba, Sourcing Style
description: Angel Lazaro, 29, was hanging out with his friends (who call him Mayito) at Bar Roma, on the rooftop of a 1920s building in Old Havana. Mr. Lazaro hadnt ended up at the bar from seeing it on the street. There was no sign outside indicating that a ride up in a rickety open-air elevator would lead him to one of the citys most interesting watering holes.

title: On an Oregon Lake, a Lodge Serving Kicked-Up Camp Food
description: There are fish sandwiches, and then there is the fish and chips sandwich at the Boathouse, an all-day counter service spot tucked into an actual former boathouse at the Suttle Lodge, a magisterial 1930s-era property located in central Oregons Deschutes National Forest. A brawny trout filet is encrusted in pulverized Kettle brand potato chips, fried golden brown, and crammed into a squishy potato bun like a linebacker into a tutu. Accompanied by tartar sauce, pickles and iceberg lettuce, its less a sandwich than a piping-hot mess of pleasure.

title: Odell Beckham Jr. on a Nike-Powered Swing Through SoHo
description: On a recent Wednesday night, Odell Beckham Jr. and his phalanx of security guards and cronies poured through a back entrance at the House of Morgan, an imposing financial district landmark that was once the headquarters of J.P. Morgan and is now an event space. Todays business was selling shoes, and the New York Giants star receiver was there to promote a new Nike collection from Virgil Abloh, the designer of Off-White.

title: Whatever Happened to Just Being Type A?
description: A few years ago, Gretchen Rubin, the best-selling self-help author, pivoted from the happiness racket into the habit business with her seventh book, Better Than Before: Mastering the Habits of Our Everyday Lives. Embedded in it was a personality typing system of her own invention she called the Four Tendencies: a homage to Freuds fateful tendencies.

title: In Catalonia Independence Push, Policing Becomes Politicized
description: SANT BOI DE LLOBREGAT, Spain  Standing in front of his apartment across from barracks occupied by Spains national police, Xavi Gomez recounted the dueling protests over Catalonian independence that unfolded on his street the previous night.

title: Schooled in Scandal: What Makes Ukraine a Hotbed of Intrigue
description: POLTAVA, Ukraine  After four years of investigation by the German police, the F.B.I. and other crime-fighting agencies around the world, heavily armed security officers stormed an apartment in the central Ukrainian town of Poltava. After a brief exchange of gunfire, they captured their prey: the man suspected of leading a cybercrime gang accused of stealing more than $100 million.

title: Transgender Brazilians Embrace Hit Soap Opera: Now You Can See Us
description: RIO DE JANEIRO  Edge of Desire, a popular prime-time soap opera chronicling the transition of a transgender man, was about to start, and the residents at a shelter seemed oblivious to the sirens wailing outside and the cockroaches navigating a maze of dirty feet and popcorn bowls on the floor.

title: Do I Have to Allow a Private Investigator Into My Apartment?
description: Q. I live a in a rent-regulated apartment complex in Corona, Queens. The landlord hired a private investigator to inspect every apartment to ensure the level of quality in the building. The inspection company, run by retired police officers, specializes in criminal investigations and surveillance, and uses policing techniques. Tenants must provide photo identification and sign an inspection checklist. This feels like an invasion of privacy that goes beyond typical maintenance-related inspections. Must I comply? If I refuse, could the landlord evict me?

title: Yemenis See Turning Point After Ousting Qaeda Militants in South
description: AZZAN, Yemen  As hundreds of Yemeni troops rolled in here in August to attack Qaeda militants, secondary school students were sitting for final exams. Helicopters buzzed overhead and armed vehicles patrolled the streets, but the schools principal, Saleh Al Wahidi, did not dismiss his students.

title: At Least 11 Injured After Driver Crashes Car Into Pedestrians Near London History Museum
description: LONDON  The London police arrested a man on Saturday after his car jumped the curb and crashed into several pedestrians near the Natural History Museum, injuring at least 11 people, the authorities said.

title: Hoping to Have Trump Cleared, Legal Team Eases Resistance to Inquiry
description: WASHINGTON  White House officials once debated a scorched-earth strategy of publicly criticizing and undercutting Robert S. Mueller III, the special counsel investigating Russian efforts to disrupt last years election. Now, President Trumps lawyers are pursuing a different course: cooperating with the special counsel in the hope that Mr. Mueller will declare in the coming months that Mr. Trump is not a target of the Russia inquiry.

title: In Long-Isolated Sudan, Lot of Excitement as U.S. Sanctions End
description: NAIROBI, Kenya  Sudan Airways regularly ranks among the worst airlines in the world. The national carrier has only one working plane, and it has suffered so many deadly accidents in recent years that passengers have acquired the habit of praying before takeoff.

title: How Pet Snakes Set Off an Unlikely Chain of Events That Could Make You Sick
description: Opossums, raccoons and deer all but disappeared from Everglades National Park in Florida after the Burmese python invaded. When they vanished, mosquitos turned to feeding on rats that can carry encephalitis. That could put humans at risk.

title: Variety: Cryptic Crossword
description: VARIETY PUZZLE  Ive known about cryptic crosswords for a long time, but I always thought that I would never be able to solve them, what with all those mystifying clues. Shame on me.

title: Who Was Stephen Paddock? The Mystery of a Nondescript Numbers Guy
description: LAS VEGAS  Stephen Paddock was a contradiction: a gambler who took no chances. A man with houses everywhere who did not really live in any of them. Someone who liked the high life of casinos but drove a nondescript minivan and dressed casually, even sloppily, in flip-flops and sweatsuits. He did not use Facebook or Twitter, but spent the past 25 years staring at screens of video poker machines.

title: Tropical Storm Nate Kills 22 in Central America Amid Flooding and Landslides
description: Tropical Storm Nate barreled up the eastern coast of Central America this week, leaving destruction in its wake before being upgraded to a category 1 hurricane as it moved toward the United States.

title: Amid Catalan Crisis, Thousands Hold Rallies in Madrid and Barcelona
description: BARCELONA, Spain  Thousands of people took to the streets for rallies in Madrid and Barcelona on Saturday as Catalan leaders appeared on the verge of announcing a unilateral declaration of independence from Spain, setting up a potential showdown with the national government.

title: Solving the Opioid Epidemic
description: To the Editor:

title: The Resistance, Raising Big Money, Upends Liberal Politics
description: WASHINGTON  It started as a scrappy grass-roots protest movement against President Trump, but now the so-called resistance is attracting six- and seven-figure checks from major liberal donors, posing an insurgent challenge to some of the lefts most venerable institutions  and the Democratic Party itself.

title: Car Crashes Into Pedestrians in London
description: The London police detained a driver on Saturday after his car injured several pedestrians near the Natural History Museum. The crash, police said, appeared to be a road traffic collision and not terrorism.

title: Joseph Schmitt, 101, Spacesuit Technician for Early Astronauts, Dies
description: Joseph W. Schmitt, who as one of NASAs earliest suit techs was often the last person to have face-to-face contact with astronauts before they shot skyward on their historic missions, died on Sept. 25 in Friendswood, Tex. He was 101.

title: Minus Electrical Grid, Puerto Rico Becomes Generator Island
description: SAN JUAN, P.R.  Like many other frivolous things on the island these days, the shiny motorcycles at the Planet Honda showroom have been pushed to the side.

title: Russians, Heeding Navalnys Call, Mark Putins Birthday With Protest
description: MOSCOW  Answering a protest call issued from behind bars by the jailed Russian opposition leader Aleksei A. Navalny, small crowds of mostly young people gathered in towns across Russia on Saturday in a wave of nationwide demonstrations. The protests were timed to coincide with the 65th birthday of President Vladimir V. Putin.

title: Schumer Says He Rebuffed Another Offer From Trump on Health Care
description: WASHINGTON  President Trump reached out to the Senate Democratic leader, Chuck Schumer, on Friday to propose yet another effort to repeal and replace the Affordable Care Act, but Mr. Schumer later said he had quickly shot down the offer.

title: Lisa Bloom, Lawyer Advising Harvey Weinstein, Resigns Amid Criticism From Board Members
description: The lawyer Lisa Bloom resigned on Saturday as an adviser to Harvey Weinstein, the high-powered film producer facing allegations of rampant sexual harassment, amid harsh criticism of her handling of his defense.

title: Hosting Proms and Selling Cows: North Korean Embassies Scrounge for Cash
description: SOFIA, Bulgaria  While the embassies of most countries promote the interests of companies back home, North Koreas are in business for themselves.

title: While the U.S. Talks of War, South Korea Shudders
description: SEOUL, South Korea  I cannot turn my thoughts from the news article I happened to see a few days ago. A man in his 70s accidentally dropped two thick wads of cash in the street. Two people who happened upon this bundle of money and shared it between them were caught by the police, made to give up the money and charged with theft.

title: Yes, Steve Bannon Should Terrify You
description: Remember all the talk, before Steve Bannon was expectorated from the Trump administration, that hed be a worse menace on the outside than on the inside?

title: No, That Robot Will Not Steal Your Job
description: The recovery from the crisis of 2008 has been one of the weakest on record, but never in postwar history has so little growth created so many jobs. The unemployment rate in the developed world is down to 5.5 percent and approaching a 40-year low. This flies in the face of all the dire warnings about a jobless future.

title: Co-Parenting With Alexa
description: You are going to have a chance to play with Alexa, I told my daughter, Grace, whos 3 years old. Pointing at the black cylindrical device, I explained that the speaker, also known as the Amazon Echo, was a bit like Siri but smarter. You can ask it anything you want, I said nonchalantly.

title: N.R.A. and G.O.P., Together Forever
description: FOR years, Republicans have effectively outsourced their thought leadership to the loudmouths at the end of the bar. But perhaps the most extreme example of that trend has been the issue of guns, where the party has ceded control to a gun lobby that has built its brand on absolutism.

title: The Pigs of Liberalism
description: If you are surprised by the news that Harvey Weinstein of Miramax fame, a man well known for profane tirades and physical altercations and scrounging M&Ms off movie theater floors, is also the sort of charmer who loafs around semi-nude while asking subordinates for back massages, then you can be surprised by just about anything: the sun rising in the east, the fact that movie stars employ plastic surgeons, the news that The Artist didnt actually deserve to win Best Picture.

title: Confessions of a Sensible Gun Owner
description: BEND, Ore.  When we hike together, my oldest son, who is 5, scans the ground for the perfect gun. His ideal stick has an ergonomic crook in it and is a comfortable size to hold. When he finds one like that, he lifts it for a test fire  pew, pew. A mile in, hes usually got one in each hand but is still on the lookout for an upgrade: anything smoother or more gunlike. My youngest, who is 2, isnt far behind. Hes been saying the word gun for more than a year.

title: Seeing Trump Through a Glass, Darkly
description: ITS an odd feeling when you find yourself effectively living on an island unconnected to people with whom you were once politically close. But its a feeling with which Ive become very familiar.

title: Our Changing Climate Mind-Set
description: Climate images have never been able to convey our full planetary danger until now. The extraordinary recent four-punch sequence of hurricanes  Harvey, Irma, Jose and Maria  threatened the lives of millions of people, obliterated their homes and has raised doubts that some places will ever recover. The rest of us have a newly immediate sense of catastrophes of biblical proportions. As meaning-hungry creatures we search for explanations. No wonder some have embraced the apocalyptic narrative of total destruction by an angry deity. And no wonder that climate-change rejecters like President Trump have increasing difficulty defending their position.

title: When an Epidemic Is Personal
description: Heres how I imagined it would go over the summer: He would have come up to stay with me and my husband for a long weekend, maybe a week even, away from the friends who gave him shelter when he was using drugs. From the specter that seemed to surface every few months like clockwork. Wed known him since he was in the womb, but that wasnt the same as knowing him now. Still, we thought hed come to stay and go to the beach nearby and body surf and stroll along the esplanade, smoking, gazing out at the swans and the geese he loved to feed back when he was a little boy and would come to visit.

title: Robert E. Lee, Christopher Columbus ... and Ptain?
description: Bill de Blasio, born Warren Wilhelm Jr., has long identified with his Italian heritage, bequeathed by his mothers family. But to the organizers of a Columbus Day parade that will be held Sunday in the Bronx, the mayor is, as one of them put it, a fake Italian. He will not reign on their parade. Thats because he is conspicuously not invited (though he plans to march Monday in the big Columbus Day procession along Fifth Avenue).

title: Seeing the North Korean Stalemate From the Other Side
description: Pyongyang, North Korea  North Koreas capital city is awash in propaganda. Posters depicting missiles, some striking the United States Capitol, hang along major streets. In recent days, a million civilians, including high school students, factory workers and older men who long ago completed their military service, have signed up at the governments request to fight the United States, if needed.

title: Who Invented Zero?
description: Carbon dating of an ancient Indian document, the Bakhshali manuscript, has recently placed the first written occurrence of the number zero in the third or fourth century A.D., about 500 years earlier than previously believed. While the news has no practical bearing on the infrastructure of zeros (and ones) underlying our high-tech civilization, it does remind us how indebted we are for this invention. But to whom is this debt owed? And how should it be repaid?

title: Nelly Arrested Following Tour-Bus Rape Accusation
description: Nelly, the multiplatinum St. Louis rapper, was arrested early Saturday morning in Auburn, Wash., after a woman accused the musician of raping her on his tour bus, according to local police.

title: Mexican Radio Hosts Resignation Highlights Ties Between Government and Media
description: MEXICO CITY  Last Thursday, as it has for nearly a dozen years, Leonardo Curzios radio show delivered lively debate. This time around, his team of analysts harshly criticized a pair of policy initiatives floated in recent weeks by, among others, the political party of Mexicos president, Enrique Pea Nieto.

title: Hurricane Nate Makes Landfall on the Gulf Coast, Then Weakens
description: BILOXI, Miss.  This years crushing hurricanes have submerged Houston, wrecked the Florida Keys and decimated Puerto Rico, but spared the central Gulf Coast  at least until now.

title: Connie Hawkins, Electrifying N.B.A. Forward Barred in His Prime, Dies at 75
description: Connie Hawkins, a high-flying basketball sensation who was molded on the playgrounds of New York and inducted into the Basketball Hall of Fame, but whose career was unjustly derailed when the N.B.A. barred him until his prime years had passed on suspicions of involvement in a college point-shaving scandal, died on Friday. He was 75.

title: Death of Chicago Teenager Found in Walk-In Freezer Is Ruled an Accident
description: The death of a Chicago teenager, whose body was discovered last month in the walk-in freezer of a hotel, has been ruled an accident by the Cook County Medical Examiners Office in Illinois.

title: Joe Girardi, Upon Review, Offers a Rare Mea Culpa: I Screwed Up
description: If you want to draw the conclusion that Manager Joe Girardi with his jut-jawed, crew-cut appearance, his degree in engineering and the phone-book-thick binder he once kept at his ready in the dugout  is meticulous in his preparation, who is he to argue?

title: Polish Catholics Gather at Border for Vast Rosary Prayer Event
description: WARSAW, Poland  Polish Catholics clutching rosary beads gathered at locations along the countrys 2,000-mile border on Saturday for a mass demonstration during which they prayed for salvation for Poland and the world.

title: Power Ballads
description: SUNDAY PUZZLE  Sometimes you have to bring your solving superpowers to the crossword, and sometimes the crossword brings its superpowers to you. Today, we have a fabulous example of the latter, plus its been set to music in a way.

title: A Game of Phone Tag and Hes It
description: Lisa Susanne Bridge and Gilad Berenstein were married Oct. 7 at the Crystal Gardens in Victoria, British Columbia, Canada. Rabbi Daniel Weiner officiated.

title: It All Started With Smiles Across a Crowd
description: Elisabeth Ness Schneider and Edward Steven Nescot are to be married Oct. 8. Rabbi Benjamin H. Spratt is to officiate at the Palace Theater in Waterbury, Conn.

title: You Could Still End Up With Your Best Friend
description: Michelle Edwina Wonsley and James DeLano Ford were married Oct. 5. Kim P. Kirkley, a minister of First Nation Church, officiated at 632 on Hudson, an events space in Manhattan.

title: Quotation of the Day: As Hawija Falls, Iraqi Forces See the Beginning of the End for ISIS
description: Their leaders failed them. A lot of fighters ran away. The rest, we killed.

title: Quotation of the Day: Father of Injured Girl Speaks, and Yankees Pledge Longer Nets
description: There is a safer way. A way where a 2-year-old girl doesnt end up in a hospital bed, a way that people dont get hit with bats and balls, a way where people dont leave a game on a stretcher.

title: The New Washington: Once Racing to Flee the Senate, Marco Rubio Now Digs In
description: During his run for president, Marco Rubio took plenty of fire for being an absentee senator. He now concedes that his day job might, indeed, have suffered.

title: Quotation of the Day: Shaping Gender Perceptions in Brazil, an Episode at a Time
description: Weve always been invisible. At least now people have the chance to open their hearts. At least now you can see us.

title: Corrections: October 8, 2017
description: BOOK REVIEW

title: Trump Poised to Sign Order Opening New Paths to Health Insurance
description: WASHINGTON  Stymied in his efforts to repeal the Affordable Care Act, President Trump is poised to issue an order that could ease some federal rules governing health insurance and make it easier for people to band together and buy coverage on their own, administration officials said Saturday.

title: Gas Station Explosion in Ghana Kills at Least 7 and Injures Over 100
description: LAGOS, Nigeria  An explosion at a gas station in Ghanas capital killed at least seven people and injured more than 130 others on Saturday, government officials and news reports said.

title: Here's the Democracy Alliance's 'Resistance Map'
description: The Democracy Alliance's 'resistance map' includes a mix of new and older groups to which the club is recommending its members donate to oppose the Trump administration.

title: Nationals Stage a Late Comeback, Perhaps Exorcising Postseason Demons
description: WASHINGTON  Standing near home plate on Saturday, the Washington Nationals Bryce Harper briefly admired his handiwork, a game-tying, second-deck, two-run homer in the eighth inning. As he ran to first base, Harper pointed to the once-tense Nationals dugout.

title: Melissa Heuer, Alex Mangini
description: Melissa Mariani Heuer and Alex Joseph Mangini are to be married Oct. 8 at the Boathouse in Prospect Park in Brooklyn. The Rev. Mark E. Erson, a Lutheran minister, is to officiate.

title: Sarah Gitlin, Tao Tan
description: Sarah Schrager Gitlin and Tao Tan were married Oct. 7 in an outdoor ceremony at the Hunter Airport in Hunter, N.Y. Rabbi Sarah Batya Joselow officiated.

title: Sandra Kreis, Stephen Lacey
description: Sandra Emily Kreis and Stephen Cook Lacey were married Oct. 7 at the lagoon at the Boston Public Garden. Michael Kolodziej, a friend of the couple, officiated, having received permission from the state of Massachusetts.

title: Samantha Hirsch, Clayton Schmidt
description: Samantha Ivy Hirsch and Clayton Harrison Schmidt are to be married Oct. 8 at the Village Club at Lake Success in Great Neck, N.Y. Talia Kovacs, a Universal Life minister, is to officiate.

title: Eric Berger, Dan Amboyer
description: Eric Philip Berger, a financial adviser, and Dan Amboyer, an actor, were married Oct. 7. The Rev. Kirsty DePree, a Reformed Church in America minister, performed the ceremony at Marble Collegiate Church in New York.

title: Nicole Berkovich, Ivan Torres
description: Nicole Vladi Berkovich and Ivan Torres were married Oct. 7 at Feast at Round Hill in Washingtonville, N.Y. Ryan LeGrady, a friend of the couple who was ordained by Rose Ministries, officiated.

title: Daniel Cassidy, Jeffrey Wilkes
description: Daniel Joseph Cassidy and Jeffrey Vinson Wilkes were married Oct. 7 in Princeton, N.J. The Rev. Bill Neely, a Unitarian Universalist minister, performed the ceremony at the Unitarian Universalist Congregation of Princeton.

title: Abby Animashaun, Chimaobi Amutah
description: Abiola Abike Animashaun and Dr. Chimaobi Obilo Amutah are to be married Oct. 8 at the DoubleTree by Hilton in Danvers, Mass. Gene Corbin, a friend of the couple, who was previously ordained a Baptist minister, is to officiate. On Oct. 7, the couple and their families participated in a ceremony involving Nigerian wedding traditions.

title: Kim Kalunian, Ted Nesi
description: Kim Kalunian and Ted Nesi, television reporters in East Providence, R.I., were married Oct. 6. The Rev. Barry J. Gamache performed the ceremony at the Roman Catholic Church of St. Mary in Bristol, R.I.

title: Laura Bornstein, Bradford McFarland
description: Laura Catherine Bornstein and Bradford Kane McFarland were married Oct. 7 at Loose Park in Kansas City, Mo. The Hon. Kenneth R. Garrett III, a Jackson County Circuit Court judge, officiated.

title: Meghan Forgione, Sean Scanlon
description: Meghan Denise Forgione and State Representative Sean Matthew Scanlon were married Oct. 7 by the Rev. Stephen Sledesky, a Roman Catholic priest, at St. George Church in Guilford, Conn.

title: Sarah Davidson, Spencer Hoffman
description: Sarah Cobb Davidson and James Spencer Hoffman were married Oct. 6 at Henry Hudson Riverside Park in Hudson, N.Y. E. Shane Hoffman, the grooms brother and a Universal Life minister, officiated. On Oct. 7, the couple took part in a second ceremony, which included the exchange of rings, led by David C. Hendrickson at Midwood, a historic Hudson River estate owned by the brides grandmother Joan K. Davidson, in Germantown, N.Y.

title: Priya Fielding-Singh, Anshuman Sahoo
description: Priya Fielding-Singh and Anshuman Sahoo are to be married Oct. 8 at the Skyline Country Club in Tucson. Eric X. Li, a friend of the couple who was authorized to officiate by the state of Arizona, is to lead a ceremony incorporating Sikh, Jewish and secular wedding traditions. Earlier in the day, Pandit Shirish Kumar Sharma, a Hindu priest, is to lead a Hindu ceremony.

title: Sarah Geismer, Joshua Halloway
description: Sarah Ruth Geismer and Joshua David Halloway were married Oct. 7 at Swallow Creek Ranch in Cayucos, Calif. Alfred Uhry, a friend of the couple who became a Universal Life minister for the event, officiated.

title: Blair Crames, Ryan Silbert
description: Blair Meredith Crames and Ryan Mathew Silbert are to be married Oct. 8 at the Norwood, a private club in New York. Stan Bratskeir, a friend of the couple who became a Universal Life minister, is to officiate.

title: Elyse Casey, Michael Samuels
description: Elyse Christine Casey and Michael Fredrick Samuels were married Oct. 7 at the Scranton Cultural Center in Scranton, Pa. The Rev. Msgr. Joseph G. Quinn, a Roman Catholic priest, performed the ceremony, with Rabbi Nina H. Mandel taking part.

title: Christian Keesee, Larry Keigwin
description: Christian Kirkpatrick Keesee and Larry Keigwin were married Oct. 4 at St. Thomas Church Fifth Avenue in New York. The Rev. Canon Carl F. Turner, an Episcopal priest, and the rector there, led the ceremony.

title: Margherita Devine, Giles Robertson
description: Margherita Wisdom Devine and Giles William James Robertson were married Oct. 7 at Lincolns Inn Chapel in London. The Venerable Sheila Watson, a priest ordained by the Church of England, officiated.

title: Whats on TV Sunday: Curb and a Tom Petty Documentary
description: Watch a documentary on Tom Petty and the Heartbreakers and a basketball-centered episode of StarTalk.

title: White Nationalists Reappear in Charlottesville in Torch-Lit Protest
description: The prominent white supremacist Richard B. Spencer was a featured speaker at a rally on Saturday in Charlottesville, Va., where demonstrators reprised their chant of You will not replace us! and asserted that the South would rise again.

title: Brittany McCandless, John Farmer
description: Brittany Ann McCandless and John Paul Griffin Farmer were married Oct. 7 at the Church of the Holy Name of Jesus in New York. The Rev. Lawrence Ford, a Roman Catholic priest, performed the ceremony.

title: Meredith Truesdale, Patrick Mullane
description: Meredith Cambria Truesdale and Patrick Edward Mullane were married Oct. 7 at the SS. John and Paul Church in Larchmont, N.Y. John Shea, a Roman Catholic deacon, performed the ceremony.

title: Naomi Schneider, Brandt Tierney
description: Naomi Nicole Schneider and Brandt Michael Tierney were married Oct. 7 in Coffeyville, Kan. Monti L. Belot, a retired judge for the United States District Court for the District of Kansas, officiated at the home of the brides parents.

title: Judith Seltzer, Jon Lovitch
description: Dr. Judith Dale Seltzer and Jon David Lovitch were married Oct. 7. The Rev. Gary Shapiro, an interfaith minister, officiated on the village green in Quechee, Vt.

title: Ricki Shenfeld, Stuart Tishman
description: Ricki Lauren Shenfeld and Stuart Alexander Tishman were married Oct. 7 in New York. Rabbi Angela Warnick Buchdahl officiated at Cipriani Wall Street.

title: D. Tucker Smith, Kim Doggett
description: D. Tucker Smith and Kim Austin Doggett are to be married Oct. 8 at their home in Rosendale, N.Y. The grooms father, the Rev. Carroll Doggett, a United Methodist minister, is to officiate, with Steven Hartov, a friend of the couple, taking part in a ceremony that is to incorporate Jewish wedding traditions.

title: Madeline Sterling, Jacob Hupart
description: Dr. Madeline Rene Sterling was married Oct. 7 to Jacob Harris Hupart in Closter, N.J. Rabbi Lisa Izes officiated at Temple Emanu-El.

title: Julia Stroud, Caitlin Offinger
description: Julia Macy Stroud and Caitlin Elizabeth Offinger were married Oct. 7 in Manhattan. The Rev. Caroline M. Stacey performed the ceremony at the Church of St. Luke in the Fields.

title: Danielle Tannenbaum, David Pasch
description: Danielle Irene Tannenbaum and David Howard Pasch are to be married Oct. 8 in Nashville. Cantor Bernard Gutcheon is to perform the ceremony at Congregation Ohabai Sholom.

title: Catherine Theis, Aaron Minas
description: Catherine Marion Theis and Steven Aaron Minas were married Oct. 7 in Tucson, Ariz. The Rev. James J. Hushek, an affiliate of the Federation of Christian Ministries, officiated at the Arizona Inn.

title: Lauren Turkel, Antonio Cuervo
description: Lauren Rachel Turkel and Antonio Guiteras Cuervo were married Oct. 7 at Crabtrees Kittle House Restaurant & Inn in Chappaqua, N.Y. Dr. Mel Hawthorne, an ecumenical minister, performed the nondenominational ceremony.

title: Jordan Valutas, Toby Jacobs
description: Jordan Olivia Valutas and Matthew Tobias Jacobs were married Oct. 7. The Right Rev. Nicholas B.B. Dill, the Anglican bishop of Bermuda, performed the ceremony at St. Annes Church in Southampton, Bermuda.

title: Samantha Vega, Anthony Buckland
description: Samantha Ann Vega and Anthony Ryan Buckland were married Oct. 7 at Immaculate Conception Church in the Bronx. The Rev. Frank Skelly, a Roman Catholic priest, performed the ceremony.

title: S.N.L.: Jason Aldean Is Surprise Guest, Singing Tom Pettys I Wont Back Down
description: Saturday Night Live had to find the right tone for its first broadcast since the shooting massacre at a Las Vegas country music festival last Sunday, which killed 58 people and injured hundreds more.

title: Catalonias Push for Independence Has an Unlikely Symbol: Tractors
description: VIC, Spain  Rolling his rickety red tractor through a rural valley in Catalonia, Jordi Colom seemed like just another farmer heading to the fields. Except that he was in a line of dozens of tractors lumbering along. And cars honked in approval. People on the side of the road waved red-and-orange Catalan flags and cheered.

title: Fly Over Colorados Autumn Colors in 360
description: Stands of aspen trees grow as a single organism, each changing to the same color at the same time. Visit White River National Forest and witness their colors firsthand.

title: Homes That Sold for Around $1 Million
description: 21 North Dutcher Street, Irvington

title: Suspected ISIS Members Surrender in Iraq
description: In the days since Iraqi forces declared victory over Islamic State fighters in Hawija, the groups final urban stronghold in the country, more than 1,000 men have turned themselves in to the Kurdish authorities.

title: ISIS Fighters, Having Pledged to Fight or Die, Surrender en Masse
description: DIBIS, Iraq  The prisoners were taken to a waiting room in groups of four, and were told to stand facing the concrete wall, their noses almost touching it, their hands bound behind their backs.

title: Las Vegas, Hurricane Nate, Harvey Weinstein: Your Weekend Briefing
description: Here are the weeks top stories, and a look ahead.

title: In Trailblazing Tokyo Governor, Japan Meets Its Great Disrupter
description: TOKYO  For decades, she has been a Japanese woman breaking barriers.

title: North Korean Leader Hails Nuclear Arsenal as Powerful Deterrent
description: SEOUL, South Korea  The North Korean leader, Kim Jong-un, has vowed to build up his countrys nuclear arsenal as a powerful deterrent to the United States, state media reported, hours after President Trump said that only one thing will work in dealing with the isolated country.

title: Erik Prince, Blackwater Founder, Weighs Primary Challenge to Wyoming Republican
description: WASHINGTON  Erik Prince, the founder of the security contractor Blackwater, is seriously considering a Republican primary challenge for a Senate seat in Wyoming, potentially adding a high-profile contender to a fledgling drive to oust establishment lawmakers with insurgents in the mold of President Trump.

title: Robin Thede: A Black Woman Hosting Late Night? Thats No Joke

title: At Queens Museum, the Director Is as Political as the Art

title: New York Towns New Deal: Well Make Your Signs, You Sweep Our Streets
description: HAUPPAUGE, N.Y.  In Suffolk County, officials are trying something that would be sort of a Craigslist for municipalities: an online municipal store that will allow local mayors and supervisors to save money by shopping for common services.

title: On The Rundown, Robin Thede Is Filling a Void in Late-Night Talk
description: When her new BET late-night talk show has its premiere on Thursday, Robin Thede said it will have many components that are staples of the format, including topical jokes about politics and popular culture, comedy sketches and musical performances.

title: How Lauren Bush Lauren, C.E.O. of Feed, Spends Her Sundays
description: This year, Lauren Bush Laurens company Feed, which has provided 100 million meals to children in need around the world by allocating some of the proceeds from its handbag and jewelry sales to the cause, is celebrating its 10th anniversary. In May, the social business opened its first brick-and-mortar store, the Feed Shop & Cafe, in Dumbo, Brooklyn. Ms. Bush Lauren, 33, who is closely related to two former presidents, lives in the West Village with her husband, David Lauren, 45, who is an executive with Ralph Lauren, and their son, James Lauren, 21 months. SHIVANI VORA

title: Man Helps Kidnapped Girl and Gives Her His $7,000 Reward

title: An Architect Designed a Calmer Restaurant. It Was Very Stressful.
description: This is going to be about the room, not the food, because there wasnt any. Not yet. There sat the architect Brad Cloepfil last Wednesday, four days before the restaurant was to open  reopen, really  in a chair he had designed in middle of the room he had designed  redesigned, really  saying that the idea had been to make the room calmer.

title: I Am Spanish: Thousands in Barcelona Protest a Push for Independence
description: BARCELONA, Spain  Catalonias silent supporters of Spanish unity found their voice on Sunday, thronging into the center of Barcelona as part of a huge rally that reverberated with chants in support of a united Spanish state and against agitators for independence.

title: Holding Prosecutors Accountable Is Hard. It Could Get Harder.
description: It is already difficult for people convicted as a result of prosecutorial error to hold someone accountable for the legal transgressions that sent them to prison. But now, a federal appeals court in New York is considering a case that could, defense lawyers say, make that challenging process all but impossible.

title: Disneys Big Bet on Streaming Relies on Little-Known Tech Company

title: The Schlock Of The New
description: Im still thinking about Kevin Hassetts appearance at the Tax Policy Center, where he repaid his hosts graciousness by gratuitously impugning their integrity. But insults aside, he offered a new analysis of corporate tax incidence  an approach that is novel, innovative, and completely boneheaded. Oh, and it just happens to say what his political masters want to hear.

title: Blade Runner 2049 Sputters at the Domestic Box Office
description: LOS ANGELES  The expensive science-fiction sequel Blade Runner 2049 collapsed at the North American box office over the weekend, taking in $31.5 million, or roughly 30 percent less than analysts had expected, as younger audiences and women failed to materialize in sizable numbers.

description: On Oct. 15, the Trump administration will for the third time have to decide whether or not to certify that my country, Iran, is complying with Joint Comprehensive Plan of Action  the nuclear deal that was reached in 2015 between Iran and the five permanent members of the U.N. Security Council plus Germany.

title: A Farewell and Other Dramas at New York City Ballet

It opens with a shot of Henry Cavills Man of Steel  who sacrificed his life last year in Batman v. Superman: Dawn of Justice  appearing in a dream to his love interest, Lois Lane (Amy Adams). Later, after scenes of apocalyptic destruction and attacks by winged creatures, Batman (Ben Affleck) growls of his former foe: The world needs Superman.

And the restaurants lively owner, Jeff Klein, worked the room as he normally does, pausing to schmooze here and shake an important hand there.

As soon as I read that page, I knew Id give Ms. Jahrens memoir to my friend, a cheerfully profane biology major. When I finished reading Wild, Cheryl Strayeds memoir about hiking and grieving, I bought two copies: one for a friend who is an intrepid solo traveler, and one for my mother, who lost her own mother too young.

description: No corrections appeared in print on Monday, October 9, 2017.

title: Odell Beckham Jr. Is Injured as Giants Season Keeps Spiraling
description: EAST RUTHERFORD, N.J.  The fan in Lot G10 outside MetLife Stadium was not taking any chances, not with these Giants, in this calamitous year, when a full month had already frittered away without a win.

title: Battered by the Dodgers, Diamondbacks Turn to Plan Z  Zack Greinke
description: LOS ANGELES  Zack Greinke sat at the far end of the visiting clubhouse at Dodger Stadium on Saturday night and used his shiny silver suitcase, which was not much bigger than the strike zone, as a footstool. While sipping water from a bottle, Greinke drank in the scene as one teammate after another was encircled by reporters.

title: In a Season of Monsters, Gulf Coast Feels Lucky All It Got Was Nate
description: BILOXI, Miss.  As Hurricane Nate cut a path through the central Gulf Coast overnight with roaring winds and a rush of storm-surge flooding, a limb snapped from a tree and landed on the windshield of Terry Gentrys convertible, cracking the glass and bending the hood.

title: McGruff the Crime Dog, Outliving His Creator, Fights On
description: Jack Keil had the slogan first. He wrote six words  Take a bite out of crime  on the back of an envelope in a Kansas City airport lounge.

title: Harvey Weinstein Is Fired After Sexual Harassment Reports
description: The Weinstein Company fired its co-founder Harvey Weinstein on Sunday, after a New York Times investigation uncovered allegations that he had engaged in rampant sexual harassment, dealing a stunning blow to a producer known for shaping American film and championing liberal causes.

title: Anti-Semitisms Rise Gives The Forward New Resolve
description: The Forward has chronicled the experiences of Jews in the United States for 120 years. Initially published as a Yiddish-language lifeline for those who fled hatred and strife in Europe, in recent years it had to work harder to stay relevant to a community now largely assimilated, finding new stories to tell about transgender rabbis, the challenges of interfaith marriage and even the secret Jewish history of The Who.

title: Dove Drops an Ad Accused of Racism
description: In a Facebook ad for Dove body wash, a black woman removes her brown shirt and  voil! Underneath is a white woman in a light shirt.

title: Dusty Baker Is Back at Wrigley Field, Still Looking for a Ring of His Own
description: CHICAGO  Dusty Baker has managed almost 1,800 games since that fateful night, so many years ago, when ghosts still haunted Wrigley Field and played their cruelest trick. The Chicago Cubs banished them forever last autumn, finally capturing a World Series title after more than a century of anguish. In the end, perhaps, the torment of waiting made the triumph even sweeter.

title: Russians in Silicon Valley Cant Shake Hackings Shadow
description: SAN FRANCISCO  Pavel Cherkashin, a Russian investor based in this city, thought he had the perfect name for a Catholic church that he is spending $11.5 million converting into a tech palace. It would be called Hack Temple.

title: Quotation of the Day: In Storm-Filled Season, Hurricane Nate Is Greeted With Relief
description: Everyones safe. Just a few pumpkin casualties.

title: For Disneys Iger, an Unlikely Political Turn
description: BEVERLY HILLS, Calif.  Before the Trump presidency, who could have imagined that the Walt Disney Company would find itself at the fiery center of the American political debate?

title: Greg Bird Preserves Yankees Season, Toppling the Indians With a Lone Blast
description: Greg Bird has long carried himself with a poise that belies his years. His high school teammates joked that he was 16 going on 40, asking him when he arrived for early-morning practices if he had already had his morning coffee and checked his stock portfolio.

title: The Deuce Season 1, Episode 5: The Way It Is
description: This weeks episode opens with a fake-out. When we hear the command Order up over a greasy-spoon breakfast tray, we assume the episode is starting at Leons, which serves as a kind of home base for pimps and prostitutes at the beginning of the day. (Or, more likely, the end of the night, given the hours they keep.) But, in fact, were in a restaurant in Darlenes North Carolina hometown, and Darlene is holding court with her old friends, who are calling her by her real name, Donna. The story shes selling is a powerful one: Shes come back from New York City a more glamorous and confident woman. Shes got a man whos taking care of her. They, too, can leave their humdrum lives behind and take a bite out of the Big Apple.

title: The Republicans Guide to Presidential Etiquette
description: Republicans used to care a whole lot about how a president comported himself. Here is what they now condone.

title: S.N.L. Prepped Jokes About Harvey Weinstein, Then Shelved Them
description: The downfall of Harvey Weinstein would seem like obvious grist for TVs late-night comedy shows. Mr. Weinstein was facing three decades worth of allegations that he sexually harassed women; on Sunday, his own film studio fired him. The story seemed to parallel those of other powerful men who were confronted with numerous accounts of sexual misdeeds, including Bill OReilly, Roger Ailes and President Trump  all of whom were widely pilloried in the monologues of the late-night hosts and on shows like Saturday Night Live.

title: Natural Wine Movement Finds a Lively Hub in Copenhagen
description: In a wine shop called Rodder & Vin in the Norrebro neighborhood, two men were talking about natural wine. They sounded like music geeks in a record shop discussing who was a better frontman for AC/DC. They werent just talking about sommeliers and natural winemakers, but particular sommeliers and importers and their effect on Copenhagens flourishing natural wine scene.

title: Che Guevaras Fiery Life and Bloody Death
description: Fifty years ago, the news spread rapidly around the world: Che Guevara was dead, again, and this time, it seemed likely to be true.

title: Execution Still Haunts Village, 50 Years After Che Guevaras Death
description: LA HIGUERA, Bolivia  Irma Rosales, tired after decades of tending her tiny store, sat back one morning with a box full of photos and remembered the stranger who was shot in the local schoolhouse 50 years ago.

title: Qatar Has a World Cup Date. It Still Needs a World-Class Team.
description: DOHA, Qatar  On the sideline of a grass soccer field a few hundred yards from the recently renovated Khalifa International Stadium, Bora Milutinovic is receiving a stream of well-wishers in four languages. Milutinovic, who has taken the national teams of five countries to the World Cup, shakes hands with dozens of people, seamlessly switching among Serbian, Spanish, German and English, as a match begins in front of him.

description: The Islands and the Whales examines the debate around a controversial, centuries-old tradition. And Valor is the latest military drama to hit the small screen this fall.

description: BOSTON  The Cleveland Indians had swept the Boston Red Sox in a division series last year and now, on Sunday afternoon at Fenway Park, the Houston Astros were seven innings from doing the same.

title: After Las Vegas Shooting, a Tight-Lipped Sheriff Faces a Maddening Case
description: LAS VEGAS  In nearly 30 years with the Las Vegas police, Joseph Lombardo has helped defuse an armed standoff between federal agents and local ranchers, struggled to contain a spike in homicides and defended his officers against accusations of using excessive force against a professional football player.

title: Before Derailments at Penn Station, Competing Priorities Led to Disrepair
description: Amtrak officials knew for years that they would have to replace large sections of deteriorating track in Pennsylvania Station in New York City. As engineering crews applied short-term fixes to rows of rotted ties, crumbling concrete and eroded steel, some of their managers repeatedly warned of the growing need to address underlying problems.

title: How France Shaped Walker Evanss American Vision
description: Walker Evans built his reputation on chronicling Americas out-of-the-way places and people.

title: Attacking Media as Distraction
description: President Trump keeps hammering away at the media, in part because of his own watch-too-much, read-too-little inclinations, but also because he needs a foil, now that hes not actively locked in an election battle.

title: Why Corporate Tax Cuts Wont Create Jobs
description: Foster City, Calif.  The tax cut framework recently put forward by President Trump relies on a central claim: that reducing taxes on corporations and wealthy individuals will open the wellsprings of entrepreneurship and investment, turbocharging job growth and the American economy. Were this premise true, reasonable people might countenance giving a vast majority of benefits to the very rich, as Mr. Trumps plan does, in exchange for greater prosperity for all. But its not.

title: Tearing Down Statues of Columbus Also Tears Down My History
description: As I watched the disturbing events unfold in Charlottesville, Va., several weeks ago, I knew our Italian-American community would soon be called to once again address questions about statues celebrating Christopher Columbus and the day named in his honor. We would once again be called on to defend Columbus against efforts to remake his day into Indigenous Peoples Day.

title: Our Polluted Senses
description: People who live in densely populated areas are all too familiar with sensory bombardment  the continuous light and noise pollution that has come to practically define the urban environment. Over time, most city dwellers grow so accustomed to this intense stimulation that they cease to notice it. Their perceptual thresholds, we might say, shift upward.

title: A Health Care Plan Thats Universal and Bipartisan
description: After the collapse of Republican efforts at one-party health care reform, many Democrats have embraced Senator Bernie Sanderss Medicare for All proposal. Few liberals would object to this single payer plan if it could be enacted with a magic wand, but the political realities of getting it through Congress are daunting.

title: Gary Cohn and Steven Mnuchin Risk Their Reputations
description: Gary Cohn and Steven Mnuchin arrived in Washington this year after long, successful careers in business.

title: I Miss the Old Megyn Kelly
description: We didnt know it then, but August 2015 was a more innocent time. Donald Trump was still a punch line, Hillary Clinton was poised to become the first female president, and Megyn Kelly was still an uncompromising, unapologetic, take-no-prisoners Fox News rebel. As of last week, Donald Trump is president, Hillary Clinton is an also-ran, and you can catch Megyn Kelly on her new NBC program, Megyn Kelly Today, where she performs each morning as some horrific bizarro version of her former self.

title: How France Shaped Walker Evanss American Vision
description: From grizzled cotton farmers to quiet small-town buildings and roadside stands, Walker Evans built his reputation on chronicling Americas out-of-the-way places and people. And while he was a prodigious chronicler of vernacular American culture, his own roots were hardly common. Born Walker Evans III, the scion of a prominent family, he grew up in privilege, attending Phillips Academy and then Williams College, dropping out after one year.

title: Which Classroom Setting Suits You?
description: We visited three third-grade math classes to see different environments at work: Montessori, Waldorf and public education.

description: SANTA MONICA, Calif.  Stephen Miller had their attention. That was reason enough to keep going.

description: WASHINGTON  Two weeks before Robert McCoy was to be tried for a triple murder, his lawyer paid him a visit. It was the summer of 2011, and the two men met in a holding cell in a Louisiana courthouse. Mr. McCoy, who was facing the death penalty, told his lawyer he was innocent.

description: GREATER GOTHAM A History of New York City From 1898 to 1919 By Mike Wallace Illustrated. 1,182 pp. Oxford University Press. $45.

description: CAIRO  The girl did not know whether it was night or day when she plotted her escape from a house in Yemen. Her husband had locked the girl in a windowless room.

title: Wall Street Firms Gambled on Puerto Rico. Theyre Losing.
description: A few days after Hurricane Maria leveled Puerto Rico, John A. Paulson, the billionaire hedge fund manager, boarded his companys 23-seat Bombardier jet and flew to San Juan.

description: For an unobtrusive piece of furniture, a night stand says a lot about its owner.

description: This weeks properties are in South Riverdale and Leslieville.

description: Sluggish and understocked were some of the words brokers used to describe the Toronto real estate market this week. Though they are relieved the housing bubble has burst and the market is balancing out, the city has yet to see its usual fall flurry of homes being put up for sale.
