Chris Filstrup, the father of the bride who obtained a temporary authorization to perform a marriage in Washington, officiated, with assistance from Juan Prawda, the father of the groom.

title: Naomi Schwartz, Ryan East
description: Naomi Beth Schwartz and Ryan Cooper East are to be married Oct. 22. Rabbi Alexander R. Braver is to officiate at the Lake House at Bulow, an events space on Johns Island in South Carolina.

title: Lianne Epstein, Daniel Jacobs
description: Lianne Newman Epstein and Dr. Daniel Ian Jacobs were married Oct. 21 at the Henry Morrison Flagler Museum in Palm Beach, Fla. Rabbi Steven Stark Lowenstein officiated.

title: Aisha Elston-Wesley, Michael Novasky
description: Aisha Cheri Elston-Wesley and Michael Robert Novasky were married Oct. 21 at the New York City Bar Association in New York. Mariana Hernandez, a friend of the bride who became a Universal Life minister for the event, officiated.

title: Danielle Traub, Mathew Yurow
description: Danielle Sara Traub and Mathew Samuel Yurow are to be married Oct. 22 at Long View Gallery, an event space in Washington. Rabbi Mark Kula is to officiate.

title: SaraJane Lieb, Marc Simon
description: SaraJane Lieb and Marc Howard Simon were married Oct. 21. Cantor Howard M. Stahl officiated in the New York Botanical Garden in the Bronx.

title: Lizabeth Bell, Samuel Schlussel
description: Lizabeth Anne Bell and Samuel Schlussel are to be married Oct. 22 at the Gardens at Elm Bank, an event space in the Massachusetts Horticultural Society in Wellesley, Mass. Rabbi Matthew V. Soffer is to lead the ceremony.

title: Morgan Sarner, Trevor George
description: Morgan Collins Sarner and Trevor James George were married Oct. 21 in New York. Rabbi Steven J. Meltz officiated at the Pierre hotel.

title: Caragh Fisher, Jeffrey OConnor
description: Caragh Eileen Fisher and Jeffrey James OConnor were married Oct. 21 in New York. The Right Rev. Dean E. Wolfe performed the ceremony at St. Bartholomews Episcopal Church, where he is the rector.

title: Taylor Kline, Mark Samburg
description: Taylor Louise Kline and Mark Benjamin Samburg were married Oct. 20 in a self-uniting ceremony at their home in Washington. Later in the day, D. James Greiner, a professor at Harvard Law School, led a ceremony at River Farm in Alexandria, Va.

title: Alexandra Rolnik, Brandon Sternberg
description: Alexandra Lindsay Rolnik and Brandon Scott Sternberg were married Oct. 21 by Rabbi Clifford Kulwin at the Stone House at Stirling Ridge in Warren, N.J.

title: Rebecca Martin, Jared Lander
description: Rebecca Emily Martin and Jared Paul Lander are to be married Oct. 22 by Rabbi Joshua Gruenberg at Congregation Beth El in Yardley, Pa.

title: Alyson Rosenfeld, James Clark
description: Alyson Leigh Rosenfeld and James Weaver Clark were married Oct. 20. Rabbi Molly Karp officiated at the Highlands Country Club in Garrison, N.Y.

title: Keiko Tokunaga, David Wolf
description: Keiko Tokunaga and David Lincoln Wolf were married Oct. 16 by Joey Tai, a staff member of the New York City Clerks office, at the Manhattan Marriage Bureau. On Oct. 15, Jennifer S. West, a close friend of the bride, led the couple in their vows at Linden Terrace of Fort Tryon Park in Manhattan.

title: Isha Dandavate, A.J. Renold
description: Isha Uday Dandavate and Alexander Joseph Renold are to be married Oct. 22 at the Shakespeare Garden in Golden Gate Park in San Francisco. Marc-Andr Renold, an uncle of the groom who was deputized as a temporary officiant by San Francisco County, is to officiate.

title: Ronnie Sykes, Michael Oliva
description: Ronnie Elizabeth Sykes and Michael Oliva Jr. were married Oct. 21 in Stony Brook, N.Y. The Rev. Farrell Graves, the vicar of All Souls Episcopal Church, performed the ceremony there.

title: Tony Meola, Carey Wagner
description: Tony Meola and Carey Phillip Wagner were married Oct. 21 at the apartment of Claudia Wagner and Don Lebowitz, friends of the couple, in Manhattan. Gary A. Rosa, the family court judge for Delaware County, N.Y., and a friend of the couple, officiated.

title: Virginea Stuart, Kevin Gibson
description: Virginea Stuart and Dr. Kevin Fitzgerald Gibson were married Oct. 16 in the South Beach section of Miami Beach, Fla. The Rev. Joaquin Perez, a priest affiliated with the Old Catholic Church, performed the ceremony.

title: Whats on TV Sunday: James Bond and The Jellies
description: Watch the premiere of a Tyler, the Creator, animated series. Jamie and Claire reunite on Outlander.

title: Iraqi Forces Overpower Kurds, but Public Relations Battle Rages
description: BAGHDAD  Military operations in Iraq this past week were one-sided, with Iraqi government forces using superior numbers and firepower to reclaim disputed areas that had been controlled by separatist Iraqi Kurds since 2014.

title: Knicks Falter in Second Half and Lose Home Opener to the Pistons
description: For the first half of their home opener on Saturday night, the new-look Knicks appeared to be onto something. They thundered to a 21-point lead against the Detroit Pistons that stood at 13 when the second quarter ended. The many Knicks fans in attendance had reason to feel just a tiny bit more optimistic about the challenging season ahead.

title: Ride a Weather Balloon Into (Near) Space
description: Take a trip into the stratosphere on one of NOAAs weather balloons. It rises 21 miles into the sky collecting data before bursting and falling back to Earth.

title: Homes That Sold for Around $600,000
description: 9 Barrow Street, No. 3H, Greenwich Village

title: The Aftermath of War, Seen Through Photographers Eyes
description: When Carol McCusker was designing the photography show Aftermath: The Fallout of War  America and the Middle East, she wanted powerful photographs that expanded the notions of individuals when they are considering warfare.

title: Nandipha Mntambos Journey From Taxidermy to Art
description: JOHANNESBURG  Unlike many professional artists who know from an early age that art is their calling, Nandipha Mntambo never thought seriously about it as a future profession.

title: Catalonia, John Kelly, Donald Trump: Your Weekend Briefing
description: Here are the weeks top stories, and a look ahead.

title: Behind Astros Victory, McCullerss Killer Instinct and a Fathers Advice
description: HOUSTON  It felt like the beginning on Saturday night at Minute Maid Park, the arrival of a new force on the World Series stage. The Houston Astros are back, for the first time in a dozen years, and they want to stay awhile.

title: The Islamic State: From Insurgency to Rogue State and Back
description: A look at what the Islamic State controlled at different stages of its military dominance.

title: Japan Election Vindicates Shinzo Abe as His Party Wins Big
description: TOKYO  Prime Minister Shinzo Abe of Japan won a commanding majority for his party in parliamentary elections on Sunday, reported NHK, the public broadcaster, fueling his hopes of revising the nations pacifist Constitution.

title: Can a Neighbor Keep Flowerpots on a Fire Escape?
description: Q. I live in a co-op in Morningside Heights. My upstairs neighbors keep plants on their window ledges and fire escape. When they water them, the runoff streams down my windows and into my apartment if the windows are open. I politely asked them to water the plants inside, telling them that the co-ops house rules prohibit personal items on window ledges or fire escapes. I also wrote a letter to the buildings managing agent and the board. But the problem continues. My neighbors are clearly in violation of building rules, but what about city rules?

title: W.H.O. Removes Robert Mugabe as Good-Will Ambassador
description: After days of scathing criticism around the globe for naming Zimbabwes leader, Robert Mugabe, a good-will ambassador for health, the leader of the World Health Organization said on Sunday that he had rescinded the title.

title: Mississippi School Named for Jefferson Davis to Be Renamed for Barack Obama
description: The latest chapter in the countrys continuing reckoning with the legacy of the Confederacy is being written by grade school students.

title: Hundreds of Italys Churches Were Robbed of Artworks. This One Was Recovered.
description: MONTERODUNI, Italy  The recent return to Monteroduni of a 16th-century statue of the archangel Michael  stolen by thieves some 20 months earlier  was a heartfelt affair.

title: Sorting Through All the Laughs Joan Rivers Left Behind
description: The drawers are jammed with jokes typed on 4-by-6-inch cards  52 drawers, stacked waist-high, like a card catalog of a certain comedians lifes work, a library of laughs.

title: Trumps Not Alone. A Lincoln Condolence Letter Stirred Controversy, Too.
description: What exactly is the protocol for American presidents after members of the military are killed or wounded in action?

title: Turbo-Charging His Life After Losing His Mother
description: Atreyal Ransom has a firm handshake. He stands just 5 foot 9, but his presence is commanding. Although he had spent the afternoon instructing children at a community center in Coney Island, Brooklyn, his collared shirt and slacks remained unwrinkled. He was serious.

title: A Presidential Bellwether Is Still Waiting to Start Winning Under Trump
description: TERRE HAUTE, Ind.  Nobody is tired of winning here.

title: The Newseum Is Increasingly Relevant, but Can It Survive?
description: WASHINGTON  The front pages of newspapers telling of the 9/11 attacks are prominently on display at the Newseum here. Sixteen years later, their headlines still scream.

title: What to Cook This Week
description: Sam Sifton emails readers of Cooking five days a week to talk about food and suggest recipes. That email also appears here. To receive it in your inbox, register here. Download the NYT Cooking app here.

title: A Replacement Home Arrives, Little Assembly Required
description: Nancy Fishers replacement home arrived on a truck. In four big pieces.

title: New York Officials Fear Closing of U.S. Lab Combating Biological Threats
description: WASHINGTON  The Department of Homeland Security plans to close a New York-based laboratory that has helped the citys Police and Fire Departments develop systems to detect nuclear and biological threats, a move that some local officials fear could hamper efforts to prevent and respond to terrorist attacks.

title: Titanic Letter Sells for Record Price at Auction in England
description: LONDON  A letter written by an American first-class passenger aboard the Titanic sold on Saturday at auction for 126,000 pounds, a record price for a note written by someone on the ill-fated ocean liner.

title: Cub Scout Is Exiled After Pressing Legislator on Guns and Race
description: When a group of Cub Scouts met with a Colorado state senator this month, they asked her about some of the most controversial topics in the nation: gun control, the environment, race and the proposed border wall between the United States and Mexico.

title: Willing to Do Everything, Mothers Defend Sons Accused of Sexual Assault
description: Four women met late last month at a restaurant in a Twin Cities suburb, where they spoke for hours, so intently their waiter had trouble getting their drink orders.

title: Julien Baker Bravely Confronts Her Traumas and Fears
description: NASHVILLE  A conversation with the singer and songwriter Julien Baker veers quickly toward the philosophical and theological. Music is everything, she said on an October afternoon, in what had begun as an interview about Turn Out the Lights, her second album, which is being released Friday. Evidence of the divine. The possibility of man to be good. The possibility of improving our surroundings and expressing ourselves. All of these things are collapsed together in my mind.

title: Heres What Happened in N.F.L. Week 7
description: After clearing away the fog of a dull Super Bowl rematch, here are our takeaways from N.F.L. Week 7:

title: ISIS Fighters Are Not Flooding Back Home to Wreak Havoc as Feared
description: THE HAGUE  As recently as a year ago, United States and other Western counterterrorism officials feared that a major surge of Islamic State fighters would return home to Europe and North Africa to commit mayhem after being driven out of their strongholds in Mosul, Iraq, and Raqqa, Syria.

title: A Newly Assertive C.I.A. Expands Its Taliban Hunt in Afghanistan
description: WASHINGTON  The C.I.A. is expanding its covert operations in Afghanistan, sending small teams of highly experienced officers and contractors alongside Afghan forces to hunt and kill Taliban militants across the country, according to two senior American officials, the latest sign of the agencys increasingly integral role in President Trumps counterterrorism strategy.

title: Review: 1 Actor, in 8 Roles, Wrestles Nuance From Eugene ONeills Strange Interlude
description: Eugene ONeills soapy saga Strange Interlude was nearly six hours long when it opened on Broadway in 1928, and the audience got only one intermission, long enough for an unhurried dinner. Transport Groups uncut revival, at the Irondale Center in Brooklyn, has a similar running time, but the pace is less punishing: two intermissions and a 30-minute dinner break. After every act or two, the audience gets up and moves to a different set.

title: E.P.A. Cancels Talk on Climate Change by Agency Scientists
description: WASHINGTON  The Environmental Protection Agency has canceled the speaking appearance of three agency scientists who were scheduled to discuss climate change at a conference on Monday in Rhode Island, according to the agency and several people involved.

title: Corruption Trial for Jail Officers Biggest Champion Is Set to Begin
description: For years his power was seemingly unparalleled.

title: Tyler Perrys Boo 2 Is No. 1 Amid a Plethora of Duds
description: LOS ANGELES  A sassy church lady, a group of elite firefighters, an alcoholic detective, some do-gooder Texans and a renegade scientific genius walked into multiplexes on Friday.

title: Xi Jinping Pushes Chinas Rise Despite Friction and Fear
description: BEIJING  No part of the world seems too small, too near or too far for Chinas globe-trotting president, Xi Jinping.

title: Still Waiting for FEMA in Texas and Florida After Hurricanes
description: HOUSTON  Outside Rachel Robertss house, a skeleton sits on a chair next to the driveway, a skeleton child on its lap, an empty cup in its hand and a sign at its feet that reads Waiting on FEMA.

title: Review: After a Decade, Martha Argerich Returns to Carnegie Hall
description: Antonio Pappano, the longtime music director of the Royal Opera in London, has absorbed a few lessons from the theater. He knows that casting is critical.

title: A Showdown Brews Between Amazon and Alibaba, Far From Home
description: SINGAPORE  From this concrete warehouse perched on the edge of a potentially vast new market for online shopping, the Alibaba Group of China hopes to beat Amazon one head of lettuce at a time.

title: Tillerson Warns Europe Against Iran Investments
description: RIYADH, Saudi Arabia  Secretary of State Rex W. Tillerson warned Europeans on Sunday not to invest in certain Iranian businesses as the Trump administration considers walking away from the Iran nuclear deal and reimposing sanctions against Iran.

title: Tech Giants Are Paying Huge Salaries for Scarce A.I. Talent
description: SAN FRANCISCO  Silicon Valleys start-ups have always had a recruiting advantage over the industrys giants: Take a chance on us and well give you an ownership stake that could make you rich if the company is successful.

title: Shinzo Abe, Catalonia, Jimmy Carter: Your Monday Briefing
description: Good morning.

title: Heng on Xi Jinpings New Era
description: President Xi Jinping of China opened the Communist Party congress in Beijing with a speech highlighting his successes over the last five years and listing his goals for the next five years. Mr. Xi repeatedly mentioned that China had entered a new era under his leadership.

title: U.S.-Backed Fighters Take Largest Syrian Oil Field From ISIS
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon  United States-backed militia fighters seized Syrias largest oil field from the Islamic State on Sunday, according to the militia, narrowly beating pro-government forces to an area critical to the war-torn countrys economy.

title: McConnell Signals Willingness to Hold Vote on Health Deal if Trump Approves
description: Senator Mitch McConnell of Kentucky, the majority leader, said on Sunday that he would be willing to bring a bipartisan proposal to stabilize health insurance markets up for debate if President Trump signaled his support.

title: Diana Hutchins Angulo, Western Witness to Chinese History, Dies at 98
description: As the daughter of an American diplomat and naval officer, Diana Hutchins Angulo enjoyed a seemingly idyllic childhood abroad, one full of state dinners and horseback-riding lessons and excursions to exotic-seeming markets and historical sites. Only when her mother started incorporating shrapnel into her interior decorating did the teenage Diana begin to fully appreciate that she had a front-row seat to a tumultuous upheaval in China, a period often forgotten in later years as Communism closed off the country.

title: The Chorus of #MeToo From Women
description: To the Editor:

title: Energy Efficiency, and Other Climate Suggestions
description: To the Editor:

title: Trumps Height Bias
description: To the Editor:

title: At BuzzFeed, a Pivot to Movies and Television
description: HOLLYWOOD  On an October morning, Matthew Henick, the head of BuzzFeed Motion Pictures, maneuvered his black Lexus S.U.V. through thick Los Angeles traffic from his home in Silver Lake toward BuzzFeeds new campus, still under construction, in Hollywood.

title: Steve Bannon Vows War on His Own Party. It Didnt Work So Well for F.D.R.
description: WASHINGTON  By the summer of 1938, President Franklin D. Roosevelt had had enough. His own party controlled both houses of Congress, yet the latest elements of his New Deal were stalled. Exasperated by fellow Democrats standing in the way, Roosevelt resolved to push some of them out of office.

title: Review: An Inspiring End to a 6-Month Tour of Monteverdis Operas
description: One might have thought that the singers of the Monteverdi Choir and the players of the English Baroque Soloists, who recently arrived at Alice Tully Hall to perform the three existing operas by Claudio Monteverdi on three nights, would have been exhausted.

title: Robert de Zafra, Who Made Key Findings on Ozone, Dies at 85
description: Robert L. de Zafra, a physicist who helped confirm that the chemicals in some aerosols and refrigerants were responsible for the expanding ozone hole over Antarctica, died on Oct. 10 in Stony Brook, N.Y. He was 85.

title: Hopes Dim for Congressional Russia Inquiries as Parties Clash
description: WASHINGTON  In a secured room in the basement of the Capitol in July, Jared Kushner, President Trumps son-in-law and senior adviser, fielded question after question from members of the House Intelligence Committee. Though the allotted time for the grilling had expired, he offered to stick around as long as they wanted.

title: Trial to Begin for Off-Duty Officer Charged in Fatal Traffic Dispute
description: Opening arguments are scheduled to begin on Monday in the trial of a New York City police officer who shot and killed a motorist in a traffic dispute as he headed home from work last year in Brooklyn.

title: With Literary Support, Xerox Asserts Its Modern Relevance
description: A 111-year-old company has turned to a 5,000-year-old medium to assert its relevance in an ever-changing workplace culture.

title: Turning Tables in Magnitsky Case, Russia Accuses a Nemesis of Murder
description: MOSCOW  The case of Sergei L. Magnitsky, the Russian tax lawyer who was imprisoned in 2008 on false charges and died in jail, began as a tragedy. But now, after years of sanctions, countersanctions, bitter feuds and one noteworthy meeting in Trump Tower, the case seems to be entering the realm of farce.

title: Protesters in Malta Denounce Failure to Protect Killed Journalist
description: VALLETTA, Malta  Outraged by the car-bomb killing last week of Maltas best-known journalist, thousands of people marched through the tiny countrys capital on Sunday, singing patriotic songs and waving signs emblazoned with the last words written by the murdered blogger: There are crooks everywhere you look now. The situation is desperate.

title: He Came Out of Nowhere
description: Dear Diary:

title: Stepped Tower of Ancient Sumer
description: MONDAY PUZZLE  The crossword editor Will Shortz has called this period of time the golden age of puzzles, which makes it especially funny to me that a crossword puzzle then goes ahead and declares six of its own ages. Its very meta, to use a colloquialism, and a decent start to our solving week.

title: Comptroller Wants Paying Rent on Time to Count Toward Credit Score
description: Hundreds of thousands of New Yorkers pay their rent on time every month without seeing those payments counted toward their credit scores, which can be used to determine how much they pay in interest rates on loans or even for cellphone service.

title: Mets Hire Mickey Callaway, Indians Pitching Coach, as Manager
description: In the wake of a disastrous 2017 season, the Mets turned to a far more successful club, the Cleveland Indians, for their new manager. And not surprisingly, the person they have plucked from the Indians was the coach of a pitching staff that had the lowest earned run average in the major leagues this season.

title: Ted Cruz: A Pressure Point for North Korea
description: On Oct. 31, the State Department faces a critical decision in our relations with the Democratic Peoples Republic of Korea. The Iran-Russia-North Korea sanctions bill enacted in August included legislation I introduced that requires the secretary of state to decide whether to relist North Korea as a state sponsor of terrorism within 90 days.

title: Dave Roberts Seeks a Different Shade of Postseason Glory
description: LOS ANGELES  He could have lived a legends life. Dave Roberts knew this. When you take the most celebrated dash through New England since Paul Reveres ride, the afterglow never fades. There are worse ways to spend retirement.

title: De Blasios Five-Point Plan Aims to Reduce Traffic Congestion
description: Half a dozen cars blocked the intersection at 57th Street and Third Avenue in Manhattan on Sunday afternoon at every change of the light, snarling traffic headed uptown. Drivers expressed their emotions in symphonic honks.

title: James Toback and John Besh Face Sexual Misconduct Allegations
description: Two prominent executives  one in the movie industry, the other in the restaurant business  are the latest to face allegations of sexual misconduct.

title: Quotation of the Day: A Missing Archangel Is Returned to Glory
description: Clearly, we cant leave things of value inside the church because there will always be scoundrels around.

title: Italian Regions of Lombardy and Veneto Vote for More Autonomy
description: ROME  The citizens of two northern Italian regions voted overwhelmingly on Sunday in favor of greater autonomy in closely watched referendums that come on the heels of Catalonias tortuous attempts to secede from Spain.

title: We Are Reclaiming Chicago One Corner at a Time
description: CHICAGO  Why is the Trump administration so obsessed with my city? Just last week, Attorney General Jeff Sessions said at a Senate hearing that the murder rate is a cloud over the city.

title: N.Y.C.F.C. Ties at Citi Field but Still Claims Playoff Bye
description: David Villa scored two goals but failed to convert a potentially game-winning penalty kick in the final minutes as New York City F.C., playing a home game on the road at Citi Field, settled for a 2-2 tie against the Columbus Crew on Sunday.

title: Where Internet Orders Mean Real Jobs, and New Life for Communities
description: BETHLEHEM, Pa.  Ellen Gaugler remembers driving her father to the Bethlehem Steel mill, where he spent his working years hauling beams off the assembly line and onto rail cars.

title: The Yankees Have a Consolation Prize: The 2018 Season
description: It has been years since the future of the Yankees has been as clear as it is now. A dynamic core of young talent, centered on the captivating Aaron Judge, is in place. Burdensome contracts  symbols of the checkbook strategy that the Yankees used to rely on to build contenders  are coming off the books.

title: Americas Forever Wars
description: The United States has been at war continuously since the attacks of 9/11 and now has just over 240,000 active-duty and reserve troops in at least 172 countries and territories. While the number of men and women deployed overseas has shrunk considerably over the past 60 years, the militarys reach has not. American forces are actively engaged not only in the conflicts in Afghanistan, Iraq, Syria and Yemen that have dominated the news, but also in Niger and Somalia, both recently the scene of deadly attacks, as well as Jordan, Thailand and elsewhere.

title: Driverless Cars Made Me Nervous. Then I Tried One.
description: On my fourth day in a semi-driverless car, I finally felt comfortable enough to let it stop itself. Before then, Id allowed the car  a Volvo S90 sedan  to steer around gentle turns, with my hands still on the wheel, and to adjust speed in traffic. By Day 4, I was ready to make a leap into the future.

title: Leaders Criticize City Colleges Likely Choice for Next President
description: Describing themselves as extremely disappointed, a group of prominent political, religious and community leaders from Harlem is lodging an unexpected 11th-hour protest against the expected next president of the City College of New York.

title: A Big Week for Earnings, and an Estimate for Economic Growth
description: Heres what to expect in the week ahead:

title: No Corrections: October 23, 2017
description: No corrections appeared in print.

title: New Trailer: Liam Neeson in The Commuter
description: In 2008, Liam Neeson kicked his career into a higher gear when the surprise-hit action movie Taken scored one of the biggest openings ever for a Super Bowl weekend. So its no wonder his latest thriller, The Commuter (due in January) debuted its new trailer during Foxs N.F.L. coverage on Sunday.

title: A Long-Delayed Reckoning of the Cost of Silence on Abuse
description: Bill OReilly and Harvey Weinstein may have come from different ends of the political spectrum, but it turns out they have a lot in common.

title: In Catalonia Crisis, Shared Blame for a Difficult and Undesirable Situation
description: BARCELONA  The standoff over Catalonias independence drive has now reached a sobering moment for Spain with the central governments announcement this weekend that it would take the drastic step of removing the regions secessionist leaders.

title: Trumps Boogeymen? Women!
description: Donald Trump has a particular taste for the degradation of racial, ethnic and religious minorities and women  and God forbid those identities should overlap  as a way of playing out his personal sense of racial, sexist, and patriarchal entitlement. And as he degrades, he plays to those very same entitlements in the base that elected him.

title: Tesla Plant in China May Be a First
description: BEIJING  Tesla is moving closer to becoming the first foreign car company to have a wholly owned manufacturing operation in China, a deal that would test the relationship norms between a foreign automaker and the Chinese government.

title: Justin Timberlake Will Perform in Super Bowl Halftime Show
description: The N.F.L. will revisit its most controversial Super Bowl halftime show by having Justin Timberlake, the singer who participated in the infamous wardrobe malfunction of 2004, perform during Super Bowl LII.

title: Outlander Season 3, Episode 6: Time Doesnt Matter
description: In a show in which a single relationship is the crux of the story, every scene that puts the two main characters together carries weight. And since Outlander waited half a season  and 20 years in story time  to bring Jamie and Claire back together, our expectations were through the roof. The success of this episode depends almost entirely on how you feel about their reunion.

title: Treasury Auctions Set for the Week of Oct. 23
description: The Treasurys schedule of financing this week includes Mondays regular weekly auction of new three- and six-month bills and an auction of four-week bills on Tuesday.

title: Star Trek: Discovery Season 1, Episode 6: Whats Up With Sarek?
description: With so many different casts, episodes, shows, movies and novels over the course of several decades, when it comes to Star Trek, there are bound to be violations of canon and plot holes that viewers just have to live with. Some are flagrant (The Enterprise being inexplicably kept from the Earth battle in First Contact) and others less so (Geordi La Forge saying Romulan ale is illegal in Nemesis, even though in Deep Space Nine, an admiral says this is no longer the case.)

title: The Deuce Season 1, Episode 7: Adaptation
description: The world of a David Simon show always comes first. For all the detail invested in the particulars of his characters lives and in the stories that animate them, Simon insists foremost on revealing how they fit into the larger ecosystem. In that respect, his approach is analogous to that of the great documentary filmmaker Frederick Wiseman, who has spent half a century trying to understand human behavior within the context of systems and institutions  like a high school (High School), a mental ward (Titicut Follies) or, more recently, the New York Public Library (Ex Libris). In a Simon show, individual actions can have far-reaching consequences, especially when the decisions of the powerful bear down on the vulnerable.

title: The Walking Dead Season Premiere Recap: A World at War
description: In the portentous Season 8 premiere of The Walking Dead  which kicks off an arc loosely modeled after the All Out War issues in Robert Kirkmans comic book series  disparate clans of warriors organize into stronger coalitions.

title: Why You Cant Think of the Word Thats on the Tip of Your Tongue
description: Welcome to the Smarter Living newsletter. The Smarter Living team emails readers once a week with tips and advice for living a better, more fulfilling life. Sign up here to get it in your inbox every Monday morning.

title: The Seahawks Are a Little Dysfunctional. Theyre O.K. With That.
description: EAST RUTHERFORD, N.J.  The Seattle Seahawks were losing at halftime on Sunday to the hapless, undermanned Giants, and Richard Sherman felt he could hear a plaintive wailing from across the country.

title: Argentinas Leader, Mauricio Macri, Bolstered by Election Results
description: BUENOS AIRES  The governing coalition of President Mauricio Macri of Argentina won decisive victories in key districts across the country in midterm elections Sunday that were widely seen as a referendum on the center-right leaders first two years in office.

title: Pediatricians New Germ-Control Advice: Bring Your Own Toys
description: As cold season and flu season settle in, many parents worry about taking children to the doctors office, and sitting in a waiting room full of sick children.

title: Tragedy and the Will to Live: The Obsessive Art of Charlotte Salomon
description: The details of Charlotte Salomons extraordinary life tend to overshadow her work. Often likened to Anne Frank, the Jewish artist was shaped by the Nazis rise to power and by a suppressed family history of suicide, before her life was cut short at Auschwitz in 1943. She has inspired plays, an opera, a movie and an award-winning French novel, and is the subject of a forthcoming animated film.

Donations Will Help Former Tennis Prodigy Get Career-Saving Surgery

description: Before reading the article:

title: After Fleeing War, They Made an Abandoned Hospital Their Home
description: The hospital, a cardiology institute in Abkhazia, shut down when the Soviet Union broke up in 1991. The following year, war made it a refuge. From 1992 to 1993, Russian-backed Abkhaz rebels pushed out Georgian troops in a proxy war, several dozen people squatted there, like countless others who were forced to flee their homes on the Black Seas east coast.

title: The Misguided Student Crusade Against Fascism
description: This month, a handful of student protesters at the University of Oregon blocked me from delivering my state-of-the-university speech, one of my jobs as president. I had planned to announce a $50 million gift that would fund several new programs. I ended up posting a recorded version of the speech online.

title: Is There a Rational Punishment for My Rapist?
description: Imagine your rapist had been found guilty and sentenced in court. What would you want his sentence to be?

title: How to Keep the Lights On After a Hurricane
description: More than a month after Hurricane Maria devastated Puerto Rico, nearly 80 percent of the island remains without power, and food and water can be tough to find. As we rally to help the survivors and look to rebuild, we owe it to the victims there and in hurricane-ravaged Texas, Florida and elsewhere in the Caribbean to build more resilient infrastructure and prevent and reduce such destruction.

title: How Mao Molded Communism to Create a New China
description: Toward the end of his life, dying of Lou Gehrigs disease, Mao Zedong claimed two achievements: leading the Communist revolution to victory and starting the Cultural Revolution. By pinpointing these episodes, he had underlined the lifelong contradiction in his attitudes toward revolution and state power.

description: MANILA  The Philippines on Monday declared an end to months of fighting against Islamic State-inspired militants in the southern city of Marawi, saying that the last stragglers had been killed in a firefight with the army.

Cuomo announced a state of emergency on the New York City subway and three months after the Metropolitan Transportation Authority instituted an $836 million rescue plan, transit officials said they have slashed the time it takes to respond to emergencies, reducing the average 45-minute response time by about half with an eventual goal of driving that figure down to 15 minutes.

Today, a drive around the city reveals few signs of the catastrophic rainfall that turned highways into rivers and reservoirs into neighborhood-devouring lakes.

description: For relaxing by a fire, almost nothing is cozier than a wingback chair.

title: The Place Beyond the Fire Island Pines
description: COLUMBIA COUNTY, N.Y., a two-hour drive north from Manhattan, is a bucolic vision of rural America  lush rolling farmland, cow-dotted hillsides, stalwart red barns. The Hudson River School artists of the mid-19th century captured the visual splendor of the region, including the English-born painter Thomas Cole, who first encountered upstate New York in 1825 and once remarked that the Hudson for natural magnificence is unsurpassed. Though primarily agricultural, the area has long attracted gentlemen farmers: Over the years, various Livingstons, Rockefellers and Roosevelts have made homes here.

description: Good morning on this pleasant Monday.

description: I will start this column with its conclusion: Riding a bicycle without wearing a properly fitted helmet is simply stupid.

description: Good Monday morning from Andrew Ross Sorkin in Riyadh, Saudi Arabia, and Michael J. de la Merced and Amie Tsang in London. description: LONDON  Driving an old diesel car in London has just gotten a lot more expensive.
