title: One Convicted, One Cleared: Signs of Trouble in Indonesia Courts
description: JAKARTA, Indonesia  Indonesias troubled legal system is again coming under scrutiny, after rulings in two high-profile cases that have alarmed both Western expatriates and local organizations that fight corruption in the countrys judiciary.

title: Iceland Goes to Polls Amid Scandals, Disgust and Distrust
description: REYKJAVIK, Iceland  As Iceland headed to the polls on Saturday to vote for members of one of the oldest Parliaments in the world, the shadow of political scandal clung to the political landscape, fomenting voter distrust and disgust.

title: 796 Irish Children Vanished. Why?
description: For decades, the bones of children lay near a home for unmarried mothers and their babies. It took an amateur historian and the horrific memories of those who had lived there to bring the tragedy to light.

title: Im Icing My Knee and Im Hard Boiling Some Eggs
description: Here are the top 10 comments of the week on our digital platforms, as selected by our readers and the journalists who moderate nearly every comment. Some comments were edited for length and clarity.

title: Where Its Made: Sriracha Hot Sauce
description: Step inside the factory that makes the iconic hot sauce in this 360 tour.

title: Public Shaming and Even Prison for Plastic Bag Use in Rwanda
description: GISENYI, Rwanda  They are sometimes tucked into bras, hidden in underwear or coiled tightly around a smugglers arms.

title: 5 Bargain Destinations for Fall Travel
description: Fall isnt just about pretty leaves for travelers. Those willing to venture overseas could end up with some major savings, according to Hipmunk, the website and app that studies itineraries and other data to reveal affordable travel deals.

title: As Catalonia Crisis Deepens, Many Basques Wary of New Independence Bid
description: GUERNICA, Spain  Deep in the hills of the Basque region, in northern Spain, Luis Iriondo tapped a bridge with his walking stick.

title: The Lost Children of Tuam
description: Ireland wanted to forget. But the dead dont always stay buried.

title: Amazon Key Is a Lot Less Scary Than My Post-1-Click Remorse
description: I recently bought a pair of sneakers online after some browsing. I knew exactly what I was getting, having owned the same model and size before; they just werent available in any neighborhood stores. The sneakers arrived in a few days, and I was satisfied with them.

title: Listen to Dear Sugars: The Other Half of Sexless Relationships
description: Sex-starved, meet sex-hounded. The Dear Sugars inbox was flooded with responses to the two-part episode Sexless Relationships with Esther Perel. In those episodes, the Sugars answered letters from people who are desperate for sexual intimacy with their partners. Many readers asked why we didnt address the other side of sexless relationships: the people who want less sex than their partners.

title: With The Dress That Eats Souls, Toni Dove Erases Boundaries
description: The artist Toni Dove was standing in her roomy TriBeCa loft this year, facing off against a large, menacing figure.

title: Oh, the Things You Can Find at Swanns Illustration Auction
description: When the doors open for the biannual Illustration Art sale at Swann Auction Galleries in New York in December, visitors will be treated to several walls of artwork, organized and ready for bidding.

title: Virtual Reality Gets Naughty
description: In early 2014 Ela Darling, 31, a pornographic actress, recorded her first virtual reality sex scene. She was in a college dorm room at the University of Maryland dressed in an R2-D2 swimsuit and high athletic socks. She sat on a twin bed, next to a wooden desk, and spoke to the camera as if it were a real person. There was no story line and no other actors.

title: Art Galleries Rethink Their Strategies as Art Fairs Proliferate
description: In August 2015, Janine Foeller finally closed her gallery Wallspace, which she had started with Jane Hait 12 years before in Chelsea. It was no longer sustainable, Ms. Foeller said in a recent interview.

title: Is Fall Dead?
description: Daniel Arnold, a photographer known for capturing quirky moments on the street, waits all year for autumn to arrive.

title: Manfred Makes His Choice: Punish Gurriel, but Leave the World Series Alone
description: HOUSTON  As soon as Yuli Gurriel touched his fingers to the edges of his eyes in the Houston Astros dugout on Friday night, stretching his skin to mock the appearance of Yu Darvish, he presented Major League Baseball with a crisis.

title: I Called the Police Last Week: After Weinstein Reports, Women Take Action
description: The Reader Center is a newsroom initiative that is helping The Times build deeper ties with our audience.

title: Will Congress Ever Limit the Forever-Expanding 9/11 War?
description: WASHINGTON  A Navy SEAL, killed alongside civilians in a January raid on a village in Yemen. Another SEAL, killed while accompanying Somali forces on a May raid. And now four Army soldiers, dead in an ambush this month in Niger.

title: The Little-Known Pragmatist Who Is Shaping the Trump Tax Cuts
description: WASHINGTON  Justin Muzinich, a top aide to Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin, was deep into writing the administrations tax plan this fall when he got an email from his high school math teacher imploring him to remember his old lessons and not deliver a giveaway for the rich.

title: Mexicos Record Violence Is a Crisis 20 Years in the Making
description: MEXICO CITY  The forces driving violence in Mexico, which is now on track for its worst year in decades, were first set in motion 20 years ago by two events that were, at the time, celebrated as triumphs.

title: A Proposal That Needed No Rehearsal
description: Alexis Mary Rodda and Kelvin Bryant Dinkins Jr. were married Oct. 28 at the Princeton University Chapel in Princeton, N.J. Lovell Holder, a Universal Life minister and a college friend of the couple, officiated.

title: For the Love of Nothing to Do  and of Sloths
description: Kori Sarabeth Schulman and Paul Calvert Kendrick were married Oct. 28 at Morgan Manufacturing, an event space in Chicago. Cantor Amy Zussman officiated, with Scott Simon, a friend of the couple, taking part.

title: The Apartment Is Great but the Hallway Smells Awful. What Now?
description: Q. My husband and I are looking to buy a new apartment, and we recently saw a fantastic place in a large co-op on the Upper West Side. It had only one problem: As we exited the elevator, we were overwhelmed by a strong camphor smell flooding the hallway. The sellers broker explained that a gentleman who lives on the floor uses mothballs and the building is trying to do something about the odor. What, realistically, can be done about this?

title: Frog and Toad Are Memes
description: We must stop eating! cried Toad, as he ate another.

title: Helicopter Crash Kills U.S. Service Member in Afghanistan
description: KABUL, Afghanistan  An American service member was killed and six others wounded in a helicopter crash south of Kabul, the United States military command in Afghanistan said in a statement on Saturday.

title: Greek Police Arrest Suspect in Letter Bomb Attacks
description: ATHENS  The police in Greece on Saturday arrested a 29-year-old man who is suspected of being involved in a bomb plot that left one of the countrys former prime ministers seriously injured.

title: Catalonias Ousted Leader Calls for Peaceful Defiance
description: BARCELONA, Spain  In a defiant message, Catalonias ousted leader, Carles Puigdemont, called on Saturday for Catalans to unite in peaceful democratic opposition after the Spanish central government took control of the restive region  an act Mr. Puigdemont called premeditated aggression.

title: A Roadshow of Hate: Supremacist Rallies Fueled by Travelers From Afar
description: ATLANTA  The white nationalist and provocateur Richard Spencer had left the University of Florida on Oct. 19 when the days most serious trouble erupted just beyond the campus.

title: In Virginia Governors Race, Immigrants Turnout May Be Key
description: MANASSAS, Va.  Kumar Iyer whipped out his smartphone the other day to eagerly show a photo of himself with Ralph S. Northam, the Democratic candidate for governor. He was thrilled to meet him, he said, and excited to vote for him.

title: Faith Moors 2 Victims of Hurricane Sandy in Lifes Storms
description: The violent wind. The relentless rain. The raging sea.

title: The Catalan Martyr vs. the Spanish Strongman
description: The drama between the Spanish government in Madrid and the pro-independence government in Catalonia, which reached a new stage of tension Friday when the separatist government in Barcelona declared independence, has featured two characters familiar to students of Spanish politics: the martyr and the strongman.

title: To Find the Story of the Lost Children of Tuam, I Needed a Guide
description: What is the compact between the living and the dead? Do we owe the dead a small plot of earth? A gravestone or an urn? A whispered prayer, a spray of flowers, or some other means by which we signal to the great silence that we remember?

title: F.B.I. Agents Faced Arrest and Ruin After Trying to Conceive a Child
description: WASHINGTON  Matthew Litton, a former Army officer and member of the F.B.I.s elite Hostage Rescue Team, choked up as he sat in a courtroom in Virginia earlier this year, questioned by his lawyer about his infertility problems.

title: At Womens Convention in Detroit, a Test of Momentum and Focus
description: DETROIT  Nearly everyone here had a story about where they were in January, the day after President Trump was inaugurated. Some packed into the streets of Washington, in a defiant demonstration against the new leadership and what it would mean for women. Others recalled marching beside grandmothers and daughters in Los Angeles; New York; Tulsa, Okla.; Ann Arbor, Mich.; and elsewhere.

title: Variety: Acrostic
description: VARIETY PUZZLE  As we approach the spookiest holiday of the year, Emily Cox and Henry Rathvon are back to remind us that those noises you hear might not be what they seem. Todays quote is from The Little Minister, the novel by J. M. Barrie, also known as the creator of Peter Pan.

title: Youre a Quadriplegic: A Las Vegas Victim Faces a Hard Reality
description: LOMA LINDA, Calif.  This is your life, the doctor said. Youre a quadriplegic.

title: Trump Unlikely to Name Top Two Fed Officials at Same Time, Mnuchin Says
description: ABU DHABI, United Arab Emirates  President Trump, who has several spots to fill at the Federal Reserve, is expected to nominate its next chairman this coming week but is unlikely to simultaneously tap a vice chairman at the same time, Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin said on Saturday, eliminating one potential twist in a selection process being closely watched on Wall Street.

title: Limit on 401(k) Savings? Its About Paying for Tax Cuts
description: When the benefits adviser Ted Benna first thought up a new type of employee savings plan in 1980, the client he created it for rejected the idea as too risky. After all, no one had previously used the unremarkable section of the tax code called 401(k) to defer paying taxes on money that rank-and-file workers set aside for retirement.

title: North Korea Rouses Neighbors to Reconsider Nuclear Weapons
description: As North Korea races to build a weapon that for the first time could threaten American cities, its neighbors are debating whether they need their own nuclear arsenals.

title: Review: All Lifes a Swirling Proscenium in The Red Shoes
description: The curtain doesnt go up at the start of The Red Shoes. Its already onstage, hanging from a gilded proscenium frame. It doesnt stay still, either. To music that screams of Old Hollywood high drama and suspense, the frame and curtain roll toward the audience like a train threatening a head-on collision.

title: Bad Behavior, Great Art
description: To the Editor:

title: The Misery Filter
description: At Christmas in 2015, the psychiatrist and blogger Scott Alexander wrote a post about his experience treating people in a wealthy, mostly white college town consistently ranked one of the best places to live in the country. Despite being in the sort of place that both the intersectional left and the populist right would reasonably identify as wildly privileged, Alexander wrote, his practice was dominated by people with problems that would seem overwrought if they were in a novel, and made-up if they were in a thinkpiece on The Fragmentation of American Society.

title: Too Many Colleges Flunk Trump 101
description: Every year the popular website Inside Higher Ed adds a few new questions to its annual survey of college admissions officials. This year those questions were inspired by Donald Trump.

title: How We Find Our Way to the Dead
description: I dont believe in ghosts, but I see them all the time. Social media gets spookier every day. Among Facebooks more than 40 million deceased users, an acquaintance who passed away two years ago has a profile page that remains quite active. Dozens of people who knew her post memories and emoji hearts, speaking to the dead woman as if she were only as near or as far as we all are these days  out there somewhere, behind another screen.

title: When You Are Replaceable and He Will Never Be
description: There are a lot of ways to pursue a career in a creative field. One path  that many young people eventually discover  is through the doggy door of a powerful institution.

title: Breast Cancer Is Serious. Pink Is Not.
description: PITTSBURGH  October is Breast Cancer Awareness Month, and I have breast cancer. The country is fully pinked out in support of breast cancer screening and research, and though I know all the pink is meant to make me feel good, to tell me that the entire country has my back, I actually find it profoundly alienating. Pink is not a serious color, though cancer is a very serious disease. Pink is about femininity; cancer is about staying alive.

title: Will Harvey Weinsteins Fall Finally Reform Men?
description: Has America at last reached a turning point on sexual harassment? Watching the events of the past three weeks, one can hope.

title: Trumps Legacy: Damaged Brains
description: President Trumps E.P.A. is fine with children eating food tainted by a pesticide derived from a nerve gas.

title: The Perfect Woman to Paint Michelle Obama
description: In 2016, I photographed the writer Diamond Sharp sitting in the grass in a park in Brooklyn. I asked her to close her eyes, take a deep breath and turn her face to the sun. The photograph illuminated a woman in stillness, surrounded by overgrown plants.

title: Refusing Weinsteins Hush Money, Rose McGowan Calls Out Hollywood
description: In late September, just as multiple women were days away from going on the record with reports of Harvey Weinsteins sexual misconduct, one of his alleged assault victims, Rose McGowan, considered an offer that suggested just how desperate the Hollywood producer had become.

title: Let It Go: Making Peace With Princesses
description: ONCE upon a time, about a month ago, Elsa bewitched my 4-year-old daughter.

title: In Mogadishu, Truck Bomb and Gunmen Kill at Least 23 in Hotel Attack
description: MOGADISHU, Somalia  A truck bomb detonated outside a hotel in Mogadishu, Somalias capital, minutes before gunmen on foot stormed the building on Saturday afternoon, killing at least 23 people and wounding at least 30 others, the police reported.

title: Yes, I Really Am in This Beauty Pageant
description: My parents raised me to believe I could do and be anything. They say they dont regret it. I grew up alongside four brothers, watching movies where the hilarious lovable underdog wins in the end.

title: Obama Expected to Report for Jury Duty in Illinois Next Month
description: First he wore dad jeans. Then he cried after dropping off his older daughter at college. Now, in the latest evidence that some experiences are universal, even for former presidents of the United States, Barack Obama has been summoned for jury duty in Illinois, his home state  and he plans to show up, a court official said.

title: James Madisons Lessons in Racism
description: When we think about the framers of the Constitution and how they handled the issue of race, we conjure up the extremes: the hypocrites and the heroes. At one end is Thomas Jefferson, who wrote that all men are created equal but believed Africans were inferior and fathered children with an enslaved woman. At the other end is Alexander Hamilton, who, at least as depicted by admirers like the biographer Ron Chernow and the playwright Lin-Manuel Miranda, was an ardent abolitionist.

title: Who Ordered Killing of Honduran Activist? Evidence of Broad Plot Is Found
description: MEXICO CITY  It was just before midnight when two men kicked in the door to Berta Cceress house in the small Honduran mountain town of La Esperanza. Moving past the kitchen, one of them opened the door to her bedroom and fired six shots. She died moments later.

title: Violence Flares and Tensions Rise After Kenya Presidential Vote
description: NAIROBI  Tensions were on the rise in western Kenya and parts of Nairobi amid confusion and discrepancies surrounding the countrys repeated presidential election this past week, with deadly violence breaking out in some areas.

title: De Blasio Says Donor Who Claimed Money Bought Access Is a Liar
description: Mayor Bill de Blasio on Saturday dismissed the court testimony of a campaign contributor who said he bought access to City Hall with his donations, calling the man a liar. But the mayor said he could not recall crucial details of their association, such as whether he had asked the man to intervene on his behalf with a powerful labor leader, and he refused to provide a full accounting of their meetings and telephone contacts.

title: Review: Onstage Jay-Z Forgoes Distractions, Drilling Down to the Message
description: ANAHEIM, Calif.  Since the mid 1990s, Jay-Z has set the bar high, often unattainably so, for hip-hops ambition and triumphalism. Age can remake you, though. In June, Jay-Z released 4:44, his 13th studio album, his first in four years, and his first in a decade that didnt use maximalism and bombast as its guideposts. Instead, it was an excavation, and a contemplative, measured one at that. Jay-Z is 47 now, and the time has come to look inward.

title: Going Off Script
description: SUNDAY PUZZLE  Do you like movie trivia? Ross Trudeau returns to test our mettle.

title: Trump Unworried About What Former Aides Will Tell Mueller, Lawyer Says
description: WASHINGTON  President Trump is confident that neither his former campaign chairman nor his former national security adviser has damaging information about him to offer prosecutors, a White House lawyer told The New York Times.

title: Texans Owner Bob McNair Apologizes Again and Meets With His Team
description: Trying to tamp down a billowing controversy, the Houston Texans owner Bob McNair on Saturday apologized for the second straight day for a comment he made at a recent meeting with fellow N.F.L. owners that was widely interpreted as demeaning to players.

title: Quotation of the Day: Paralyzed in Las Vegas, and Joining the Ranks of the Forgotten Victims
description: Why would one person do something like this to people? If youre that unhappy with your life, why hurt others?

title: Donald Trump and Michael Moore Quarrel Over Broadway Show
description: Well, Michael Moore succeeded in getting the presidents attention.

description: Chelsea Janette Weinberg and Jesse David Sivkin Lirtzman were married Oct. 28 at Union Station in Washington. Rabbi Cantor Annie Bornstein officiated.

description: Allison Marie Nagle and Dennis Francis Adams III were married Oct. 28 by the Rev. Erik Larsen at Trinity Episcopal Church in Newport, R.I.

description: Leah Rachel Field Sandals and Alexander Evan Gessner were married Oct. 28 at the Barnes Foundation, the art museum in Philadelphia. They were wed under Pennsylvanias self-uniting marriage statute; Ilona Logvinova, a friend of the couple, led the ceremony.

description: Elizabeth Amanda Newman and Scott Kent Warren were married Oct. 28 at the Elkridge Furnace Inn, a restaurant and events space in Elkridge, Md. Corinne E. Warren, the grooms sister, officiated, having joined the American Marriage Ministries in order to preside at the event.

title: Allison Barofsky, Andrew Sender
description: Allison Elaine Barofsky and Andrew Jeffrey Sender were married Oct. 28. Rabbi Peter E. Kasdan officiated at the Park Chateau Estate, an events space in East Brunswick, N.J.

description: Sarah Allen Tucker and Christian Michael Piccolo were married Oct. 28 at the Hermann-Grima House, a museum in New Orleans. Audrey R. Evans, a friend of the brides family and a retired judge of the United States Bankruptcy Court in Arkansas, who became a Universal Life officiant for the event, led the ceremony.

description: Lindy Sage Wisotsky and Joshua Harris Dembowitz are to be married Oct. 29 in Woodbury, N.Y. Cantor Ralph Nussbaum is to officiate at the Woodbury Jewish Center, with assistance from Rabbi Jordan Soffer, a brother-in-law of the groom.

description: Courtney Zinat Khademi and Teddy John Steinkellner were married Oct. 28 at the Los Angeles Museum of Natural History. Emma Steinkellner, a sister of the groom who became a Universal Life minister for the occasion, officiated.

description: Dr. Monica Gowri Enamandram and Dr. Emir Singh Sandhu were married Oct. 28 at the Bently Reserve, an events space in San Francisco. Daniel G. Randolph, a friend of the couple who was designated a deputy marriage commissioner for the occasion by San Mateo County, officiated.

title: Annabel Schlossberg, George Lui
description: Annabel Meehan Schlossberg and George Kingman Lui were married Oct. 28 at the Queens Botanical Garden in Flushing. Jonathan Ku, a friend of the couple who became a Universal Life minister for the event, officiated.

title: Shannon Guy, John Errico
description: Shannon Burke Guy and John Anthony Errico were married Oct. 28 in Moonachie, N.J. Justin Stone, a friend of the couple who became a Universal Life minister for the event, officiated at the Graycliff, an events space.

title: Kenzie Biggins, Johan Jean
description: Kenzie Madelyn Biggins and Johan Jean were married Oct. 28 at Savannah College of Art and Design in Atlanta. The Rev. Dennis D. Patterson Jr., an Episcopal priest, led the ceremony.

title: Sacha Haworth, Will Mitchell
description: Alexandra Louise Haworth and Will Ellis Mitchell were married Oct. 28 at the Woodend Audubon Sanctuary and Mansion in Chevy Chase, Md. Mark S. Grindy, a friend of the couple who became a Universal Life minister for the event, officiated.

title: Ashley Boone, Arthur Williams III
description: Ashley Danielle Boone and Arthur Williams III were married Oct. 28 at the Cadre Building, an events space in Memphis. The Rev. Eric J. Boone, an African Methodist Episcopal pastor and the brides father, officiated.

title: Cody Bellinger Breaks Through, Leading the Dodgers Past the Astros
description: HOUSTON  It took until the World Series, but Los Angeles Dodgers first baseman Cody Bellinger had finally begun to resemble the rookie that he actually is. He had gone from looking precocious at the plate to besieged, a 22-year-old who was suddenly hitting like one.

title: Whats on TV Sunday: Charlie Brown and a Fats Domino Documentary
description: Linus continues to search for the Great Pumpkin. Two prestige TV dramas present their season finales.

title: Malis Desert Elephants, on Edge of Annihilation, Get a Fighting Chance
description: DOUENTZA, Mali  Malis elephants, Africas northernmost herd and adapted to life in the countrys harsh desert, were in desperate need of protection.

title: Ever Heard of Burmese Sushi Counters? Youve Probably Been to One
description: OCEANSIDE, Calif.  Gam Aung, a Burmese refugee, had never heard of sushi before arriving in the United States three years ago. Today, he makes six figures a year hawking creations like the Dazzling Dragon roll and the Mango Tango.

title: Rebuilding a Dam in Puerto Rico
description: A massive effort is underway to repair a nearly three-foot crack in the Guajataca Dam created during Hurricane Maria.

title: Homes That Sold for Around $450,000
description: 9 Garden Street, Dumont

title: The Battle-Scarred West Wing Veteran Scripting the N.F.L.s Anthem Message
description: In the late 1990s, when the Clinton White House was under siege amid revelations of the presidents affair with Monica Lewinsky and efforts by Congress to impeach him, it fell on Joe Lockhart, then the White House spokesman, day after day to defend his boss.

title: North Korea, Donald Trump, Catalonia: Your Weekend Briefing
description: Here are the weeks top stories, and a look ahead.

title: Next! Dodgers and Astros Are Quick to Pull Pitchers
description: HOUSTON  For decades, the best relievers in the major leagues received a trophy topped by the silver hat of a fireman. The quaint term still flickers, faintly, around baseball. Brandon Morrow mentioned it in the Los Angeles Dodgers clubhouse here late Saturday night.

title: Her Peers Made School Look Easy. Now, With Hard Work, Shes Catching Up.
description: The decision not to complete high school came with deep-rooted stigma. Wendy Genao made the choice anyway.

title: Bedlam Out Here in Arizona After Jeff Flake Departs Senate Race
description: WASHINGTON  Senator Jeff Flakes decision to abandon his 2018 re-election campaign in Arizona has thrown open the Senate race there, exposing deep fissures not only on the Republican side where a nationalist insurgency is gunning for the party establishment but also among Democrats contending with a rising left.

title: A 40-Foot Cross Has Honored War Dead for 90 Years. Is It Unlawful?
description: BLADENSBURG, Md.  Five miles from the United States Supreme Court, a 40-foot-tall World War I memorial in the shape of a cross has stood for nearly a century. Now, it is at the center of a battle over the separation of church and state that may end up on the courts docket.

title: Icelands Independence Party Retains Most Seats After Election
description: Icelands governing conservative Independence Party held off a stiff election challenge from the Left-Green Movement to maintain the most seats in Parliament, results released on Sunday showed.

title: Spain Is a Collection of Glued Regions. Or Maybe Not So Glued.
description: The independence declaration by Catalonias regional Parliament has escalated a longstanding confrontation with the central government of Spain.

title: Outside Anchorage, a Chef Makes the Case for Local Alaskan Cuisine
description: Twenty-three miles south of Anchorage on the Seward Highway, the first glimpse of Froth & Forages turquoise roof comes two mountainside highway curves ahead of the restaurants gravel parking. Though the weathered wood building looks like the barbecue shack it was in a past life, it is now home to a 22-seat restaurant headed up by a chef who wants to prove that a restaurant in south-central Alaska can thrive using local ingredients or, at least, other small local purveyors, instead of goods delivered from, as Alaskans call it, Outside.

title: On the Mainland, a Duty to Help Puerto Rico
description: After a month of silence since Hurricane Maria hit Puerto Rico, Edwin Aponte finally made contact last week with the world beyond his town of Coamo. It came via a Facebook post, a simple check-in from afar that his friends celebrated as if it brought news that they had hit the lottery. Sure, he had no water, power and little food. Nor did he have his apartment, which was flooded.

title: Do You Know Anyone in This 50s Photograph From Ireland?
description: Five children posed for a photograph in Ireland in the early 1950s. The Times is trying to identify them.

title: Tell Us 5 Things About Your Book: Hitler in Los Angeles
description: Adolf Hitler and Joseph Goebbels saw Hollywood as central to their efforts to win over the American public and the world to their cause, Steven J. Ross writes in his new book, Hitler in Los Angeles. Nazis and other fascists in L.A. planned terrorist attacks against Jews and also plotted to kill high-profile Hollywood figures including, according to Mr. Rosss account, Al Jolson, Charlie Chaplin and Samuel Goldwyn. Leon Lewis, one of the founding members of the Anti-Defamation League and a veteran of World War I, recruited fellow military veterans and others to create a spy ring to foil the Nazis plans and counter their influence. Below, Mr. Ross, a professor of history at the University of Southern California, discusses the initial discoveries that led him to dive into the subject, the surprising things he learned about a German previously known as an arch-villain and more.

title: What to Cook This Week
description: Sam Sifton emails readers of Cooking five days a week to talk about food and suggest recipes. That email also appears here. To receive it in your inbox, register here. Download the NYT Cooking app here.

title: Mexicos Day of the Dead Parade Pays Tribute to Quake Victims
description: With faces painted as skulls and bodies made up like skeletons, throngs of performers marched through the streets of Mexico City on Saturday in a Day of the Dead (Da de los Muertos) parade in a country still mourning the nearly 500 people killed in back-to-back earthquakes last month.

title: Five Years After Sandy, Are We Better Prepared?
description: At 8:30 p.m. on a Monday, millions of residents of the most man-made landscape in the United States were reminded how powerless they were against the forces of nature.

title: Tax Cut Fraudulence: The Usual Suspects
description: Stan Collender has a characteristically perceptive discussion of the ongoing budget farce, and invokes Casablanca: round up the usual suspects. That struck me as the perfect motto for what Im seeing, although Im focusing on somewhat different aspects of the farce.

title: N.F.L. Week 8: Texans Kneel, but Seahawks Steal the Show
description: In N.F.L. Week 8, About 40 members of the Houston Texans knelt during the national anthem in protest of their team owners inmates running the prison remarks. In an exciting, back-and-forth game, the Texans lost to the Seattle Seahawks, 41-38.

title: How a 672,000-Gallon Oil Spill Was Nearly Invisible
description: Mention oil spills, and images of birds coated in black slime and a shiny slick on the oceans surface come to mind.

title: Rebuilding After Sandy: One Brick at a Time
description: Five years after New York Citys deadliest hurricane in modern history, rebuilding continues. The Times spoke with residents in New York and New Jersey whose lives were upended by Hurricane Sandy on Oct. 29, 2012. Here is how their lives have changed:

title: Trump Tries to Shift Focus as First Charges Reportedly Loom in Russia Case
description: WASHINGTON  Pushing back against the accelerating criminal investigation into his campaigns ties to Russia, President Trump argued on Sunday that its focus should instead be on his 2016 rival, Hillary Clinton, even as the special counsels inquiry was reportedly poised to produce its first indictment.

title: Puerto Rico Cancels Whitefish Energy Contract to Rebuild Power Lines
description: Facing withering criticism from members of Congress and the Federal Emergency Management Agency, the governor of Puerto Rico moved on Sunday to cancel a $300 million contract awarded to a small Montana company to rebuild part of the islands battered power grid.

title: Democrats Attack Tax Bill as a Middle-Class Con Job
description: WASHINGTON  Republicans will pitch their tax bill this week as a gift to the middle class, but Democrats will call it a Trojan horse: a windfall for big business and the rich dressed as a tax cut for workers.

title: Jigsaw Carves Up Clooneys Suburbicon at the Box Office
description: LOS ANGELES  George Clooney served up a comedic drama that gave Paramount Pictures the worst wide-release opening total in its history. Steven Spielbergs production company delivered a military drama that went widely ignored. The Weinstein Company offloaded a horror movie in very limited release and took in a grand total of $742.

title: Afghan Taliban Awash in Heroin Cash, a Troubling Turn for War
description: KABUL, Afghanistan  The labs themselves are simple, tucked into nondescript huts or caves: a couple-dozen empty barrels for mixing, sacks or gallon jugs of precursor chemicals, piles of firewood, a press machine, a generator and a water pump with a long hose to draw from a nearby well.

title: A Canadian Composers Death-Obsessed Search for Connection
description: TORONTO  Death-haunted, drawn to danger and desperate for connection, with his ceremonies in sound charting transitions from life to something beyond it, the Canadian composer Claude Vivier should be the great downer of modern music.

title: Egypt Shakes Up Security Forces After Deadly Ambush of Police
description: CAIRO  Egypt carried out a sweeping reshuffle of its security forces, removing a dozen senior police and military officials from critical posts just a week after an ambush by militants killed at least 16 policemen in the desert outside Cairo.

title: How Do You Stop Bullying? Advertisers Try to Help
description: Back when most of the United States got online via dial-up modem, Monica S. Lewinsky learned how the anonymity of the internet can prompt people to be crude and cruel in a way they never would be in real life. Now she is trying to help others who find themselves the target of vitriol.

title: MetroCards With Barbara Kruger Art Are Coming to New York City
description: Barbara Krugers bold lettering has adorned buses, warehouses, magazine covers, albums and train stations. Her next medium? MetroCards.

title: Forget Washington. Facebooks Problems Abroad Are Far More Disturbing.
description: For months, Facebooks headquarters in Menlo Park, Calif., has been in crisis mode, furiously attempting to contain the damage stemming from its role in last years presidential campaign. The company has mounted an all-out defense campaign ahead of this weeks congressional hearings on election interference in 2016, hiring three outside communications firms, taking out full-page newspaper ads, and mobilizing top executives, including Mark Zuckerberg and Sheryl Sandberg, to beat back accusations that it failed to prevent Russia from manipulating the outcome of the election.

title: Wopo Holup, Who Adorned Public Spaces With Art, Dies at 80
description: Wopo Holup, an artist whose works have been walked past, walked on and touched by countless people in public spaces in New York; Denver; Kansas City, Mo.; and elsewhere, died on Sept 29 in Manhattan. She was 80.

title: Hitch a Ride on de Blasios Coattails? A Brooklyn Democrat Says No Thanks
description: In search of votes less than two weeks before Election Day, John F. Quaglione rapped on the door of a home in Bensonhurst, Brooklyn, with a yard decked out for Halloween. A shirtless man answered.

title: 2 Navy SEALs Under Suspicion in Strangling of Green Beret in Mali
description: WASHINGTON  Navy criminal authorities are investigating whether two members of the elite SEAL Team 6 strangled an Army Green Beret in June while they were in Mali on a secret assignment, military officials say.

title: Review: A Russian Pianist Who Doesnt Play It Safe (Even With Chopin)
description: Through its coveted Perspectives program, Carnegie Hall invites outstanding artists to plan a season-long series of concerts. Most designees think big and go adventurous. At first glance it might seem that the Russian pianist Daniil Trifonov is playing it safe with his Perspectives series this season. Three of his seven programs are focused on Chopin, including the sold-out recital he played on Saturday to kick off the series, titled Hommage  Chopin.

title: Treasury Auctions Set for the Week of Oct. 30
description: The Treasurys schedule of financing this week includes Mondays regular weekly auction of new three- and six-month bills and an auction of four-week bills on Tuesday.

title: Review: Knives in Hens, a Wondrous Drama of the Lust for Language
description: It happens only rarely. But on the occasional random, happy day, you come across a work of art that youve never encountered before, even though its been around for years. And it feels so absolutely essential to your experience that you think, But where have you been all my life?

title: Heng on Japans Parliamentary Elections and Constitution
description: Prime Minister Shinzo Abe of Japan won a majority for his party in parliamentary elections earlier this month, fueling his hopes to change Japans pacifist constitution.

title: Sexual Misconduct in Californias Capitol Is Difficult to Escape
description: SACRAMENTO  There were the demeaning personal chores she said her boss assigned her, like buying a shower curtain and blankets. And there was the time that he appeared at the door of his apartment with his pants open, she said, exposing himself to her when she went to pick him up for a vote.

title: What Virtual Reality Can Teach a Driverless Car
description: SAN FRANCISCO  As the computers that operate driverless cars digest the rules of the road, some engineers think it might be nice if they can learn from mistakes made in virtual reality rather than on real streets.

title: Former Priest Says Revered Colleague Was a Predator
description: Stephen Ryan-Vuotto was 14 and had recently lost his father to lung cancer when a priest in his Greenwich Village parish began inviting him to sleep over at the rectory. His mother was happy, he recalled, because she revered priests.

title: I Dont Want an Independent Catalonia: Rally Backs Unified Spain
description: BARCELONA, Spain  Catalonia residents opposed to independence from Spain took to the streets of Barcelona in large numbers on Sunday but struck a moderate tone, with many saying they felt Catalan and Spanish  and wanted to remain both.

title: In Liberia, an Executive Mansion Fit for a President  and Ghosts, Too
description: MONROVIA, Liberia  Construction crews are hard at work at fixing up this countrys Executive Mansion, the enormous and historic edifice that is supposed to be home to whoever wins the presidential elections.

title: 2 Frenchwomen Accuse Prominent Islamic Scholar of Sexual Assault
description: Amid a recent outpouring by Frenchwomen reporting episodes of sexual harassment and naming their aggressors, two women have accused a renowned Islamic scholar of violent sexual attacks.

description: When constituents wrote to a senator from Tennessee in the 1960s about issues like health care, immigration and racial tensions, they often made the same arguments heard in 2017  sometimes in the very same phrases.

title: World Series 2017: How the Astros Won Game 5, Inning by Inning
description: No lead was safe in a raucous Game 5 of the World Series on Sunday, but the Houston Astros had the advantage of batting last. After nine innings filled with lead changes, the home team put one last run on the board in the 10th to beat the visiting Dodgers, 13-12.

description: BARCELONA, Spain  Agust Colomines, a Catalan civil servant, held up a copy of the decree from Madrid that had fired his boss and all the other leaders in the Catalan regional government.

title: Russia Uses Its Oil Giant, Rosneft, as a Foreign Policy Tool
description: Russia is increasingly wielding oil as a geopolitical tool, spreading its influence around the world and challenging the interests of the United States.

title: The Economy Cant Grow Without Birth Control
description: This month, 41 Democrats introduced a bill with a simple mission: It would undo the Trump administrations recent change to the Affordable Care Act that paves the way for virtually any employer to deny its employees access to contraception without a co-payment. Before President Trumps new guidance, the law required nearly all employers to offer workers health insurance plans that include contraception without cost. But the new rules, effective immediately after the announcement, allow any employer to request that the government let it opt out based on religious or moral objections.

title: In Third Retirement, Martina Hingis Cedes Her Doubles Kingdom
description: Heinz Gnthardt, Martina Hingiss Swiss Fed Cup captain, said he believed she was capable of playing on tour until she was 50 years old.

title: Manhattan Gallerys Squeaking Floor Angers Rodent Lovers
description: There are 70 white mice in individual boxes set like tiles on the floor of a gallery on Manhattans Lower East Side. In clear plexiglass cages, designed to be stepped upon, they peer up underfoot in an exhibition exploring phobia.

title: In Choice of Fed Chairman, Trump Downgrades Deregulation
description: WASHINGTON  President Trumps short list of candidates for Federal Reserve chairman all have this much in common: They do not share his frequently professed passion for financial deregulation.

title: Kurdish Leader Quits, Latest Fallout From Much-Criticized Independence Vote
description: BAGHDAD  The man who led an independence push for the Kurdish region of Iraq for more than a decade announced on Sunday that he would quit as president. The move is the latest fallout from an independence vote that many Iraqi Kurdish leaders now see as a catastrophic blunder costing them their economic and political self-reliance.

title: Astros Make a Routine of the Extraordinary Out at the Plate
description: HOUSTON  Brian McCanns left arm is getting a little worn out, and his catchers mitt is getting strafed by spikes and soiled from the dirt around home plate. For over the course of 14 postseason games this month, his glove has successfully applied the tag to four runners trying to score.

title: Outlander, Season 3, Episode 7: Do as You Must
description: Some episodes of a TV show are built around either a single moment or an emotional journey. Last weeks episode was built around both, anchoring us to the past again and giving us Claire and Jamies reunion. This episode has no time for any such focus, as chaos erupts from every existing subplot, as well as from a few new ones. Outlander: Come for the sweeping romance, stay for the emergency trepanning!

title: Phil Murphy for Governor of New Jersey
description: Who should be the next governor of New Jersey? Thats not even a close call. There is only one choice on the ballot next week who guarantees voters an end to the Chris Christie era, and thats the Democratic candidate, Phil Murphy.

title: Insect Armageddon
description: There is alarming new evidence that insect populations worldwide are in rapid decline. As Prof. Dave Goulson of the University of Sussex, a co-author of a new insect study, put it, we are on course for ecological Armageddon because if we lose the insects, then everything is going to collapse.

title: The Silence of the Democrats
description: A recent speech by George W. Bush made headlines for its pointed criticisms of Donald Trump, but there was something else he said that I found far more compelling. As soon as he finished his thank-yous and his little jokes, Mr. Bush dived immediately into the heart of the crisis confronting Western democracies today:

title: The Deuce Season 1 Finale: Swept Up
description: The first season of The Deuce ends, fittingly, with a screening of Deep Throat, the 1972 box office phenomenon that ushered in the era of porno chic, when hard-core pornography infiltrated theaters and production values rose accordingly. Theres gold in them hills for the gangsters and pornographers that populate Times Square, and perhaps some measure of celebrity, too, given the star treatment Linda Lovelace receives as she ascends to the V.I.P. section. Yet creators David Simon and George Pelecanos, who wrote the episode, surely know the behind-the-scenes story of Deep Throat and how it epitomizes the exploitation and abuse at the heart of the industry. The particulars are not easily sorted out, but Lovelace, under her real name, Linda Boreman, later claimed her husband coerced her into sex work, telling the Meese Commission, Virtually every time someone watches that movie, theyre watching me being raped.

title: The Walking Dead Season 8, Episode 2: The Hazards of Pity
description: In its capacity as a neo-Western, The Walking Dead has always preoccupied itself with the question of what defines the American national character. Appropriately, the eighth season has seen the loosely collected anti-Negan forces  Rick and the Alexandrians, Maggies Hilltop posse and Ezekiels subjects from the Kingdom  merging ranks and organizing themselves into their own makeshift United States. Last weeks episode illustrated the power that comes from cooperative alliances, but this weeks episode examines the flip side of the coin by introducing a little infighting.

title: Are the World Series Balls Too Slick? Some Say Yes
description: HOUSTON  No World Series has had as many home runs through the first four games as this one. Heading into Game 5 on Sunday, the Los Angeles Dodgers and the Houston Astros had smashed 15 of them, putting the teams on pace to break the World Series record of 21, set in 2002.

description: TANGERANG, Indonesia  At the age of 14, Surnah was done with school, and a month ago she took a full-time job packaging fireworks at a new factory near her home. On a good day, she could make about $3.80.

Its exhibitions include one about Japanese architecture from 1945 to the present day, and the recently opened Japanorama, a survey of Japans contemporary art since 1970, on view through March 5.

description: HOUSTON  George Springer, disheveled in his grass-stained, untucked uniform, was exhausted. Brian McCann, sweat still beading on his forehead, stood near his locker, emotionally spent. Joe Musgrove, who seemed as though he might be serious, said he was ready to have a heart attack  several times.

title: Opioids on the Quad

title: Drinks at High-End Hotel Bars  Hold the Booze
description: Renowned hotel bars  the American Bar at the Savoy Hotel in London, for example, or Bemelmans Bar at the Carlyle in New York  are often well-regarded for their innovative cocktails. Today, creative nonalcoholic concoctions are catching on  most notably in London, Paris, New York and Los Angeles. Just dont call them mocktails.

title: Learning French With Flashy, Sassy Christine
description: Like most people, I started studying a second language at the exact worst time in life. Junior high falls just after the period when one might pick up a language easily and right before most people are able to grasp what a valuable skill it is, making it a cruelly perfect sweet spot for frustration. As if dealing with unfamiliar grammar isnt challenging enough, existentialist works like Huis Clos and LEtranger are introduced not long after, in high school  a true philosophy of the absurd.

title: The Book Crunchers
description: The Stanford Literary Lab, founded in 2010 by Franco Moretti and Matthew Jockers, uses computer analysis to detect hidden patterns in literary texts by reading hundreds, and sometimes thousands, of them at a time. [Read more about that work.] Here are a few findings from the new book Canon/Archive, which collects 11 of the labs research pamphlets.

title: Carson Wentz Is Fueling Eagles Hype. Not That Hes Noticed.

title: Sight and Insight in the California Desert
description: On my second evening alone in the California high desert, I realize how much Im looking forward to lighting the glass oil lamp. My home for this scorchingly hot week in June is a one-room cabin without electricity or running water that my host, the artist Andrea Zittel, has purposefully left nearly bare, and Im craving the flames intricate shadow, the only baroque fillip in this spartan interior. As daylight drains from the wide, empty plain outside the uncurtained windows, and the darkness makes the uncanny quiet feel even more silent, I fall into a brief reverie about the human hunger for ornamentation and the expressionlessness of my electric lamps back home. Mundane revelations, perhaps, but insights into the ordinary are the point of living in this spare box tucked into a landscape as strange and sweltering as Venus, with little to occupy me but uninterrupted thoughts about how I conduct every bit of my life, down to the way I brush my teeth or wipe my hands on a dish towel.

Having, temporarily at least, released the muscle tension that aggravates my back and hip pain, I felt like I was walking on air.

title: Managing the Storm of a Toddlers Tantrum
description: Pity the poor parent whose child is throwing a public tantrum. No, dont come up with a list of excellent parenting strategies that youre quite sure would have averted this unhappy scene. And dont use it as an opportunity to deliver a little homily about kids today or parents today and how much better things used to be. Just pity the poor parent, offer to help if you think you can, and otherwise, give everyone some space.

title: Anything Can Happen in Baseball, and Most of It Did in Game 5
description: HOUSTON  The flatbed cart hauling the equipment bags of the Los Angeles Dodgers zipped sharply through the field-level corridors of Minute Maid Park early Monday morning. The driver was in a hurry, and why not? The Dodgers had just blown three leads to the Houston Astros in one of the most frenzied games in World Series history. Home never looked so inviting.

title: South Korea and China End Dispute Over Missile Defense System
description: SEOUL, South Korea  South Korea and China on Tuesday agreed to end a dispute over the deployment of an advanced American missile defense system in the South and to restore their economic and other ties.

title: 10 Places That Define New York City, Reimagined
description: New York is a city of landmarks: world famous skyscrapers, grand monuments and cultural icons. But many of its must-see places each came shockingly close to becoming something completely different, some for better, some for worse. Visiting the sites of these remarkable unbuilt schemes can heighten the enjoyment of touring the things that actually got built. You could see dozens of unbuilt plans at the new Queens Museum exhibition, and in the book Never Built New York (Metropolis Books, 2016). Or roam the city, with these visions in the back of your mind.

title: Star Trek: Discovery Season 1, Episode 7: Party Time
description: This weeks Star Trek: Discovery has a very similar story line to the Star Trek: The Next Generation episode Cause And Effect. In that one, the crew of the Enterprise finds itself in a time loop which only has one ending: the ships destruction. Eventually, they figure it out and find a way to break it, thanks to an advantage that other starships dont have: an android. (Data probably shouldve used future Google to look up the plot for Groundhog Day, but we digress.)

title: Trump Campaign Adviser Met With Russian to Discuss Dirt on Clinton
